Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

properties.name: min_to_charge
properties.description:
The robot will go to charge when its battery fill ratio is less than this.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

properties.name: speed
properties.description: The flying speed of the robot, in tiles/tick.

properties.name: speed_multiplier_when_out_of_energy
properties.description:
Some robots simply crash, some slowdown but keep going. 0 means crash.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

prototypes.name: FlyingTextPrototype
prototypes.description: An upwards flying text that disappears after a certain time (setting [LuaEntity::active](runtime:LuaEntity::active) = false stops the flying and the disappearing.)

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: speed
properties.description: How fast the text flies up. Seems to be tiles/tick.

properties.name: time_to_live
properties.description: Time in ticks this flying-text lasts.

prototypes.name: FontPrototype
prototypes.description: Fonts are used in all GUIs in the game.

properties.name: border
properties.description: Whether the font has a border.

properties.name: border_color
properties.description: The color of the border, if enabled.

properties.name: from
properties.description: The name of the fonts .ttf descriptor. This descriptor must be defined in the locale info.json. Refer to `data/core/locale/_language_/info.json` for examples.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the font.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Size of the font.

prototypes.name: FuelCategory
prototypes.description: Each item which has a fuel_value must have a fuel category. The fuel categories are used to allow only certain fuels to be used in [EnergySource](prototype:EnergySource).

prototypes.name: FurnacePrototype
prototypes.description: A furnace. Normal furnaces only process "smelting" category recipes, but you can make furnaces that process other [recipe categories](prototype:RecipeCategory). The difference to assembling machines is that furnaces automatically choose their recipe based on input.

properties.name: cant_insert_at_source_message_key
properties.description: The locale key of the message shown when the player attempts to insert an item into the furnace that cannot be processed by that furnace. In-game, the locale is provided the `__1__` parameter, which is the localised name of the item.

properties.name: entity_info_icon_shift
properties.description: Shift of the "alt-mode icon" relative to the machine's center.

properties.name: result_inventory_size
properties.description: The number of output slots.

properties.name: source_inventory_size
properties.description: The number of input slots, but not more than 1.

prototypes.name: GatePrototype
prototypes.description: A [gate](https://wiki.factorio.com/Gate).

properties.name: close_sound
properties.description: Played when the gate closes.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: open_sound
properties.description: Played when the gate opens.

properties.name: opened_collision_mask
properties.description: This collision mask is used when the gate is open.

prototypes.name: GeneratorEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [portable fusion reactor](https://wiki.factorio.com/Portable_fusion_reactor). Provides power in equipment grids. Can produce power for free or use a burner energy source.

properties.name: burner
properties.description: If not defined, this equipment produces power for free.

properties.name: power
properties.description: The power output of this equipment.

prototypes.name: GeneratorPrototype
prototypes.description: An entity that produces power from fluids, for example a [steam engine](https://wiki.factorio.com/Steam_engine).

properties.name: burns_fluid
properties.description: If set to true, the available power output is based on the [FluidPrototype::fuel_value](prototype:FluidPrototype::fuel_value). Otherwise, the available power output will be based on the fluid temperature.

properties.name: destroy_non_fuel_fluid
properties.description:
This property is used when `burns_fluid` is true and the fluid has a [fuel_value](prototype:FluidPrototype::fuel_value) of 0.

This property is also used when `burns_fluid` is false and the fluid is at default temperature.

In these cases, this property determines whether the fluid should be destroyed, meaning that the fluid is consumed at the rate of `fluid_usage_per_tick`, without producing any power.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: How much energy the generator produces compared to how much energy it consumes. For example, an effectivity of 0.5 means that half of the consumed energy is output as power.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description: This must have a filter if `max_power_output` is not defined.

properties.name: fluid_usage_per_tick
properties.description: The number of fluid units the generator uses per tick.

properties.name: max_power_output
properties.description:
The power production of the generator is capped to this value. This is also the value that is shown as the maximum power output in the tooltip of the generator.

`fluid_box` must have a filter if this is not defined.

properties.name: maximum_temperature
properties.description:
The maximum temperature to which the efficiency can increase. At this temperature the generator will run at 100% efficiency. Note: Higher temperature fluid can still be consumed.

Used to calculate the `max_power_output` if it is not defined and `burns_fluid` is false. Then, the max power output is `(min(fluid_max_temp, maximum_temperature) - fluid_default_temp) × fluid_usage_per_tick × fluid_heat_capacity × effectivity`, the fluid is the filter specified on the `fluid_box`.

properties.name: min_perceived_performance
properties.description: Animation runs at least this fast. This corresponds to the sound.

properties.name: scale_fluid_usage
properties.description:
Scales the generator's fluid usage to its maximum power output.

Setting this to true prevents the generator from overconsuming fluid, for example when higher than`maximum_temperature` fluid is fed to the generator.

If scale_fluid_usage is false, the generator consumes the full `fluid_usage_per_tick` and any of the extra energy in the fluid (in the form of higher temperature) is wasted. The [steam engine](https://wiki.factorio.com/Steam_engine) exhibits this behavior when fed steam from [heat exchangers](https://wiki.factorio.com/Heat_exchanger).

prototypes.name: GodControllerPrototype
prototypes.description: Properties of the god controller.

properties.name: crafting_categories
properties.description: Names of the crafting categories the player can craft recipes from.

properties.name: mining_categories
properties.description: Names of the resource categories the player can mine resources from.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the god-controller. Base game uses "default".

prototypes.name: GroupAttackAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player gets attacked due to pollution.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the player receives this amount of attacks. **Note**: The default achievement "it stinks and they don't like it" uses the amount of 1. (As in getting attacked once.)

prototypes.name: GuiStyle
prototypes.description: The available GUI styles.

custom_properties.description:
Styles are defined as uniquely named [StyleSpecification](prototype:StyleSpecification) properties of the prototype.

Styles with certain names are mandatory, as they are used by the base game GUI. A list is found below.
examples:
```
-- Adding a custom frame_style-type style
data.raw["gui-style"]["default"]["custom_style_for_a_frame"] =
{
  type = "frame_style",
  parent = "frame",
  use_header_filler = false,
  drag_by_title = false
}
```

prototypes.name: GunPrototype
prototypes.description: A gun. A weapon to deal damage to entities.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: The information the item needs to know in order to know what ammo it requires, the sounds, and range.

prototypes.name: HeatInterfacePrototype
prototypes.description: This entity produces or consumes heat. Its heat settings can be changed runtime.

prototypes.name: HeatPipePrototype
prototypes.description: A [heat pipe](https://wiki.factorio.com/Heat_pipe).

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

prototypes.name: HighlightBoxEntityPrototype
prototypes.description:
Used to attach graphics for [cursor boxes](prototype:CursorBoxType) to entities during runtime. HighlightBoxEntity can also be independent from entities so it is simply drawn somewhere in the world. See [LuaSurface::create_entity](runtime:LuaSurface::create_entity) for the available options for type "highlight-box".

The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of the highlight box prototype is ignored during runtime, instead the "bounding_box" given in create_entity() or the selection box of the target entity is used.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

prototypes.name: InfinityContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A generic container, such as a chest, that can spawn or void items and interact with the logistics network.

properties.name: gui_mode
properties.description: Controls which players can control what the chest spawns.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: The number of slots in this container. May not be zero.

properties.name: logistic_mode
properties.description: The way this chest interacts with the logistic network.

properties.name: render_not_in_network_icon
properties.description: Whether the "no network" icon should be rendered on this entity if the entity is not within a logistics network.

prototypes.name: InfinityPipePrototype
prototypes.description: This entity produces or consumes fluids. Its fluid settings can be changed runtime.

prototypes.name: InserterPrototype
prototypes.description: An [inserter](https://wiki.factorio.com/Inserter).

properties.name: allow_burner_leech
properties.description: Whether this burner inserter can fuel itself from the fuel inventory of the entity it is picking up items from.

properties.name: allow_custom_vectors
properties.description: Whether pickup and insert position can be set run-time.

properties.name: chases_belt_items
properties.description: Whether the inserter hand should move to the items it picks up from belts, leading to item chasing behaviour. If this is off, the inserter hand will stay in the center of the belt and any items picked up from the edges of the belt "teleport" to the inserter hand.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: draw_held_item
properties.description: Whether the item that the inserter is holding should be drawn.

properties.name: draw_inserter_arrow
properties.description: Whether the yellow arrow that indicates the drop point of the inserter and the line that indicates the pickup position should be drawn.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Defines how this inserter gets energy. The emissions set on the energy source are ignored so inserters cannot produce pollution.

properties.name: filter_count
properties.description: How many filters this inserter has. Maximum count of filtered items in inserter is 5.

properties.name: hand_size
properties.description: Used to determine how long the arm of the inserter is when drawing it. Does not affect gameplay. The lower the value, the straighter the arm. Increasing the value will give the inserter a bigger bend due to its longer parts.

properties.name: stack
properties.description: Whether this inserter is considered a stack inserter. Relevant for determining how [inserter capacity bonus (research)](https://wiki.factorio.com/Inserter_capacity_bonus_(research)) applies to the inserter.

properties.name: stack_size_bonus
properties.description: Stack size bonus that is inherent to the prototype without having to be researched.

properties.name: use_easter_egg
properties.description: Whether the inserter should be able to fish [fish](https://wiki.factorio.com/Raw_fish).

prototypes.name: ItemEntityPrototype
prototypes.description: The entity used for items on the ground.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description:
Item entity collision box has to have same width as height.

Specification of the entity collision boundaries. Empty collision box means no collision and is used for smoke, projectiles, particles, explosions etc.

The `{0,0}` coordinate in the collision box will match the entity position. It should be near the center of the collision box, to keep correct entity drawing order. The bounding box must include the `{0,0}` coordinate.

Note, that for buildings, it is customary to leave 0.1 wide border between the edge of the tile and the edge of the building, this lets the player move between the building and electric poles/inserters etc.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

prototypes.name: ItemGroup
prototypes.description:
An item group. Item groups are the tabs shown above the list of craftable items in the player's inventory GUI. The built-in groups are "logistics", "production", "intermediate-products" and "combat" but mods can define their own.

Items are sorted into item groups by sorting them into a [subgroup](prototype:ItemPrototype::subgroup) which then belongs to an [item group](prototype:ItemSubGroup::group).
examples:
```
{
  type = "item-group",
  name = "logistics",
  order = "a",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/item-group/logistics.png",
  icon_size = 128,
  icon_mipmaps = 2
}
```

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon that is shown to represent this item group.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description: Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined, or if `icon_size` is not specified for all instances of `icons`.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: The icon that is shown to represent this item group. Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: order_in_recipe
properties.description: Item ingredients in recipes are ordered by item group. The `order_in_recipe` property can be used to specify the ordering in recipes without affecting the inventory order.

prototypes.name: ItemPrototype
prototypes.description: Possible configuration for all items.

properties.name: burnt_result
properties.description: The item that is the result when this item gets burned as fuel.

properties.name: dark_background_icon
properties.description:
If this is set, it is used to show items in alt-mode instead of the normal item icon. This can be useful to increase the contrast of the icon with the dark alt-mode [icon outline](prototype:UtilityConstants::item_outline_color).

Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `dark_background_icons` is not defined.

Uses the basic `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` properties.

properties.name: dark_background_icons
properties.description:
Inside IconData, the property for the file path is `dark_background_icon` instead of `icon`. Can't be an empty array.

Uses the basic `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` properties.

properties.name: default_request_amount
properties.default: The stack size of this item.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Specifies some properties of the item.

properties.name: fuel_category
properties.description: Must exist when a nonzero fuel_value is defined.

properties.name: fuel_glow_color
properties.description: Colors the glow of the burner energy source when this fuel is burned. Can also be used to color the glow of reactors burning the fuel, see [ReactorPrototype::use_fuel_glow_color](prototype:ReactorPrototype::use_fuel_glow_color).

properties.name: fuel_value
properties.description:
Amount of energy the item gives when used as fuel.

Mandatory if `fuel_acceleration_multiplier`, `fuel_top_speed_multiplier` or `fuel_emissions_multiplier` or `fuel_glow_color` are used.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description:
Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

This definition applies to all icon-type properties, both on here and on any children.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

This definition applies to all icon-type properties, both on here and on any children.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined, or if `icon_size` is not specified for all instances of `icons`.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description:
Used to give the item multiple different icons so that they look less uniform on belts. For inventory icons and similar, `icon/icons` will be used. Maximum number of variations is 16.

The expected size for icons of items on belts is 16px. So when using sprites of size `64` (same as base game icons), the `scale` should be set to 0.25.

properties.name: place_result
properties.description:
Name of the [EntityPrototype](prototype:EntityPrototype) that can be built using this item. If this item should be the one that construction bots use to build the specified `place_result`, set the `"primary-place-result"` [item flag](prototype:ItemPrototypeFlags).

The localised name of the entity will be used as the in-game item name. This behavior can be overwritten by specifying `localised_name` on this item, it will be used instead.

properties.name: rocket_launch_product
properties.description: Only loaded if `rocket_launch_products` is not defined.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

properties.name: subgroup
properties.description: Empty text of subgroup is not allowed. (You can omit the definition to get the default "other").

properties.name: wire_count
properties.description: The number of items needed to connect 2 entities with this as wire. In the base game, [green wire](https://wiki.factorio.com/Green_wire), [red wire](https://wiki.factorio.com/Red_wire) and [copper cable](https://wiki.factorio.com/Copper_cable) have this set to 1.

prototypes.name: ItemRequestProxyPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity used to signify that an entity is requesting items, for example modules for an assembling machine after it was blueprinted with modules inside.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

prototypes.name: ItemSubGroup
prototypes.description:
An item subgroup. Item subgroups are the rows in the recipe list in the player's inventory GUI. The subgroup of a prototype also determines its item [group](prototype:ItemGroup::group) (tab in the recipe list).

The built-in subgroups can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#item-subgroup). See [ItemPrototype::subgroup](prototype:ItemPrototype::subgroup) for setting the subgroup of an item.

properties.name: group
properties.description: The item group this subgroup is located in.

prototypes.name: ItemWithEntityDataPrototype
prototypes.description: ItemWithEntityData saves data associated with the entity that it represents, for example the content of the equipment grid of a car.

properties.name: icon_tintable
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icon_tintables` is not defined.

Uses `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` from its [ItemPrototype](prototype:ItemPrototype) parent.

properties.name: icon_tintable_mask
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icon_tintable_masks` is not defined and `icon_tintable` is defined.

Uses `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` from its [ItemPrototype](prototype:ItemPrototype) parent.

properties.name: icon_tintable_masks
properties.description:
Inside IconData, the property for the file path is `icon_tintable_mask` instead of `icon`. Can't be an empty array.

Only loaded if `icon_tintable` is defined.

Uses `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` from its [ItemPrototype](prototype:ItemPrototype) parent.

properties.name: icon_tintables
properties.description:
Inside IconData, the property for the file path is `icon_tintable` instead of `icon`. Can't be an empty array.

Only loaded if `icon_tintable` is defined (`icon_tintables` takes precedence over `icon_tintable`).

Uses `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` from its [ItemPrototype](prototype:ItemPrototype) parent.

prototypes.name: ItemWithInventoryPrototype
prototypes.description: The inventory allows setting player defined filters similar to cargo wagon inventories.

properties.name: extends_inventory_by_default
properties.description: When true, this item-with-inventory will extend the inventory it sits in by default. This is a runtime property on the result item that can be changed through the Lua interface and only determines the initial value.

properties.name: filter_message_key
properties.description: The locale key used when the player attempts to put an item that doesn't match the filter rules into the item-with-inventory.

properties.name: filter_mode
properties.description: This determines how filters are applied. If no filters are defined this is automatically set to "none".

properties.name: insertion_priority_mode
properties.description: The insertion priority mode for this item. This determines if items are first attempted to be put into this items inventory if the item extends the inventory it sits in when items are put into the parent inventory.

options.description: Items are inserted into this item-with-inventory only if they match the whitelist defined in the prototype for the item and whitelist is used.
Items are never inserted into this item-with-inventory except explicitly by the player or script.
All items first try to be inserted into this item-with-inventory.
When the inventory contains filters that match the item-to-be-inserted then try to put it into this item before the inventory this item resides in.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: The inventory size of the item.

properties.name: item_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item names to be used as filters.

properties.name: item_group_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item group names to be used as filters.

properties.name: item_subgroup_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item subgroup names to be used as filters.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: ItemWithLabelPrototype
prototypes.description: Like a normal item but with the ability to have a colored label.

properties.name: default_label_color
properties.description: The default label color the item will use.

properties.name: draw_label_for_cursor_render
properties.description: If the item will draw its label when held in the cursor in place of the item count.

prototypes.name: ItemWithTagsPrototype
prototypes.description: Item type that can store any basic arbitrary Lua data, see [LuaItemStack::tags](runtime:LuaItemStack::tags).

prototypes.name: KillAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player destroys a certain amount of an entity, with a specific damage type.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This is the amount of entity of the specified type the player needs to destroy to receive the achievement.

properties.name: damage_type
properties.description: This defines how the player needs to destroy the specific entity.

properties.name: in_vehicle
properties.description: This defines if the player needs to be in a vehicle.

properties.name: personally
properties.description: This defines to make sure you are the one driving, for instance, in a tank rather than an automated train.

properties.name: to_kill
properties.description: This defines which entity needs to be destroyed in order to receive the achievement.

properties.name: type_to_kill
properties.description: This defines what entity type needs to be destroyed in order to receive the achievement.

prototypes.name: LabPrototype
prototypes.description: A [lab](https://wiki.factorio.com/Lab).

properties.name: allowed_effects
properties.description: Sets the module effects that are allowed to be used on this lab.

properties.name: base_productivity
properties.description: Productivity bonus that this machine always has.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Defines how this lab gets energy.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy this lab uses.

properties.name: entity_info_icon_shift
properties.description: Shift of the "alt-mode icon" relative to the lab's center.

properties.name: inputs
properties.description:
A list of the names of science packs that can be used in this lab.

If a technology requires other types of science packs, it cannot be researched in this lab.

properties.name: module_specification
properties.description: The number of module slots.

properties.name: off_animation
properties.description: The animation that plays when the lab is idle.

properties.name: on_animation
properties.description: The animation that plays when the lab is active.

prototypes.name: LampPrototype
prototypes.description: A [lamp](https://wiki.factorio.com/Lamp) to provide light, using energy.
examples:
```
{
  type = "lamp",
  name = "small-lamp",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/small-lamp.png",
  icon_size = 64, icon_mipmaps = 4,
  flags = {"placeable-neutral", "player-creation"},
  minable = {mining_time = 0.1, result = "small-lamp"},
  max_health = 100,
  corpse = "lamp-remnants",
  dying_explosion = "lamp-explosion",
  collision_box = {{-0.15, -0.15}, {0.15, 0.15}},
  selection_box = {{-0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5}},
  energy_source =
  {
    type = "electric",
    usage_priority = "lamp"
  },
  energy_usage_per_tick = "5KW",
  darkness_for_all_lamps_on = 0.5,
  darkness_for_all_lamps_off = 0.3,
  light = {intensity = 0.9, size = 40, color = {r=1.0, g=1.0, b=0.75}},
  light_when_colored = {intensity = 0, size = 6, color = {r=1.0, g=1.0, b=0.75}},
  glow_size = 6,
  glow_color_intensity = 1,
  glow_render_mode = "multiplicative",
  picture_off =
  {
    layers =
    {
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/small-lamp/lamp.png",
        priority = "high",
        width = 42,
        height = 36,
        frame_count = 1,
        axially_symmetrical = false,
        direction_count = 1,
        shift = util.by_pixel(0,3)
      },
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/small-lamp/lamp-shadow.png",
        priority = "high",
        width = 38,
        height = 24,
        frame_count = 1,
        axially_symmetrical = false,
        direction_count = 1,
        shift = util.by_pixel(4,5),
        draw_as_shadow = true
      }
    }
  },
  picture_on =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/small-lamp/lamp-light.png",
    priority = "high",
    width = 46,
    height = 40,
    frame_count = 1,
    axially_symmetrical = false,
    direction_count = 1,
    shift = util.by_pixel(0, -7)
  },
  signal_to_color_mapping =
  {
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-red",    color = {r = 1, g = 0, b = 0}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-green",  color = {r = 0, g = 1, b = 0}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-blue",   color = {r = 0, g = 0, b = 1}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-yellow", color = {r = 1, g = 1, b = 0}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-pink",   color = {r = 1, g = 0, b = 1}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-cyan",   color = {r = 0, g = 1, b = 1}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-white",  color = {r = 1, g = 1, b = 1}}
  },

  circuit_wire_connection_point = circuit_connector_definitions["lamp"].points,
  circuit_connector_sprites = circuit_connector_definitions["lamp"].sprites,
  circuit_wire_max_distance = default_circuit_wire_max_distance
}
```

properties.name: always_on
properties.description: Whether the lamp should always be on.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: The pictures displayed for circuit connections to this lamp.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_point
properties.description: Defines how wires visually connect to this lamp.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: darkness_for_all_lamps_off
properties.description: darkness_for_all_lamps_on must be > darkness_for_all_lamps_off. Values must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: darkness_for_all_lamps_on
properties.description: darkness_for_all_lamps_on must be > darkness_for_all_lamps_off. Values must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The emissions set on the energy source are ignored so lamps cannot produce pollution.

properties.name: energy_usage_per_tick
properties.description: The amount of energy the lamp uses. Must be greater than > 0.

properties.name: light
properties.description: What color the lamp will be when it is on, and receiving power.

properties.name: light_when_colored
properties.description: This refers to when the light is in a circuit network, and is lit a certain color based on a signal value.

properties.name: picture_off
properties.description: The lamps graphics when it's off.

properties.name: picture_on
properties.description: The lamps graphics when it's on.

prototypes.name: LandMinePrototype
prototypes.description: A [land mine](https://wiki.factorio.com/Land_mine).

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: force_die_on_attack
properties.description: Force the landmine to kill itself when exploding.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: picture_safe
properties.description: The sprite of the landmine before it is armed (just after placing).

properties.name: picture_set
properties.description: The sprite of the landmine of a friendly force when it is armed.

properties.name: picture_set_enemy
properties.description: The sprite of the landmine of an enemy force when it is armed.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: Time between placing and the landmine being armed, in ticks.

properties.name: trigger_collision_mask
properties.description: Collision mask that another entity must collide with to make this landmine blow up.

prototypes.name: LeafParticlePrototype
prototypes.description: Deprecated in 0.18. Particles that are exclusively meant for leaves of trees. The type "leaf-particle" has been obsoleted and cannot be created. See [ParticlePrototype](prototype:ParticlePrototype) for particles.

prototypes.name: LinkedBeltPrototype
prototypes.description: A belt that can be connected to a belt anywhere else, including on a different surface. The linked belts have to be [connected with console commands](https://wiki.factorio.com/Console#Connect_linked_belts) or runtime scripting in mods or scenarios. [LuaEntity::connect_linked_belts](runtime:LuaEntity::connect_linked_belts) and other runtime functions.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

prototypes.name: LinkedContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A container that shares its inventory with containers with the same [link_id](runtime:LuaEntity::link_id), which can be set via the GUI. The link IDs are per prototype and force, so only containers with the **same ID**, **same prototype name** and **same force** will share inventories.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: The pictures displayed for circuit connections to this linked container.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_point
properties.description: Defines how wires visually connect to this linked container.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this linked container.

properties.name: gui_mode
properties.description: Players that can access the GUI to change the link ID.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: Must be > 0.

properties.name: inventory_type
properties.description: Whether the inventory of this container can be filtered (like cargo wagons) or not.

prototypes.name: Loader1x1Prototype
prototypes.description:
Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.

This loader type is identical to [Loader1x2Prototype](prototype:Loader1x2Prototype) with the exception of its hardcoded belt_distance. The belt_distance of the loader determines the distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's belt target.

This loader type always has a belt_distance of 0, meaning by default it is 1 tile long in total. For a loader type with a belt_distance of 0.5, see [Loader1x2Prototype](prototype:Loader1x2Prototype).

prototypes.name: Loader1x2Prototype
prototypes.description:
Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.

This loader type is identical to [Loader1x1Prototype](prototype:Loader1x1Prototype) with the exception of its hardcoded belt_distance. The belt_distance of the loader determines the distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's belt target.

This loader type always has a belt_distance of 0.5, meaning by default it is 2 tiles long in total. For a loader type with a belt_distance of 0, see [Loader1x1Prototype](prototype:Loader1x1Prototype).

prototypes.name: LoaderPrototype
prototypes.description: Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.

properties.name: allow_container_interaction
properties.description: Whether this loader can load and unload stationary inventories such as containers and crafting machines.

properties.name: allow_rail_interaction
properties.description: Whether this loader can load and unload [RollingStockPrototype](prototype:RollingStockPrototype).

properties.name: belt_length
properties.description: How long this loader's belt is. Should be the same as belt_distance, which is hardcoded to `0.5` for [Loader1x2Prototype](prototype:Loader1x2Prototype) and to 0 for [Loader1x1Prototype](prototype:Loader1x1Prototype). See the linked prototypes for an explanation of belt_distance.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: container_distance
properties.description: The distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's container target.

properties.name: energy_per_item
properties.description: Energy in Joules. Can't be negative.

properties.name: filter_count
properties.description: How many item filters this loader has. Maximum count of filtered items in loader is 5.

prototypes.name: LocomotivePrototype
prototypes.description: A [locomotive](https://wiki.factorio.com/Locomotive).

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Must be a burner energy source when using "burner", otherwise it can also be a void energy source.

properties.name: max_snap_to_train_stop_distance
properties.description: In tiles. A locomotive will snap to a nearby train stop when the player places it within this distance to the stop.

prototypes.name: LogisticContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A generic container, such as a chest, that interacts with the logistics network.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Drawn when a robot brings/takes items from this container.

properties.name: animation_sound
properties.description: Played when a robot brings/takes items from this container. Ignored if `animation` is not defined.

properties.name: landing_location_offset
properties.description: The offset from the center of this container where a robot visually brings/takes items.

properties.name: logistic_mode
properties.description: The way this chest interacts with the logistic network.

properties.name: max_logistic_slots
properties.description: The number of request slots this logistics container has. Requester-type containers must have > 0 slots and can have a maximum of 1000 slots. Storage-type containers must have <= 1 slot.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: The picture displayed for this entity.

properties.name: render_not_in_network_icon
properties.description: Whether the "no network" icon should be rendered on this entity if the entity is not within a logistics network.

properties.name: use_exact_mode
properties.description: Whether logistic robots have to deliver the exact amount of items requested to this logistic container instead of over-delivering (within their cargo size).

prototypes.name: LogisticRobotPrototype
prototypes.description: A [logistic robot](https://wiki.factorio.com/Logistic_robot).

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Must have a collision box size of zero.

properties.name: idle_with_cargo
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the idle state cannot be animated.

properties.name: in_motion_with_cargo
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the in_motion state cannot be animated.

properties.name: shadow_idle_with_cargo
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the idle state cannot be animated.

properties.name: shadow_in_motion_with_cargo
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the in_motion state cannot be animated.

prototypes.name: MapGenPresets
prototypes.description: The available map gen presets.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the map gen presets. Base game uses "default".

custom_properties.description: Presets are defined as uniquely named [MapGenPreset](prototype:MapGenPreset) properties of the prototype. Zero or more named presets can be specified within the prototype.

prototypes.name: MapSettings
prototypes.description: The default map settings.

properties.name: max_failed_behavior_count
properties.description: If a behavior fails this many times, the enemy (or enemy group) is destroyed. This solves biters stuck within their own base.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the map-settings. Base game uses "map-settings".

prototypes.name: MarketPrototype
prototypes.description: Offers can be added to a market and they are shown when opening the entity. Offers allow to spend items to get research bonuses or items.

properties.name: allow_access_to_all_forces
properties.description: Whether all forces are allowed to open this market.

prototypes.name: MiningDrillPrototype
prototypes.description: A mining drill for automatically extracting resources from [resource entities](prototype:ResourceEntityPrototype). This prototype type is used by [burner mining drill](https://wiki.factorio.com/Burner_mining_drill), [electric mining drill](https://wiki.factorio.com/Electric_mining_drill) and [pumpjack](https://wiki.factorio.com/Pumpjack) in vanilla.

properties.name: animations
properties.description: Only loaded if `graphics_set` is not defined.

properties.name: base_picture
properties.description: Used by the [pumpjack](https://wiki.factorio.com/Pumpjack) to have a static 4 way sprite.

properties.name: base_productivity
properties.description: Productivity bonus that this machine always has. Values below `0` are allowed, however the sum of the resulting effect together with modules and research is limited to be at least 0%, see [Effect](prototype:Effect).

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance  > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance  > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The energy source of this mining drill.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy used by the drill while mining. Can't be less than or equal to 0.

properties.name: mining_speed
properties.description: The speed of this drill.

properties.name: monitor_visualization_tint
properties.description: When this mining drill is connected to the circuit network, the resource that it is reading (either the entire resource patch, or the resource in the mining area of the drill, depending on circuit network setting), is tinted in this color when mousing over the mining drill.

properties.name: radius_visualisation_picture
properties.description: The sprite used to show the range of the mining drill.

properties.name: resource_categories
properties.description:
The names of the [ResourceCategory](prototype:ResourceCategory) that can be mined by this drill. For a list of built-in categories, see [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#resource-category).

Note: Categories containing resources which produce items, fluids, or items+fluids may be combined on the same entity, but may not work as expected. Examples: Miner does not rotate fluid-resulting resources until depletion. Fluid isn't output (fluid resource change and fluidbox matches previous fluid). Miner with no `vector_to_place_result` can't output an item result and halts.

properties.name: resource_searching_radius
properties.description:
The distance from the centre of the mining drill to search for resources in.

This is 2.49 for electric mining drills (a 5x5 area) and 0.99 for burner mining drills (a 2x2 area). The drill searches resource outside its natural boundary box, which is 0.01 (the middle of the entity); making it 2.5 and 1.0 gives it another block radius.

properties.name: vector_to_place_result
properties.description: The position where any item results are placed, when the mining drill is facing north (default direction). If the drill does not produce any solid items but uses a fluidbox output instead (e.g. pumpjacks), a vector of `{0,0}` disables the yellow arrow alt-mode indicator for the placed item location.

prototypes.name: MiningToolPrototype
prototypes.description: Exists only for migration, cannot be used by mods.

prototypes.name: ModuleCategory
prototypes.description: A module category. The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#module-category). See [ModulePrototype::category](prototype:ModulePrototype::category).

prototypes.name: ModulePrototype
prototypes.description: A [module](https://wiki.factorio.com/Module).

properties.name: art_style
properties.description: Chooses with what art style the module is shown inside beacons. See [BeaconModuleVisualizations::art_style](prototype:BeaconModuleVisualizations::art_style). Vanilla uses "vanilla" here.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Used when upgrading modules: Ctrl + click modules into an entity and it will replace lower tier modules of the same category with higher tier modules.

properties.name: limitation
properties.description: Array of recipe names this module can be used on. If empty, the module can be used on all recipes.

properties.name: limitation_blacklist
properties.description:
Array of recipe names this module can **not** be used on, implicitly allowing its use on all other recipes. This property has no effect if set to an empty table.

Note that the game converts this into a normal list of limitations internally, so reading [LuaItemPrototype::limitations](runtime:LuaItemPrototype::limitations) at runtime will be the product of both ways of defining limitations.

properties.name: limitation_message_key
properties.description: The locale key of the message that is shown when the player attempts to use the module on a recipe it can't be used on. The locale key will be prefixed with `item-limitation.` (the "category" of the locale) by the game.

properties.name: tier
properties.description: Tier of the module inside its category. Used when upgrading modules: Ctrl + click modules into an entity and it will replace lower tier modules with higher tier modules if they have the same category.

prototypes.name: MouseCursor
prototypes.description: Used by [SelectionToolPrototype::mouse_cursor](prototype:SelectionToolPrototype::mouse_cursor).

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Mandatory if `system_cursor` is not defined.

properties.name: hot_pixel_x
properties.description: Mandatory if `system_cursor` is not defined.

properties.name: hot_pixel_y
properties.description: Mandatory if `system_cursor` is not defined.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the prototype.

properties.name: system_cursor
properties.description: Either this or the other three properties have to be present.

prototypes.name: MovementBonusEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [exoskeleton](https://wiki.factorio.com/Exoskeleton). Increases max speed of characters or acceleration of vehicles if they have this equipment in their grid.

properties.name: movement_bonus
properties.description: Multiplier of the character speed/vehicle acceleration.

prototypes.name: NamedNoiseExpression
prototypes.description:
A [NoiseExpression](prototype:NoiseExpression) with a name. The base game uses named noise expressions to specify functions for many map properties to be used in map generation; e.g. the "elevation" expression is used to calculate elevation for every point on a map. For a list of the built-in named noise expressions, see [data.raw](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#noise-expression).

Named noise expressions can be used by [MapGenSettings](prototype:MapGenSettings) and [MapGenPreset](prototype:MapGenPreset) to override which named expression is used to calculate a given property by having an entry in `property_expression_names`, e.g. `elevation = "0.16-elevation"`.

Alternate expressions can be made available in the map generator GUI by setting their `intended_property` to the name of the property they should override.

Named noise expressions can also be used by [noise variables](prototype:NoiseVariable), e.g. `noise.var("my-named-expression")`.

properties.name: expression
properties.description: The noise expression itself. This is where most of the noise magic happens.

properties.name: intended_property
properties.description:
Names the property that this expression is intended to provide a value for, if any. This will make the expression show up as an option in the map generator GUI, unless it is the only expression with that intended property, in which case it will be hidden and selected by default.

Note that the "Map type" dropdown in the map generation GUI is actually a selector for "elevation" generators. If generators are available for other properties, the "Map type" dropdown in the GUI will be renamed to "elevation" and shown along with selectors for the other selectable properties.

For example if a noise expression is intended to be used as an alternative temperature generator, `intended_property` should be "temperature". The base game uses the intended_properties elevation, temperature, moisture and aux. For how the named noise expression with those intended_properties are used in the base game see the notable named noise expression list on [BaseNamedNoiseExpressions](prototype:BaseNamedNoiseExpressions). Mods may add any other intended_property or modify the existing noise expressions to change/remove their intended properties. Furthermore, mods may remove the use of those named noise expressions from the map generation code or change what they affect.

**intended_property in the base game:** The base game defines two named noise expressions that have the `intended_property` "elevation" so that are selectable via the "Map type" dropdown (which actually selects elevation generators)

```
local noise = require("noise")
data:extend{
  {
    type = "noise-expression",
    name = "elevation",
    intended_property = "elevation",
    expression = noise.var("0_17-lakes-elevation") -- "0_17-lakes-elevation" is another named noise expression. Noise variables may reference named noise expressions.
  },
  {
    type = "noise-expression",
    name = "0_17-island",
    intended_property = "elevation",
    -- A large island surrounded by an endless ocean
    -- expression =  [...]
  }
}
```

**Mods can define any intended_property with any name**. This examples aims to show what this is useful for.

A [NoiseVariable](prototype:NoiseVariable) can reference a named noise expression, so by defining the "test" named noise expression, `noise.var("test")` may be used in other [noise expressions](prototype:NoiseExpression). Intended_property allows to override what the variable references: With the example, if "more-test" is selected in the dropdown in the map generator GUI, its `expression` (`noise.ridge(noise.var("y"), -10, 6`) will provide the value for the noise variable "test" instead.

For easy demonstration, that value is assigned to the "elevation" named noise expression, so changing the "test" generator changes the `noise.var("test")` which in turn is used by the "elevation" named noise expression. The "elevation" noise variable is used by water generation, so changing the test generators is immediately visible in the map generation preview.

Note that the player can select the "Island" elevation generator in the Elevation dropdown (previously named Map type), which means the 0_17-island named noise expression is selected and `noise.var("test")` isn't used anymore so changing the test generator no longer has an effect.

```
local noise = require("noise")
data:extend{
  {
    type = "noise-expression",
    name = "test",
    intended_property = "test",
    expression = noise.ridge(noise.var("x"), -80, 8),
  },
  {
    type = "noise-expression",
    name = "more-test",
    intended_property = "test", -- override the "test" noise variable when selected by the player
    expression = noise.ridge(noise.var("y"), -10, 6),
  }
}
data.raw["noise-expression"]["elevation"].expression = noise.var("test") -- the noise variable "test"
```

properties.name: order
properties.description:
Used to order alternative expressions in the map generator GUI. For a given property (e.g. 'temperature'), the NamedNoiseExpression with that property's name as its `intended_property` with the lowest order will be chosen as the default in the GUI.

If no order is specified, it defaults to "2000" if the property name matches the expression name (making it the 'technical default' generator for the property if none is specified in MapGenSettings), or "3000" otherwise. A generator defined with an order less than "2000" but with a unique name can thereby override the default generator used when creating a new map through the GUI without automatically overriding the 'technical default' generator, which is probably used by existing maps.

prototypes.name: NightVisionEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [nightvision](https://wiki.factorio.com/Nightvision).

properties.name: darkness_to_turn_on
properties.description: Must be >= 0 and <= 1.

prototypes.name: NoiseLayer
prototypes.description: A noise layer used by the [autoplace system](prototype:AutoplacePeak::noise_layer). For a list of built-in layers, see [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#noise-layer).

prototypes.name: OffshorePumpPrototype
prototypes.description: An [offshore pump](https://wiki.factorio.com/Offshore_pump).

properties.name: adjacent_tile_collision_mask
properties.description: Tiles colliding with `adjacent_tile_collision_box` must NOT collide with this collision mask.

properties.name: adjacent_tile_collision_test
properties.description: Tiles colliding with `adjacent_tile_collision_box` must collide with this collision mask (unless it's empty).

properties.name: always_draw_fluid
properties.description: If false, the offshore pump will not show fluid present (visually) before there is an output connected. The pump will also animate yet not show fluid when the fluid is 100% extracted (e.g. such as with a pump).

properties.name: center_collision_mask
properties.description: Tile at placement position must NOT collide with this collision mask.

properties.name: check_bounding_box_collides_with_tiles
properties.description:
If not set (=default), the offshore pump does not collide with tiles if it has none of these collision masks: "water-tile", "ground-tile", "resource-layer", "player-layer", "item-layer", "doodad-layer". If it has at least one of the six collision masks, it does collide with tiles.

If set, this specifies whether collision with tiles should (true) or should not (false) be performed on an offshore pump.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: fluid

properties.name: min_perceived_performance

properties.name: picture
properties.description:
Mandatory if `graphics_set` is not defined.

Deprecated, use `graphics_set` instead.

properties.name: pumping_speed
properties.description: How many units of fluid are produced per tick. Must be > 0.

prototypes.name: ParticlePrototype

properties.name: pictures

properties.name: regular_trigger_effect_frequency

properties.name: shadows

properties.name: vertical_acceleration

properties.name: smoke

prototypes.name: PipePrototype

prototypes.name: PipeToGroundPrototype

properties.name: draw_fluid_icon_override

prototypes.name: PlayerDamagedAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player receives damage.

properties.name: minimum_damage
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the amount of damage taken by the dealer, is more than this.

properties.name: should_survive
properties.description: This sets the achievement to only trigger, if you survive the minimum amount of damage. If you don't need to survive, false.

properties.name: type_of_dealer

prototypes.name: PlayerPortPrototype
prototypes.description: When a character dies, this entity will immediately respawn the character at the entities location, so there is no respawn time. If there are multiple player ports in the world, the character will respawn at the nearest player port to their death location.

properties.name: collision_mask

properties.description: This will set the amount of items or fluids needed to craft, for the player to complete the achievement.

This will tell the achievement what fluid the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

properties.name: item_product

Mandatory if `fluid_product` is not defined.

This will tell the achievement what item the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

properties.name: limited_to_one_game

prototypes.name: ProducePerHourAchievementPrototype

properties.description:
Mandatory if `item_product` is not defined.

This will tell the achievement what fluid the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

properties.name: item_product
properties.description:
Mandatory if `fluid_product` is not defined.

This will tell the achievement what item the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

prototypes.description: A [programmable speaker](https://wiki.factorio.com/Programmable_speaker).

prototypes.name: ProjectilePrototype
prototypes.description: Entity with limited lifetime that can hit other entities and has triggers when this happens.

properties.name: acceleration
properties.description: Must be != 0 if `turning_speed_increases_exponentially_with_projectile_speed` is true.

properties.name: action
properties.description: Executed when the projectile hits something.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: direction_only
properties.description: Setting this to true can be used to disable projectile homing behaviour.

properties.name: final_action
properties.description: Executed when the projectile hits something, after `action` and only if the entity that was hit was destroyed. The projectile is destroyed right after the final_action.

properties.name: hit_at_collision_position
properties.description: When true the entity is hit at the position on its collision box the projectile first collides with. When false the entity is hit at its own position.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

properties.name: piercing_damage
properties.description: Whenever an entity is hit by the projectile, this number gets reduced by the health of the entity. If the number is then below 0, the `final_action` is applied and the projectile destroyed. Otherwise, the projectile simply continues to its destination.

properties.name: rotatable
properties.description: Whether the animation of the projectile is rotated to match the direction of travel.

properties.name: turn_speed
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

properties.name: name

For a list of all names used in vanilla, see [data.raw](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw).

properties.name: order

properties.name: type

Specifies the kind of prototype this is.

For a list of all types used in vanilla, see [data.raw](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw).

properties.name: energy_per_nearby_scan
properties.description:
The amount of energy the radar has to consume for nearby scan to be performed. This value doesn't have any effect on sector scanning.

Performance warning: nearby scan causes re-charting of many chunks, which is expensive operation. If you want to make a radar that updates map more in real time, you should keep its range low. If you are making radar with high range, you should set this value such that nearby scan is performed once a second or so. For example if you set `energy_usage` to 100kW, setting `energy_per_nearby_scan` to 100kJ will cause nearby scan to happen once per second.

properties.name: energy_per_sector
properties.description: The amount of energy it takes to scan a sector. This value doesn't have any effect on nearby scanning.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The energy source for this radar.

properties.name: energy_usage

properties.name: max_distance_of_nearby_sector_revealed
properties.description: The radius of the area constantly revealed by this radar, in chunks.

properties.name: max_distance_of_sector_revealed
properties.description: The radius of the area this radar can chart, in chunks.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.description: The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of rail signals is hardcoded to `{{-0.2, -0.2}, {0.2, 0.2}}`.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description:
Rail signals must collide with each other, this can be achieved by having the "rail-layer" collision mask layer on all rail signals.

Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: The "placeable-off-grid" flag will be ignored for rail signals.

prototypes.name: RailSignalPrototype
prototypes.description: A [rail signal](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rail_signal).

prototypes.name: ReactorPrototype
prototypes.description: A [reactor](https://wiki.factorio.com/Reactor).

properties.name: connection_patches_connected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. Each variation represents connected heat buffer connection of corresponding index.

properties.name: connection_patches_disconnected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. Each variation represents unconnected heat buffer connection of corresponding index.

properties.name: consumption
properties.description: How much energy this reactor can consume (from the input energy source) and then output as heat.

properties.name: default_fuel_glow_color
properties.description: When `use_fuel_glow_color` is true, this is the color used as `working_light_picture` tint for fuels that don't have glow color defined.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description:
May not be a heat energy source.

The input energy source, in vanilla it is a burner energy source.

properties.name: heat_buffer
properties.description: The energy output as heat.

properties.name: heat_connection_patches_connected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. When reactor is heated, corresponding variations are drawn over `connection_patches_connected`.

properties.name: heat_connection_patches_disconnected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. When reactor is heated, corresponding variations are drawn over `connection_patches_disconnected`.

properties.name: meltdown_action
properties.description: The action is triggered when the reactor dies (is destroyed) at over 90% of max temperature.

properties.name: scale_energy_usage
properties.description: When this is true, the reactor will stop consuming fuel/energy when the temperature has reached the maximum.

properties.name: use_fuel_glow_color
properties.description: Whether the reactor should use [fuel_glow_color](prototype:ItemPrototype::fuel_glow_color) from the fuel item prototype as light color and tint for `working_light_picture`. [Forum post.](https://forums.factorio.com/71121)

prototypes.name: RecipeCategory
prototypes.description:
A recipe category. The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#recipe-category). See [RecipePrototype::category](prototype:RecipePrototype::category). Recipe categories can be used to specify which [machine](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype::crafting_categories) can craft which [recipes](prototype:RecipePrototype).

The recipe category with the name "crafting" cannot contain recipes with fluid ingredients or products.

prototypes.name: RecipePrototype
prototypes.description:
A recipe. It can be a crafting recipe, a smelting recipe, or a custom type of recipe, see [RecipeCategory](prototype:RecipeCategory).

This prototype has two different formats that can be specified. If both `normal` and `expensive` are not defined, the standard properties define this recipe. Otherwise, they are ignored, and the `normal` and `expensive` properties are used exclusively to define this recipe.
examples:
```
{
  type = "recipe",
  name = "iron-plate",
  category = "smelting",
  energy_required = 3.5,
  ingredients = {{"iron-ore", 1}},
  result = "iron-plate"
}
```

```
{  -- Uncraftable in normal mode (unless unlocked via command/research)
  type = "recipe",
  name = "iron-gear-wheel",
  normal = false,
  expensive =
  {
    ingredients = {{"iron-plate", 4}},
    result = "iron-gear-wheel"
  }
}
```

```
{  -- Expensive recipe always used, even when in normal mode
  type = "recipe",
  name = "iron-gear-wheel",
  normal = nil, -- can be omitted
  expensive =
  {
    ingredients = {{"iron-plate", 4}},
    result = "iron-gear-wheel"
  }
}
```

properties.name: allow_as_intermediate
properties.description:
Whether the recipe can be used as an intermediate recipe in hand-crafting.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: allow_decomposition
properties.description:
Whether this recipe is allowed to be broken down for the recipe tooltip "Total raw" calculations.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: allow_inserter_overload
properties.description:
Whether the recipe is allowed to have the extra inserter overload bonus applied (4 * stack inserter stack size).

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: allow_intermediates
properties.description:
Whether the recipe is allowed to use intermediate recipes when hand-crafting.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: always_show_made_in
properties.description:
Whether the "Made in: <Machine>" part of the tool-tip should always be present, and not only when the recipe can't be hand-crafted.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: always_show_products
properties.description:
Whether the products are always shown in the recipe tooltip.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: category
properties.description:
Controls which category of machines can craft this recipe.

The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#recipe-category). The base `"crafting"` category can not contain recipes with fluid ingredients or products.

properties.name: crafting_machine_tint
properties.description: Used by [CraftingMachinePrototype::working_visualisations](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype::working_visualisations) to tint certain layers with the recipe color. [WorkingVisualisation::apply_recipe_tint](prototype:WorkingVisualisation::apply_recipe_tint) determines which of the four colors is used for that layer, if any.

properties.name: emissions_multiplier
properties.description: Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
This can be `false` to disable the recipe at the start of the game, or `true` to leave it enabled.

If a recipe is unlocked via technology, this should be set to `false`.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: energy_required
properties.description:
The amount of time it takes to make this recipe. Must be `> 0.001`. Equals the number of seconds it takes to craft at crafting speed `1`.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: expensive
properties.description:
Can be set to `false` if the `normal` property is defined. This will disable this difficulty, same as setting `enabled` to `false` would. If it's later enabled (by research, etc.), it will use the data from `normal`.

If this property is not defined while `normal` is, it will mirror its data.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description:
Hides the recipe from crafting menus.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: hide_from_player_crafting
properties.description:
Hides the recipe from the player's crafting screen. The recipe will still show up for selection in machines.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: hide_from_stats
properties.description:
Hides the recipe from item/fluid production statistics.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
If given, this determines the recipe's icon. Otherwise, the icon of `main_product` or the singular product is used.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined for a recipe with more than one product and no `main_product`, or no product.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description: Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined, or if `icon_size` is not specified for all instances of `icons`.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description:
A table containing ingredient names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually in the IngredientPrototype (see [here](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-256)).

The maximum ingredient amount is 65 535. Can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that needs no ingredients.

Duplicate ingredients, e.g. two entries with the same name, are *not* allowed. In-game, the item ingredients are ordered by [ItemGroup::order_in_recipe](prototype:ItemGroup::order_in_recipe).

Mandatory if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: main_product
properties.description:
For recipes with one or more products: Subgroup, localised_name and icon default to the values of the singular/main product, but can be overwritten by the recipe. Setting the main_product to an empty string (`""`) forces the title in the recipe tooltip to use the recipe's name (not that of the product) and shows the products in the tooltip.

If 1) there are multiple products and this property is nil, 2) this property is set to an empty string (`""`), or 3) there are no products, the recipe will use the localised_name, icon, and subgroup of the recipe. icon and subgroup become non-optional.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: normal
properties.description:
Can be set to `false` if the `expensive` property is defined. This will disable this difficulty, same as setting `enabled` to `false` would. If it's later enabled (by research, etc.), it will use the data from `expensive`.

If this property is not defined while `expensive` is, it will mirror its data.

properties.name: overload_multiplier
properties.description:
Used to determine how many extra items are put into an assembling machine before it's considered "full enough". See [insertion limits](https://wiki.factorio.com/Inserters#Insertion_limits).

If set to `0`, it instead uses the following formula: `1.166 / (energy_required / the assembler's crafting_speed)`, rounded up, and clamped to be between`2` and `100`. The numbers used in this formula can be changed by the [UtilityConstants](prototype:UtilityConstants) properties `dynamic_recipe_overload_factor`, `minimum_recipe_overload_multiplier`, and `maximum_recipe_overload_multiplier`.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: requester_paste_multiplier
properties.description: Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: result
properties.description:
The item created by this recipe. Must be the name of an [item](prototype:ItemPrototype), such as `"iron-gear-wheel"`.

Only loaded if neither `results`, `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: result_count
properties.description:
The number of items created by this recipe.

Only loaded if neither `results`, `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: results
properties.description:
A table containing result names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually in the ProductPrototype (see [here](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-256)).

Can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that produces nothing. Duplicate results, e.g. two entries with the same name, are allowed.

Mandatory if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: show_amount_in_title
properties.description:
Whether the recipe name should have the product amount in front of it. E.g. "2x Transport belt".

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: subgroup
properties.description:
The subgroup of this recipe. If not specified, it defaults to the subgroup of the product if there is only one, or of the `main_product` if multiple products exist.

Mandatory if multiple products exist and no `main_product` is specified, or if there is no product.

properties.name: unlock_results
properties.description:
Whether enabling this recipe unlocks its item products to show in selection lists (item filters, logistic requests, etc.).

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

prototypes.name: RepairToolPrototype
prototypes.description: A [repair pack](https://wiki.factorio.com/Repair_pack).

properties.name: repair_result
properties.description: This does nothing, it is never triggered.

prototypes.name: ResearchAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player completes a specific research.

properties.name: research_all
properties.description:
Mandatory if `technology` is not defined.

This will only trigger if the player has learned every research in the game.

properties.name: technology
properties.description:
Mandatory if `research_all` is not defined.

Researching this technology will trigger the achievement.

prototypes.name: ResourceCategory
prototypes.description: A resource category. The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#resource-category). See [ResourceEntityPrototype::category](prototype:ResourceEntityPrototype::category).

prototypes.name: ResourceEntityPrototype
prototypes.description: A mineable/gatherable entity. Its [collision_mask](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_mask) must contain "resource-layer" if it should be minable with a [MiningDrillPrototype](prototype:MiningDrillPrototype).
examples:
```
{
  type = "resource",
  name = "crude-oil",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/crude-oil.png",
  icon_size = 32,
  flags = {"placeable-neutral"},
  category = "basic-fluid",
  order="a-b-a",
  infinite = true,
  highlight = true,
  minimum = 60000,
  normal = 300000,
  infinite_depletion_amount = 10,
  resource_patch_search_radius = 12,
  tree_removal_probability = 0.7,
  tree_removal_max_distance = 32 * 32,
  minable =
  {
    mining_time = 1,
    results =
    {
      {
        type = "fluid",
        name = "crude-oil",
        amount_min = 10,
        amount_max = 10,
        probability = 1
      }
    }
  },
  collision_box = {{ -1.4, -1.4}, {1.4, 1.4}},
  selection_box = {{ -0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5}},
  autoplace = resource_autoplace.resource_autoplace_settings{
    name = "crude-oil",
    order = "c", -- Other resources are "b"; oil won't get placed if something else is already there.
    base_density = 8.2,
    base_spots_per_km2 = 1.8,
    random_probability = 1/48,
    random_spot_size_minimum = 1,
    random_spot_size_maximum = 1, -- don't randomize spot size
    additional_richness = 220000, -- this increases the total everywhere, so base_density needs to be decreased to compensate
    has_starting_area_placement = false,
    resource_index = resource_autoplace.resource_indexes["crude-oil"],
    regular_rq_factor_multiplier = 1
  },
  stage_counts = {0},
  stages =
  {
    sheet =
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/crude-oil/crude-oil.png",
      priority = "extra-high",
      width = 75,
      height = 61,
      frame_count = 4,
      variation_count = 1
    }
  },
  map_color = {r=0.78, g=0.2, b=0.77},
  map_grid = false
}
```

properties.name: category
properties.description: The category for the resource. Available categories in vanilla can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#resource-category).

properties.name: cliff_removal_probability
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: effect_animation_period
properties.description: How long it takes `stages_effect` to go from `min_effect_alpha` to `max_effect_alpha`.

properties.name: effect_animation_period_deviation
properties.description: How much `effect_animation_period` can deviate from its original value. Used to make the stages effect alpha change look less uniform.

properties.name: effect_darkness_multiplier
properties.description: How much the surface darkness should affect the alpha of `stages_effect`.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description: If the resource should be highlighted when holding a mining drill that can mine it (holding a pumpjack highlights crude-oil in the base game).

properties.name: infinite
properties.description: If the ore is infinitely minable, or if it will eventually run out of resource.

properties.name: infinite_depletion_amount
properties.description: Every time an infinite-type resource "ticks" lower it's lowered by that amount. -- [Rseding91](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=271115#p271115)

properties.name: map_grid
properties.description: Whether the resource should have a grid pattern on the map instead of a solid map color.

properties.name: max_effect_alpha
properties.description: Maximal alpha value of `stages_effect`.

properties.name: min_effect_alpha
properties.description: Minimal alpha value of `stages_effect`.

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: Must be not 0 when `infinite = true`.

properties.name: mining_visualisation_tint
properties.description: Defaults to the resources map color if left unset and map color is set, otherwise defaults to white if left unset.

properties.name: normal
properties.description: Must be not 0 when `infinite = true`.

properties.name: randomize_visual_position
properties.description: Whether there should be a slight offset to graphics of the resource. Used to make patches a little less uniform in appearance.

properties.name: resource_patch_search_radius
properties.description: When hovering over this resource in the map view: How far to search for other resource patches of this type to display as one (summing amount, white outline).

properties.name: stage_counts
properties.description: Number of stages the animation has.

properties.name: stages
properties.description:
Entity's graphics, using a graphic sheet, with variation and depletion. At least one stage must be defined.
