When using [AnimationVariations::sheet](prototype:AnimationVariations::sheet), `frame_count` is the amount of frames per row in the spritesheet. `variation_count` is the amount of rows in the spritesheet. Each row in the spritesheet is one stage of the animation.

properties.name: stages_effect
properties.description: An effect that can be overlaid above the normal ore graphics. Used in the base game to make [uranium ore](https://wiki.factorio.com/Uranium_ore) glow.

properties.name: tree_removal_max_distance
properties.description: Must be positive when `tree_removal_probability` is set.

properties.name: tree_removal_probability
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: walking_sound
properties.description: Sound played when the player walks over this resource.

prototypes.name: RoboportEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [personal roboport](https://wiki.factorio.com/Personal_roboport).

properties.name: burner
properties.description: Add this is if the roboport should be fueled directly instead of using power from the equipment grid.

properties.name: charge_approach_distance
properties.description: Presumably, the distance from the roboport at which robots will wait to charge.

properties.name: charging_offsets
properties.description: The offsets from the center of the roboport at which robots will charge. Only used if `charging_station_count` is equal to 0.

properties.name: charging_station_count
properties.description: How many charging points this roboport has. If this is 0, the length of the charging_offsets table is used to calculate the charging station count.

properties.name: charging_threshold_distance
properties.description: Distance in tiles. This defines how far away a robot can be from the charging spot and still be charged, however the bot is still required to reach a charging spot in the first place.

properties.name: construction_radius
properties.description: Can't be negative.

properties.name: draw_logistic_radius_visualization
properties.description: Unused, as roboport equipment does not have a logistic radius that could be drawn.

properties.name: power
properties.description:
Mandatory if `burner` is defined.

The size of the buffer of the burner energy source, so effectively the amount of power that the energy source can produce per tick.

properties.name: recharging_animation
properties.description: The animation played at each charging point when a robot is charging there.

properties.name: recharging_light
properties.description: The light emitted when charging a robot.

properties.name: robot_limit
properties.description: How many robots can exist in the network (cumulative).

properties.name: spawn_and_station_height
properties.description: Presumably states the height of the charging stations and thus an additive offset for the charging_offsets.

properties.name: spawn_minimum
properties.description: Minimum amount of energy that needs to available inside the roboport's buffer so that robots can be spawned.

properties.name: stationing_offset
properties.description: The offset from the center of the roboport at which robots will enter and exit.

prototypes.name: RoboportPrototype
prototypes.description: A [roboport](https://wiki.factorio.com/Roboport).

properties.name: base_animation
properties.description: The animation played when the roboport is idle.

properties.name: charge_approach_distance
properties.description: The distance (in tiles) from the roboport at which robots will wait to charge. Notably, if the robot is already in range, then it will simply wait at its current position.

properties.name: charging_energy
properties.description: The maximum power provided to each charging station.

properties.name: charging_offsets
properties.description: The offsets from the center of the roboport at which robots will charge. Only used if `charging_station_count` is equal to 0.

properties.name: charging_station_count
properties.description: How many charging points this roboport has. If this is 0, the length of the charging_offsets table is used to calculate the charging station count.

properties.name: charging_threshold_distance
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: construction_radius
properties.description: Can't be negative.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The roboport's energy source.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy the roboport uses when idle.

properties.name: logistics_connection_distance
properties.description: Must be >= `logistics_radius`.

properties.name: logistics_radius
properties.description: Can't be negative.

properties.name: material_slots_count
properties.description: The number of repair pack slots in the roboport.

properties.name: recharge_minimum
properties.description:
Minimum charge that the roboport has to have after a blackout (0 charge/buffered energy) to begin working again. Additionally, freshly placed roboports will have their energy buffer filled with `0.25 × recharge_minimum` energy.

Must be larger than or equal to `energy_usage` otherwise during low power the roboport will toggle on and off every tick.

properties.name: recharging_animation
properties.description: The animation played at each charging point when a robot is charging there.

properties.name: recharging_light
properties.description: The light emitted when charging a robot.

properties.name: robot_limit
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: robot_slots_count
properties.description: The number of robot slots in the roboport.

properties.name: spawn_and_station_height
properties.description: Presumably states the height of the charging stations and thus an additive offset for the charging_offsets.

properties.name: stationing_offset
properties.description: The offset from the center of the roboport at which robots will enter and exit.

prototypes.name: RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype
prototypes.description: The common properties of logistic and construction robots represented by an abstract prototype.

properties.name: destroy_action
properties.description: Applied when the robot expires (runs out of energy and [FlyingRobotPrototype::speed_multiplier_when_out_of_energy](prototype:FlyingRobotPrototype::speed_multiplier_when_out_of_energy) is 0).

properties.name: idle
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the idle state cannot be animated.

properties.name: in_motion
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the in_motion state cannot be animated.

properties.name: shadow_idle
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the idle state cannot be animated.

properties.name: shadow_in_motion
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the in_motion state cannot be animated.

prototypes.name: RocketSiloPrototype
prototypes.description: A [rocket silo](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rocket_silo).

properties.name: active_energy_usage
properties.description: Additional energy used during the following parts of the [launch sequence](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status): doors_opening, rocket_rising, arms_advance, engine_starting, arms_retract, doors_closing.

properties.name: alarm_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state.

properties.name: alarm_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state.

properties.name: base_night_sprite
properties.description: Drawn instead of `base_day_sprite` during the night, that is when [LuaSurface::darkness](runtime:LuaSurface::darkness) is larger than 0.3.

properties.name: clamps_off_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [arms_retract](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_retract) state.

properties.name: clamps_off_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [arms_retract](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_retract) state.

properties.name: clamps_on_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [arms_advance](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_advance) state.

properties.name: clamps_on_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [arms_advance](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_advance) state.

properties.name: door_opening_speed
properties.description: The inverse of the duration in ticks of [doors_opening](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opening) and [closing](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_closing).
examples:
```
door_opening_speed = 1 / (4 * 60) -- doors opening and closing takes 4 seconds
```

properties.name: doors_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [doors_opening](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opening) and [doors_closing](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_closing) states.

properties.name: doors_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [doors_opening](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opening) and [doors_closing](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_closing) states.

properties.name: flying_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [engine_starting](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.engine_starting) state.

properties.name: lamp_energy_usage
properties.description:
May be 0.

Additional energy used during the night, that is when [LuaSurface::darkness](runtime:LuaSurface::darkness) is larger than 0.3.

properties.name: launch_wait_time
properties.description: The time to wait in the [launch_started](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.launch_started) state before switching to [engine_starting](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.engine_starting).

properties.name: light_blinking_speed
properties.description: The inverse of the duration in ticks of [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) and [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close).

properties.name: raise_rocket_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [rocket_rising](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.rocket_rising) state.

properties.name: raise_rocket_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [rocket_rising](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.rocket_rising) state.

properties.name: red_lights_back_sprites
properties.description: Drawn from the start of the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state until the end of the [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close) state.

properties.name: red_lights_front_sprites
properties.description: Drawn from the start of the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state until the end of the [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close) state.

properties.name: rocket_entity
properties.description: Name of a [RocketSiloRocketPrototype](prototype:RocketSiloRocketPrototype).

properties.name: rocket_parts_required
properties.description: The number of crafts that must complete to produce a rocket. This includes bonus crafts from productivity. Recipe products are ignored.

properties.name: rocket_rising_delay
properties.description: The time to wait in the [doors_opened](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opened) state before switching to [rocket_rising](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.rocket_rising).

properties.name: times_to_blink
properties.description:
How many times the `red_lights_back_sprites` and `red_lights_front_sprites` should blink during [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) and [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close).

Does not affect the duration of the launch sequence.

prototypes.name: RocketSiloRocketPrototype
prototypes.description: The rocket inside the rocket silo.

prototypes.name: RocketSiloRocketShadowPrototype
prototypes.description: The shadow of the rocket inside the rocket silo.

prototypes.name: RollingStockPrototype
prototypes.description: The abstract base of all rolling stock.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: connection_distance
properties.description: The distance between the joint of this rolling stock and its connected rolling stocks joint.

properties.name: drive_over_tie_trigger
properties.description: Usually a sound to play when the rolling stock drives over a tie. The rolling stock is considered to be driving over a tie every `tie_distance` tiles.

properties.name: joint_distance
properties.description:
The length between this rolling stocks front and rear joints. Joints are the point where connection_distance is measured from when rolling stock are connected to one another. Wheels sprite are placed based on the joint position.

Maximum joint distance is 15.

Note: There needs to be border at least 0.2 between the [bounding box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) edge and joint. This means that the collision_box must be at least `{{-0,-0.2},{0,0.2}}`.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Maximum speed of the rolling stock in tiles/tick.

In-game, the max speed of a train is `min(all_rolling_stock_max_speeds) × average(all_fuel_modifiers_in_all_locomotives)`. This calculated train speed is then silently capped to 7386.3km/h.

properties.name: tie_distance
properties.description: In tiles. Used to determine how often `drive_over_tie_trigger` is triggered.

prototypes.name: SelectionToolPrototype
prototypes.description: Used in the base game as a base for the blueprint item and the deconstruction item.

properties.name: alt_reverse_selection_cursor_box_type
properties.description: The type of cursor box used to render selection of entities/tiles when alt-reverse-selecting (using SHIFT + Right mouse button

properties.name: alt_reverse_selection_mode
properties.description: A list of selection mode flags that define how the selection tool alt-reverse-selects things in-game (using SHIFT + Right mouse button).

properties.name: alt_selection_color
properties.description: The color of the rectangle used when alt-selection is done in-game.

properties.name: alt_selection_cursor_box_type
properties.description: The type of cursor box used to render selection of entities/tiles when alt selecting.

properties.name: alt_selection_mode
properties.description: A list of selection mode flags that define how the selection tool alt-selects things in-game.

properties.name: always_include_tiles
properties.description: If tiles should be included in the selection regardless of entities also being in the selection. This is a visual only setting.

properties.name: reverse_selection_cursor_box_type
properties.description: The type of cursor box used to render selection of entities/tiles when reverse-selecting.

properties.name: reverse_selection_mode
properties.description: A list of selection mode flags that define how the selection tool reverse-selects things in-game.

properties.name: selection_color
properties.description: The color of the rectangle used when standard selection is done in-game.

properties.name: selection_cursor_box_type
properties.description: The type of cursor box used to render selection of entities/tiles when standard selecting.

properties.name: selection_mode
properties.description: A list of selection mode flags that define how the selection tool selects things in-game.

prototypes.name: ShortcutPrototype
prototypes.description:
Definition for a shortcut button in the [shortcut bar](https://wiki.factorio.com/Shortcut_bar).

This is **not** a custom keybinding (keyboard shortcut), for that see [CustomInputPrototype](prototype:CustomInputPrototype).
examples:
```
{
  type = "shortcut",
  name = "give-deconstruction-planner",
  order = "b[blueprints]-g[deconstruction-planner]",
  action = "spawn-item",
  localised_name = {"shortcut.make-deconstruction-planner"},
  associated_control_input = "give-deconstruction-planner",
  technology_to_unlock = "construction-robotics",
  item_to_spawn = "deconstruction-planner",
  style = "red",
  icon =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/icons/shortcut-toolbar/mip/new-deconstruction-planner-x32-white.png",
    priority = "extra-high-no-scale",
    size = 32,
    mipmap_count = 2,
    flags = {"gui-icon"}
  },
  small_icon =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/icons/shortcut-toolbar/mip/new-deconstruction-planner-x24-white.png",
    priority = "extra-high-no-scale",
    size = 24,
    mipmap_count = 2,
    flags = {"gui-icon"}
  },
  disabled_small_icon =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/icons/shortcut-toolbar/mip/new-deconstruction-planner-x24-white.png",
    priority = "extra-high-no-scale",
    size = 24,
    mipmap_count = 2,
    flags = {"gui-icon"}
  }
}
```

properties.name: action
properties.description: If this is `"lua"`, [on_lua_shortcut](runtime:on_lua_shortcut) is raised when the shortcut is clicked.

properties.name: associated_control_input
properties.description: Name of a custom input or vanilla control. This is **only** used to show the keybind in the tooltip of the shortcut.

properties.name: disabled_icon
properties.description:
The icon used when the shortcut is shown in the quickbar, and is not usable.

Note: The scale that can be defined in the sprite may not behave as expected because the game always scales the sprite to fill the GUI slot.

properties.name: disabled_small_icon
properties.description:
The icon used in the panel for visible shortcuts, when the shortcut is not usable.

Note: The scale that can be defined in the sprite may not behave as expected because the game always scales the sprite to fill the GUI slot.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Scales to fit a 16x16-pixel square.

Note: The scale that can be defined in the sprite may not behave as expected because the game always scales the sprite to fill the GUI slot.

properties.name: item_to_spawn
properties.description: The item to create when clicking on a shortcut with the action set to `"spawn-item"`. The item must have the [spawnable](prototype:ItemPrototypeFlags::spawnable) flag set.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Used to order the shortcuts in the [quick panel](https://wiki.factorio.com/Quick_panel), which replaces the shortcut bar when using a controller (game pad). It [is recommended](https://forums.factorio.com/106661) to order modded shortcuts after the vanilla shortcuts.

properties.name: small_icon
properties.description:
The icon used in the panel for visible shortcuts, when the shortcut is usable.

Note: The scale that can be defined in the sprite may not behave as expected because the game always scales the sprite to fill the GUI slot.

properties.name: technology_to_unlock
properties.description: The technology that must be researched before this shortcut can be used. Once a shortcut is unlocked in one save file, it is unlocked for all future save files.

properties.name: toggleable
properties.description: Must be enabled for the Factorio API to be able to set the toggled state on the shortcut button, see [LuaPlayer::set_shortcut_toggled](runtime:LuaPlayer::set_shortcut_toggled).

prototypes.name: SimpleEntityPrototype
prototypes.description: An extremely basic entity with no special functionality. Used for minable rocks. Cannot be rotated.

properties.name: count_as_rock_for_filtered_deconstruction
properties.description: Whether this entity should be treated as a rock for the purpose of deconstruction and for [CarPrototype::immune_to_rock_impacts](prototype:CarPrototype::immune_to_rock_impacts).

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Takes priority over `animations`. Only the `north` sprite is used because this entity cannot be rotated.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Takes priority over `picture` and `animations`.

properties.name: random_variation_on_create
properties.description: Whether a random graphics variation is chosen when placing the entity/creating it via script/creating it via map generation. If this is `false`, the entity will use the first variation instead of a random one.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for entities with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Entities with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

prototypes.name: SimpleEntityWithForcePrototype
prototypes.description: By default, this entity will be a priority target for units/turrets, who will choose to attack it even if it does not block their path. Setting [EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target) to `false` will turn this off, which then makes this type equivalent to [SimpleEntityWithOwnerPrototype](prototype:SimpleEntityWithOwnerPrototype).

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

prototypes.name: SimpleEntityWithOwnerPrototype
prototypes.description:
Has a force, but unlike [SimpleEntityWithForcePrototype](prototype:SimpleEntityWithForcePrototype) it is only attacked if the biters get stuck on it (or if [EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target) set to true to make the two entity types equivalent).

Can be rotated in 4 directions. `picture` can be used to specify different graphics per direction.

properties.name: force_visibility
properties.description: If the entity is not visible to a player, the player cannot select it.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Takes priority over `animations`.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Takes priority over `picture` and `animations`.

properties.name: random_variation_on_create
properties.description: Whether a random graphics variation is chosen when placing the entity/creating it via script/creating it via map generation. If this is false, the entity will use the first variation instead of a random one.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for entities with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Entities with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

prototypes.name: SimpleSmokePrototype
prototypes.description: Deprecated in 0.16. The type "simple-smoke" has been obsoleted and cannot be created. Use [TrivialSmokePrototype](prototype:TrivialSmokePrototype) or [SmokeWithTriggerPrototype](prototype:SmokeWithTriggerPrototype) instead.

prototypes.name: SmokePrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract entity that has an animation.

properties.name: affected_by_wind
properties.description: Smoke always moves randomly unless `movement_slow_down_factor` is 0. If `affected_by_wind` is true, the smoke will also be moved by wind.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Must have a collision box size of zero.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: May not be 0 if cyclic is true.

properties.name: fade_away_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: fade_in_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: movement_slow_down_factor
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, with 0 being no movement.

prototypes.name: SmokeWithTriggerPrototype
prototypes.description: An entity with animation and a trigger.

properties.name: action_cooldown
properties.description: 0 means never apply.

prototypes.name: SolarPanelEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: A [portable solar panel](https://wiki.factorio.com/Portable_solar_panel).

properties.name: power
properties.description: How much power should be provided.

prototypes.name: SolarPanelPrototype
prototypes.description: A [solar panel](https://wiki.factorio.com/Solar_panel).

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Sets how this solar panel connects to the energy network. The most relevant property seems to be the output_priority.

properties.name: overlay
properties.description: Overlay has to be empty or have same number of variations as `picture`.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: The picture displayed for this solar panel.

properties.name: production
properties.description: The maximum amount of power this solar panel can produce.

prototypes.name: SoundPrototype
prototypes.description: Specifies a sound that can be used with [SoundPath](runtime:SoundPath) at runtime.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Modifies how far a sound can be heard. Must be between `0` and `1` inclusive.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Supported sound file formats are `.ogg (Vorbis)` and `.wav`.

Only loaded, and mandatory if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= min_speed`.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined. Only loaded, and mandatory if `min_speed` is defined.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= 1 / 64`.

Only loaded if both `variations` and `speed` are not defined.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the sound. Can be used as a [SoundPath](runtime:SoundPath) at runtime.

properties.name: preload
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
Speed must be `>= 1 / 64`. This sets both min and max speeds.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

prototypes.name: SpectatorControllerPrototype
prototypes.description: Properties of the spectator controller.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the spectator controller. Base game uses "default".

prototypes.name: SpeechBubblePrototype
prototypes.description: A speech bubble. It floats in the world and can display text.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Needs a style of the type "speech_bubble_style", defined inside the gui styles.

properties.name: wrapper_flow_style
properties.description: Needs a style of the type "flow_style", defined inside the gui styles.

prototypes.name: SpiderLegPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [SpiderLegSpecification](prototype:SpiderLegSpecification) for [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype), also known as [spidertron](https://wiki.factorio.com/Spidertron).

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: part_length
properties.description: Must be larger than 0.

prototypes.name: SpiderVehiclePrototype
prototypes.description: A [spidertron](https://wiki.factorio.com/Spidertron).

properties.name: chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier
properties.description:
This is applied whenever the spider shoots (manual and automatic targeting), `automatic_weapon_cycling` is true and the next gun in line (which is then selected) has ammo. When all of the above is the case, the chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier is a multiplier on the remaining shooting cooldown: `cooldown = (remaining_cooldown × chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier)`.

chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier is intended to be in the range of 0 to 1. This means that setting chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier to 0 reduces the remaining shooting cooldown to 0 while a chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier of 1 does not affect the remaining shooting cooldown at all.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Must be a burner energy source when using "burner", otherwise it can also be a void energy source.

properties.name: guns
properties.description: The guns this spider vehicle uses.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the spider affects the shooting height and the drawing of the graphics and lights.

properties.name: torso_bob_speed
properties.description: Cannot be negative.

properties.name: torso_rotation_speed
properties.description: The orientation of the torso of the spider affects the shooting direction and the drawing of the graphics and lights.

properties.name: trash_inventory_size
properties.description: If set to 0 then the spider will not have a Logistics tab.

prototypes.name: SpidertronRemotePrototype
prototypes.description: The [spidertron remote](https://wiki.factorio.com/Spidertron_remote). This remote can only be connected to entities of type [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: icon_color_indicator_mask
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icon_color_indicator_masks` is not defined.

Uses `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` from its [ItemPrototype](prototype:ItemPrototype) parent.

properties.name: icon_color_indicator_masks
properties.description:
Inside IconData, the property for the file path is `icon_color_indicator_mask` instead of `icon`. Can't be an empty array.

Uses `icon_size` and `icon_mipmaps` from its [ItemPrototype](prototype:ItemPrototype) parent.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: SplitterPrototype
prototypes.description: A [splitter](https://wiki.factorio.com/Splitter).

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: structure_patch
properties.description: Drawn 1 tile north of `structure` when the splitter is facing east or west.

prototypes.name: SpritePrototype
prototypes.description: Specifies an image that can be used with [SpritePath](runtime:SpritePath) at runtime.
examples:
```
{
  type = "sprite"
  name = "accumulator-sprite",
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/basic-accumulator/basic-accumulator.png",
  priority = "extra-high",
  width = 124,
  height = 103,
  shift = {0.7, -0.2}
}
```

properties.name: apply_runtime_tint
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: blend_mode
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: draw_as_glow
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_light`.

Draws first as a normal sprite, then again as a light layer. See [https://forums.factorio.com/91682](https://forums.factorio.com/91682).

properties.name: draw_as_light
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true.

properties.name: draw_as_shadow
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light`.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `layers` is not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Unused.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the Sprite.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Sprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties besides `name` and `type` are ignored.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error ([Example](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/340530709712076801/532315796626472972/unknown.png)). Modders can ignore this property.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only loaded if this is an icon, that is it has the flag `"group=icon"` or `"group=gui"`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the sprite. Can be used as a [SpritePath](runtime:SpritePath) at runtime.

properties.name: position
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Loaded only when `x` and `y` are both `0`. The first member of the tuple is `x` and the second is `y`.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Whether alpha should be pre-multiplied.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: scale
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Values other than `1` specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. A scale of `2` means that the picture will be two times bigger on screen (and thus more pixelated).

properties.name: shift
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The shift in tiles. `util.by_pixel()` can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The width and height of the sprite. If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height. Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: slice
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. As an example, if this is `4`, the sprite will be sliced into a `4x4` grid.

properties.name: slice_x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `slice`, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x-axis.

properties.name: slice_y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `slice`, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y-axis.

properties.name: tint
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

prototypes.name: StickerPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity that sticks to another entity, and damages/slows it. Stickers can only be attached to [UnitPrototype](prototype:UnitPrototype), [CharacterPrototype](prototype:CharacterPrototype), [CarPrototype](prototype:CarPrototype) and [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: damage_interval
properties.description: Interval between application of `damage_per_tick`, in ticks.

properties.name: damage_per_tick
properties.description: Applied every `damage_interval` ticks, so may not necessarily be "per tick".

properties.name: duration_in_ticks
properties.description: Must be > 0.

properties.name: selection_box_type
properties.description: Using this property marks the sticker as a "selection sticker", meaning that the selection box will be rendered around the entity when the sticker is on it.

properties.name: spread_fire_entity
properties.description: If this is given, this sticker is considered a "fire sticker" for some functions, such as [BaseAttackParameters::fire_penalty](prototype:BaseAttackParameters::fire_penalty) and [EntityPrototypeFlags::not-flammable](prototype:EntityPrototypeFlags::not_flammable).

properties.name: target_movement_modifier
properties.description: Less than 1 to reduce movement speed, more than 1 to increase it.

properties.name: target_movement_modifier_from
properties.description: The modifier value when the sticker is attached. It linearly changes over time to reach `target_movement_modifier_to`.

properties.name: target_movement_modifier_to
properties.description: The modifier value when the sticker expires. It linearly changes over time starting from `target_movement_modifier_from`.

properties.name: vehicle_friction_modifier_from
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_from`.

properties.name: vehicle_friction_modifier_to
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_to`.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_modifier
properties.description: Less than 1 to reduce vehicle speed, more than 1 to increase it.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_modifier_from
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_from`.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_modifier_to
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_to`.

prototypes.name: StorageTankPrototype
prototypes.description: A [storage tank](https://wiki.factorio.com/Storage_tank).

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance  > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance  > 0.

properties.name: flow_length_in_ticks
properties.description:
Must be positive.

Used for determining the x position inside the `flow_sprite` when drawing the storage tank. Does not affect gameplay.

The x position of the sprite will be `((game.tick % flow_length_in_ticks) ÷ flow_length_in_ticks) × (flow_sprite.width - 32)`. This means, that over `flow_length_in_ticks` ticks, the part of the `flow_sprite` that is drawn in-game is incrementally moved from most-left to most-right inside the actual sprite, that part always has a width of 32px. After `flow_length_in_ticks`, the part of the `flow_sprite` that is drawn will start from the left again.

properties.name: scale_info_icons
properties.description: If the icons of fluids shown in alt-mode should be scaled to the storage tank's size.

properties.name: window_bounding_box
properties.description: The location of the window showing the contents. Note that for `window_background` the width and height are determined by the sprite and window_bounding_box only determines the drawing location. For `fluid_background` the width is determined by the sprite and the height and drawing location are determined by window_bounding_box.

prototypes.name: StraightRailPrototype
prototypes.description: A straight rail.

prototypes.name: TechnologyPrototype
prototypes.description:
A [technology](https://wiki.factorio.com/Technologies).

This prototype has two different formats that can be specified. If both `normal` and `expensive` are not defined, the standard properties define this technology. Otherwise, they are ignored, and the `normal` and `expensive` properties are used exclusively to define this technology.

properties.name: effects
properties.description:
List of effects of the technology (applied when the technology is researched).

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: expensive
properties.description:
Can be set to `false` if the `normal` property is defined. This will disable this difficulty, same as setting `enabled` to `false` would. If it's later manually enabled by script, it will use the data from `normal`.

If this property is not defined while `normal` is, it will mirror its data.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description:
Hides the technology from the tech screen.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description: Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined, or if `icon_size` is not specified for all instances of `icons`.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: ignore_tech_cost_multiplier
properties.description:
Controls whether the technology cost ignores the tech cost multiplier set in the [DifficultySettings](runtime:DifficultySettings). E.g. `4` for the default expensive difficulty.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: max_level
properties.description:
`"infinite"` for infinite technologies, otherwise `uint32`.

Defaults to the same level as the technology, which is `0` for non-upgrades, and the level of the upgrade for upgrades.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: name
properties.description: If this name ends with `-<number>`, that number is ignored for localization purposes. E.g. if the name is `technology-3`, the game looks for the `technology-name.technology` localization. The technology tree will also show the number on the technology icon.

properties.name: normal
properties.description:
Can be set to `false` if the `expensive` property is defined. This will disable this difficulty, same as setting `enabled` to `false` would. If it's later manually enabled by script, it will use the data from `expensive`.

If this property is not defined while `expensive` is, it will mirror its data.

properties.name: prerequisites
properties.description:
List of technologies needed to be researched before this one can be researched.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: unit
properties.description:
Determines the cost in items and time of the technology.

Mandatory if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: upgrade
properties.description:
When set to true, and the technology contains several levels, only the relevant one is displayed in the technology screen.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

properties.name: visible_when_disabled
properties.description:
Controls whether the technology is shown in the tech GUI when it is not `enabled`.

Only loaded if neither `normal` nor `expensive` are defined.

prototypes.name: TileEffectDefinition
prototypes.description: Used to define the parameters for the water shader.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the tile-effect. Base game uses "water".

properties.name: texture
properties.description: Sprite size must be 512x512.

prototypes.name: TileGhostPrototype
prototypes.description: The entity used for tile ghosts.
examples:
```
{
  type = "tile-ghost",
  name = "tile-ghost",
  flags = {"not-on-map"},
  minable = { mining_time = 0, results={}},
  collision_box = {{-0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5}},
  selection_priority = 45
}
```

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

prototypes.name: TilePrototype
prototypes.description: A [tile](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tile).

properties.name: allowed_neighbors
properties.description: Array of tile names that are allowed next to this one.

properties.name: build_sound
properties.description: If this is loaded as one Sound, it is loaded as the "small" build sound.

properties.name: check_collision_with_entities
properties.description: If set to true, the game will check for collisions with entities before building or mining the tile. If entities are in the way it is not possible to mine/build the tile.

properties.name: draw_in_water_layer
properties.description: Used only for the `layer_group` default, see above.

properties.name: effect
properties.description: Name of a [TileEffectDefinition](prototype:TileEffectDefinition).

properties.name: effect_color_secondary
properties.description: Used by the [pollution](https://wiki.factorio.com/Pollution) shader.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file. If this and `icon` is not set, the `material_background` in `variants` is used as the icon.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description: Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined, or if `icon_size` is not specified for all instances of `icons`.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array. If this and `icon` is not set, the `material_background` in `variants` is used as the icon.

properties.name: layer
properties.description: Specifies transition drawing priority.

properties.name: minable
properties.description: If you want the tile to not be mineable, don't specify the minable property. Only non-mineable tiles become hidden tiles when placing mineable tiles on top of them.

properties.name: needs_correction
properties.description: Whether the tile needs tile correction logic applied when it's generated in the world, to prevent graphical artifacts. The tile correction logic disallows 1-wide stripes of the tile, see [Friday Facts #346](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-346).

properties.name: pollution_absorption_per_second
properties.description: Emissions absorbed per second by this tile. Use a negative value if pollution is created instead of removed.

properties.name: transitions
properties.description: Extra transitions.

properties.name: trigger_effect
properties.description: Called by [InvokeTileEffectTriggerEffectItem](prototype:InvokeTileEffectTriggerEffectItem).

properties.name: variants
properties.description: Graphics for this tile.

prototypes.name: TipsAndTricksItem
prototypes.description: A tips and tricks entry.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Name of a [TipsAndTricksItemCategory](prototype:TipsAndTricksItemCategory), used for the sorting of this tips and tricks entry. Tips and trick entries are sorted first by category and then by their `order` within that category.

properties.name: dependencies
properties.description: An array of names of other tips and tricks items. This tips and tricks entry is only shown to the player once they have marked all dependencies as read.

properties.name: indent
properties.description: The tips and tricks entry is indented by `indent`×6 spaces.

properties.name: is_title
properties.description: Whether the tip title on the left in the tips and tricks GUI should use the "title_tip_item" style (semi bold font).

properties.name: skip_trigger
properties.description: Condition for never showing the tip notification to the player.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: String to add in front of the tips and trick entries name. Can be anything, the base game tends to use [rich text](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rich_text) tags for items, e.g. `[item=wooden-chest]` here.

properties.name: trigger
properties.description: Condition for when the tip notification should be shown to the player.

properties.name: tutorial
properties.description: Name of a [TutorialDefinition](prototype:TutorialDefinition).

prototypes.name: TipsAndTricksItemCategory
prototypes.description: A [TipsAndTricksItem](prototype:TipsAndTricksItem) category, used for sorting of tips and tricks entries: Tips and trick entries are sorted first by category and then by their order within that category.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Tips and trick categories are sorted by `order`, and then the tips and tips entries are sorted by their own order within those categories.

prototypes.name: ToolPrototype
prototypes.description: Items with a "durability". Used for [science packs](https://wiki.factorio.com/Science_pack).

properties.name: durability
properties.description: The durability of this tool. Must be positive. Mandatory if `infinite` is false. Ignored if infinite is true.

properties.name: durability_description_key
properties.description: May not be longer than 200 characters.

properties.name: durability_description_value
properties.description:
May not be longer than 200 characters.

In-game, the game provides the locale with three [parameters](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Localisation#Localising_with_parameters):

`__1__`: remaining durability

`__2__`: total durability

`__3__`: durability as a percentage

So when a locale key that has the following translation

`Remaining durability is __1__ out of __2__ which is __3__ %`

is applied to a tool with 2 remaining durability out of 8 it will be displayed as

`Remaining durability is 2 out of 8 which is 25 %`

properties.name: infinite
properties.description: Whether this tool has infinite durability. If this is false, `durability` must be specified.

prototypes.name: TrainPathAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player has a specified train path length.

properties.name: minimum_distance
properties.description: The achievement will trigger if a train path is longer than this.

prototypes.name: TrainStopPrototype
prototypes.description: A [train stop](https://wiki.factorio.com/Train_stop).

properties.name: build_grid_size
properties.description: Has to be 2 for 2x2 grid.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

prototypes.name: TransportBeltConnectablePrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract class that anything that is a belt or can connect to belts uses.

properties.name: belt_animation_set
properties.description: This is the preferred way to specify transport belt animations.

properties.name: belt_horizontal
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: belt_vertical
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Transport belt connectable entities must have [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of an appropriate minimal size, they should occupy more than half of every tile the entity covers.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Transport belt connectable entities must collide with "transport-belt-layer". Transport belt connectable entities must have collision_mask that collides with itself. Transport belt connectable entities cannot have collision mask that collides only with tiles (must collide with entities in some way).

properties.name: ending_bottom
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: ending_patch
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: ending_side
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: ending_top
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Transport belt connectable entities cannot have any of the following flags: "placeable-off-grid", "building-direction-8-way".

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
The speed of the belt: `speed × 480 = x Items/second`.

The raw value is expressed as the number of tiles traveled by each item on the belt per tick, relative to the belt's maximum density - e.g. `x items/second ÷ (4 items/lane × 2 lanes/belt × 60 ticks/second) = <speed> belts/tick` where a "belt" is the size of one tile. See [Transport_belts/Physics](https://wiki.factorio.com/Transport_belts/Physics) for more details.

Must be a positive non-infinite number. The number is a fixed point number with 8 bits reserved for decimal precision, meaning the smallest value step is `1/2^8 = 0.00390625`. In the simple case of a non-curved belt, the rate is multiples of `1.875` items/s, even though the entity tooltip may show a different rate.

properties.name: starting_bottom
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: starting_side
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

properties.name: starting_top
properties.description: Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

prototypes.name: TransportBeltPrototype
prototypes.description: A [transport belt](https://wiki.factorio.com/Transport_belt).

properties.name: animations
properties.description:
Mandatory if `belt_animation_set` is not defined.

Transport belts must have 12 animations.

properties.name: belt_animation_set
properties.description: This is the preferred way to specify transport belt animations.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: The pictures displayed for circuit connections to this transport belt.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Defines how wires visually connect to this transport belt.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: related_underground_belt
properties.description: The name of the [UndergroundBeltPrototype](prototype:UndergroundBeltPrototype) which is used in quick-replace fashion when the smart belt dragging behavior is triggered.

prototypes.name: TreePrototype
prototypes.description: A [tree](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tree).

properties.name: colors
properties.description: Mandatory if `variations` is defined.

properties.name: healing_per_tick
properties.description: The amount of health automatically regenerated. Trees will regenerate every 60 ticks with `healing_per_tick × 60`.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Mandatory if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: variations
properties.description: Can't be empty.

prototypes.name: TriggerTargetType
prototypes.description: The base game always internally defines a "common" trigger target type. See [Design discussion: Trigger target type](https://forums.factorio.com/71657).

prototypes.name: TrivialSmokePrototype
prototypes.description: Smoke, but it's not an entity for optimization purposes.

properties.name: affected_by_wind
properties.description: Smoke always moves randomly unless `movement_slow_down_factor` is 0. If `affected_by_wind` is true, the smoke will also be moved by wind.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Can't be 0 - the smoke will never render.

properties.name: fade_away_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: fade_in_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: movement_slow_down_factor
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, with 1 being no slowdown and 0 being no movement.

prototypes.name: TurretPrototype
prototypes.description: A turret that needs no extra ammunition. See the children for turrets that need some kind of ammunition.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters unless this is a [AmmoTurretPrototype](prototype:AmmoTurretPrototype).

properties.name: attacking_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the attacking_animation: `1 ÷ attacking_speed = duration of the attacking_animation`

properties.name: corpse
properties.description: Specifies the name of the [CorpsePrototype](prototype:CorpsePrototype) to be used when this entity dies.

properties.name: ending_attack_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the ending_attack_animation: `1 ÷ ending_attack_speed = duration of the ending_attack_animation`

properties.name: energy_glow_animation_flicker_strength
properties.description: The range of the flickering of the alpha of `energy_glow_animation`. Default is range 0.2, so animation alpha can be anywhere between 0.8 and 1.0.

properties.name: folded_speed
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the folded_animation: `1 ÷ folded_speed = duration of the folded_animation`

properties.name: folded_speed_secondary
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the folded_animation: `1 ÷ folded_speed_secondary = duration of the folded_animation`

properties.name: folding_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the folding_animation: `1 ÷ folding_speed = duration of the folding_animation`

properties.name: glow_light_intensity
properties.description: The intensity of light in the form of `energy_glow_animation` drawn on top of `energy_glow_animation`.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: prepared_alternative_chance
properties.description: The chance for `prepared_alternative_animation` to be used.

properties.name: prepared_alternative_speed
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_alternative_animation: `1 ÷ prepared_alternative_speed = duration of the prepared_alternative_animation`

properties.name: prepared_alternative_speed_secondary
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_alternative_animation: `1 ÷ prepared_alternative_speed_secondary = duration of the prepared_alternative_animation`

properties.name: prepared_speed
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_animation: `1 ÷ prepared_speed = duration of the prepared_animation`

properties.name: prepared_speed_secondary
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_animation: `1 ÷ prepared_speed_secondary = duration of the prepared_animation`

properties.name: preparing_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the preparing_animation: `1 ÷ preparing_speed = duration of the preparing_animation`

properties.name: secondary_animation
properties.description: Whether the secondary (animation) speeds should always be used.

properties.name: spawn_decoration
properties.description: Decoratives to be created when the spawner is created by the [map generator](https://wiki.factorio.com/Map_generator). Placed when enemies expand if `spawn_decorations_on_expansion` is set to true.

properties.name: spawn_decorations_on_expansion
properties.description: Whether `spawn_decoration` should be spawned when this turret is created through [enemy expansion](https://wiki.factorio.com/Enemies#Expansions).

properties.name: starting_attack_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the starting_attack_animation: `1 ÷ starting_attack_speed = duration of the starting_attack_animation`

prototypes.name: TutorialDefinition
prototypes.description: The definition of the tutorial to be used in the tips and tricks, see [TipsAndTricksItem](prototype:TipsAndTricksItem). The actual tutorial scripting code is defined in the tutorial scenario. The scenario must be placed in the `tutorials` folder in the mod.

properties.name: scenario
properties.description: Name of the folder for this tutorial scenario in the [`tutorials` folder](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Mod_structure#Subfolders).

prototypes.name: UndergroundBeltPrototype
prototypes.description: An [underground belt](https://wiki.factorio.com/Underground_belt).

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

prototypes.name: UnitPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity that moves around and attacks players, for example [biters and spitters](https://wiki.factorio.com/Enemies#Creatures).

properties.name: allow_run_time_change_of_is_military_target
properties.description: If this is true, this entities `is_military_target property` can be changed runtime (on the entity, not on the prototype itself).

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires animation in attack_parameters. Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: distance_per_frame
properties.description:
How fast the `run_animation` frames are advanced. The animations are advanced animation_speed frames per `distance_per_frame` that the unit moves.

`frames_advanced = (distance_moved ÷ distance_per_frame) * animation_speed`

properties.name: dying_sound
properties.description: The sound file to play when entity dies.

properties.name: has_belt_immunity
properties.description: If the unit is immune to movement by belts.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: min_pursue_time
properties.description: In ticks.

properties.name: movement_speed
properties.description: Movement speed of the unit in the world, in tiles per tick. Must be equal to or greater than 0.

properties.name: pollution_to_join_attack
properties.description: The amount of pollution that has to be absorbed by the unit's spawner before the unit will leave the spawner and attack the source of the pollution.

properties.name: running_sound_animation_positions
properties.description: Only loaded if `walking_sound` is defined.

properties.name: vision_distance
properties.description:
Max is 100.

Note: Setting to 50 or above can lead to undocumented behavior of individual units creating groups on their own when attacking or being attacked.

prototypes.name: UpgradeItemPrototype
prototypes.description: An [upgrade planner](https://wiki.factorio.com/Upgrade_planner).

properties.name: alt_entity_filter_mode
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: alt_entity_filters
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: alt_entity_type_filters
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: alt_selection_mode
properties.description: This property is hardcoded to `"cancel-upgrade"`.

properties.name: alt_tile_filter_mode
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: alt_tile_filters
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: always_include_tiles
properties.description: This property is hardcoded to `false`.

properties.name: entity_filter_mode
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: entity_filters
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: entity_type_filters
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: mapper_count
properties.description: Can't be > 255.

properties.name: selection_mode
properties.description: This property is hardcoded to `"upgrade"`.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

properties.name: tile_filter_mode
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

properties.name: tile_filters
properties.description: This property is parsed, but then ignored.

prototypes.name: UtilityConstants
prototypes.description: Constants used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes. See [utility-constants.lua](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/core/prototypes/utility-constants.lua) for the values used by the base game.

properties.name: bonus_gui_ordering
properties.description: The base game uses more entries here that are applied via the [ammo categories](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/base/prototypes/categories/ammo-category.lua#L72-L76).

properties.name: chart
properties.description: Chart = map + minimap.

properties.name: default_trigger_target_mask_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

properties.name: flying_text_ttl
properties.description: Must be >= 1

properties.name: inventory_width
properties.description: Must be in range [1, 100].

properties.name: light_renderer_search_distance_limit
properties.description: Can be set to anything from range 0 to 255, but larger values will be clamped to 160. Setting it to larger values can have performance impact (growing geometrically).

properties.name: main_menu_simulations
properties.description: The strings represent the names of the simulations.

properties.name: module_inventory_width
properties.description: Must be in range [1, 100].

properties.name: normalised_achievement_icon_size
properties.description: Must be >= 1.

properties.name: player_colors
properties.description: The table with `name = "default"` must exist and be the first member of the array.

properties.name: select_group_row_count
properties.description: Must be in range [1, 100].

properties.name: select_slot_row_count
properties.description: Must be in range [1, 100].

properties.name: tooltip_monitor_edge_border
properties.description: Must be >= 1.

properties.name: tutorial_notice_icon_size
properties.description: Must be >= 1.

prototypes.name: UtilitySounds
prototypes.description: Sounds used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes.

prototypes.name: UtilitySprites
prototypes.description: Sprites used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes.

properties.name: fluid_icon
properties.description: The sprite will be drawn on top of [fluid turrets](prototype:FluidTurretPrototype) that are out of fluid ammunition and don't have [FluidTurretPrototype::out_of_ammo_alert_icon](prototype:FluidTurretPrototype::out_of_ammo_alert_icon) set.

prototypes.name: VehiclePrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract base of all vehicles.

properties.name: allow_passengers
properties.description: Determines whether this vehicle accepts passengers. This includes both drivers and gunners, if applicable.

properties.name: braking_power
properties.description: Must be positive. There is no functional difference between the two ways to set braking power/force.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: energy_per_hit_point
properties.description: The (movement) energy used per hit point (1 hit point = 1 health damage) taken and dealt for this vehicle during collisions. The smaller the number, the more damage this vehicle and the rammed entity take during collisions: `damage = energy / energy_per_hit_point`.

properties.name: equipment_grid
properties.description: The name of the [EquipmentGridPrototype](prototype:EquipmentGridPrototype) this vehicle has.

properties.name: friction
properties.description: Must be positive. There is no functional difference between the two ways to set friction force.

properties.name: minimap_representation
properties.description: The sprite that represents this vehicle on the map/minimap.

properties.name: selected_minimap_representation
properties.description: The sprite that represents this vehicle on the map/minimap when it is selected.

properties.name: sound_minimum_speed
properties.description: Must be positive. Sound is scaled by speed.

properties.name: sound_scaling_ratio
properties.description: Must be positive. Sound is scaled by speed.

properties.name: terrain_friction_modifier
properties.description: Must be in the [0, 1] interval.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: Must be positive. Weight of the entity used for physics calculation when car hits something.

prototypes.name: VirtualSignalPrototype
prototypes.description: A [virtual signal](https://wiki.factorio.com/Circuit_network#Virtual_signals).

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file that is used to represent this virtual signal.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description: Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined, or if `icon_size` is not specified for all instances of `icons`.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: The icon that is used to represent this virtual signal. Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: subgroup
properties.description: The name of a [ItemSubGroup](prototype:ItemSubGroup).

prototypes.name: WallPrototype
prototypes.description: A [wall](https://wiki.factorio.com/Wall).

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: visual_merge_group
properties.description: Different walls will visually connect to each other if their merge group is the same.

prototypes.name: WindSound
prototypes.description: A wind sound.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique textual identification of the prototype.

properties.name: sound
properties.description: The sound file and volume.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specification of the type of the prototype.

properties.name: equipment
properties.description: Activation is only implemented for [ActiveDefenseEquipmentPrototype](prototype:ActiveDefenseEquipmentPrototype).

properties.name: count_already_playing
properties.description: If `true`, already playing sounds are taken into account when checking `max_count`.

properties.name: progress_threshold
properties.description: If `count_already_playing` is `true`, this will determine maximum progress when instance is counted toward playing sounds.

types.name: AmmoCategoryID
types.description: The name of an [AmmoCategory](prototype:AmmoCategory).

properties.name: ammo_category
properties.description: Name of the [AmmoCategory](prototype:AmmoCategory) that is affected.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: modifier
properties.description: Modification value, which will be added to the current ammo damage modifier upon researching.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: AmmoSourceType
types.description:
Used to allow specifying different ammo effects depending on which kind of entity the ammo is used in.

If ammo is used in an entity that isn't covered by the defined source_types, e.g. only `"player"` and `"vehicle"` are defined and the ammo is used by a turret, the first defined AmmoType in the [AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type](prototype:AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type) array is used.

types.name: AmmoType
types.description: Definition of actual parameters used in attack.

properties.name: action
properties.description: Describes actions taken upon attack happening.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Name of a [AmmoCategory](prototype:AmmoCategory). Defines whether the attack will be affected by upgrades.

properties.name: clamp_position
properties.description: When true, the gun will be able to shoot even when the target is out of range. Only applies when `target_type` equals `"position"`. The gun will fire at the maximum range in the direction of the target position.

properties.name: energy_consumption
properties.description: Energy consumption of a single shot, if applicable.

properties.name: range_modifier
properties.description:
Affects the `range` value of the shooting gun prototype's [BaseAttackParameters](prototype:BaseAttackParameters) to give a modified maximum range. The `min_range` value of the gun is unaffected.

This has no effect on artillery turrets and wagons even though the bonus appears in the GUI. [Forum thread](https://forums.factorio.com/103658).

properties.name: source_type
properties.description:
Only exists (and is then mandatory) if the [AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type](prototype:AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type) this AmmoType is defined on has multiple ammo types.

Defines for which kind of entity this ammo type applies. Each entity kind can only be used once per array.

properties.name: target_type
properties.description:
`"entity"` fires at an entity, `"position"` fires directly at a position, `"direction"` fires in a direction.

If this is `"entity"`, `clamp_position` is forced to be `false`.

properties.name: triggers
properties.description: If all of the triggers are fulfilled, this trigger is considered fulfilled.

properties.name: render_layer
properties.description: Default render layer for the rotations.

types.name: Animation
types.description:
Specifies an animation that can be used in the game.

Note that if any frame of the animation is specified from the same source as any other [Sprite](prototype:Sprite) or frame of other animation, it will be shared.
examples:
```
-- simple animation
horizontal_animation =
{
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/steam-engine/steam-engine-H.png",
  width = 176,
  height = 128,
  frame_count = 32,
  line_length = 8,
  shift = {0.03125, -0.15625}
}
```

```
-- animation with hr version
horizontal_animation =
{
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/steam-engine/steam-engine-H.png",
  width = 176,
  height = 128,
  frame_count = 32,
  line_length = 8,
  shift = {0.03125, -0.15625},
  hr_version =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/steam-engine/hr-steam-engine-H.png",
    width = 352,
    height = 257,
    frame_count = 32,
    line_length = 8,
    shift = {0.03125, -0.1484375},
    scale = 0.5
  }
}
```

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `stripes` is not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the Animation.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Animation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

`animation_speed` and `max_advance` of the first layer are used for all layers. All layers will run at the same speed.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from AnimationParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: stripes
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

types.name: Animation4Way
types.description: If this is loaded as a single Animation, it applies to all directions.

properties.name: east
properties.description: Defaults to the north animation.

properties.name: south
properties.description: Defaults to the north animation.

properties.name: west
properties.description: Defaults to the east animation.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

types.name: AnimationFrameSequence
types.description:
This is a list of 1-based frame indices into the spritesheet. The actual length of the animation will then be the length of the frame_sequence (times `repeat_count`, times two if `run_mode` is `"forward-then-backward"`). There is a limit for (actual) animation length of 255 frames.

Indices can be used in any order, repeated or not used at all. Unused frames are not loaded into VRAM at all, frames referenced multiple times are loaded just once, see [here](https://forums.factorio.com/53202).
examples:
```
-- Trivial example - frame_sequence defines same sequence in which the animation would load by default,
-- so it is useless in this case:
frame_count = 4,
frame_sequence = { 1, 2, 3, 4 }
```

```
-- Usage example - first five times repeat frame 2, then alternate between 4 and 3 two times. Frame 1 is not used:
frame_count = 4,
frame_sequence = { 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 4, 3, 4, 3 }
```

properties.name: animation_speed
properties.description: Modifier of the animation playing speed, the default of `1` means one animation frame per tick (60 fps). The speed of playing can often vary depending on the usage (output of steam engine for example). Has to be greater than `0`.

properties.name: dice
properties.description: Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 4×4 grid.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description: Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description: Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: frame_count
properties.description: Can't be `0`.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.
