Height of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Specifies how many pictures are on each horizontal line in the image file. `0` means that all the pictures are in one horizontal line. Once the specified number of pictures are loaded from a line, the pictures from the next line are loaded. This is to allow having longer animations loaded in to Factorio's graphics matrix than the game engine's width limit of 8192px per input file. The restriction on input files is to be compatible with most graphics cards.

properties.name: max_advance
properties.description: Maximum amount of frames the animation can move forward in one update. Useful to cap the animation speed on entities where it is variable, such as car animations.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if this is an icon, that is it has the flag `"group=icon"` or `"group=gui"`.

Note that `mipmap_count` doesn't make sense in an animation, as it is not possible to layout mipmaps in a way that would load both the animation and the mipmaps correctly (besides animations with just one frame). See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=549058#p549058).

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description: How many times to repeat the animation to complete an animation cycle. E.g. if one layer is 10 frames, a second layer of 1 frame would need `repeat_count = 10` to match the complete cycle.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The width and height of one frame. If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height. Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Width of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the AnimationSheet.

types.name: AnimationVariations
examples:
```
-- array of animations
animations =
{
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/explosion-gunshot/explosion-gunshot.png",
    draw_as_glow = true,
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 34,
    height = 38,
    frame_count = 2,
    animation_speed = 1.5,
    shift = {0, 0}
  },
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/explosion-gunshot/explosion-gunshot.png",
    draw_as_glow = true,
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 34,
    height = 38,
    x = 34 * 2,
    frame_count = 2,
    animation_speed = 1.5,
    shift = {0, 0}
  },
  -- [...]
}
```

```
-- animation sheet using "sheet"
pictures =
{
  sheet =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/character/footprints.png",
    line_length = 2,
    frame_count = 2,
    width = 15,
    height = 11,
    shift = util.by_pixel(0.5, 0.5),
    variation_count = 8,
    hr_version =
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/character/hr-footprints.png",
      line_length = 2,
      frame_count = 2,
      width = 30,
      height = 22,
      shift = util.by_pixel(0.25, 0.25),
      scale = 0.5,
      variation_count = 8
    }
  }
}
```

properties.name: sheet
properties.description: The variations are arranged vertically in the file, one row for each variation.

properties.name: sheets
properties.description: Only loaded if `sheet` is not defined.

types.name: AnyPrototype
types.description:
A union of all prototypes. A specific prototype is loaded based on the value of the `type` key.

See the [Prototypes page](prototype:prototypes) for more information.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: flare
properties.description: Name of an [ArtilleryFlarePrototype](prototype:ArtilleryFlarePrototype).

properties.name: direction_deviation
properties.description: Maximum deviation of the projectile from source orientation, in +/- (`x radians / 2`). Example: `3.14 radians -> +/- (180° / 2)`, meaning up to 90° deviation in either direction of rotation.

properties.name: projectile
properties.description: Name of a [ArtilleryProjectilePrototype](prototype:ArtilleryProjectilePrototype).

types.name: AttackParameters
types.description: Loaded as one of the [BaseAttackParameters](prototype:BaseAttackParameters) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: AutoplaceControlID
types.description: The name of an [AutoplaceControl](prototype:AutoplaceControl).

properties.name: aux_max_range
properties.description:
Distance from the optimal parameters that get influence of -1.

Only loaded if `aux_optimal` is defined.

properties.name: aux_optimal
properties.description:
Optimal value of aux. If aux is close to this value, peak influence is 1.

aux corresponds to the `aux` [noise expression](prototype:BaseNamedNoiseExpressions).

properties.name: aux_range
properties.description:
Distance from the optimal parameters that is still considered optimal.

Only loaded if `aux_optimal` is defined.

properties.name: aux_top_property_limit
properties.description:

Only loaded if `distance_optimal` is defined.

distance corresponds to the `distance` [noise expression](prototype:BaseNamedNoiseExpressions).

properties.name: distance_range
properties.description:
Distance from the optimal parameters that is still considered optimal.

Only loaded if `distance_optimal` is defined.

properties.name: distance_top_property_limit
properties.description:
Limit distance from the optimum on a single (positive) side. This is pure magic.

Only loaded if `distance_optimal` is defined.

Distance from the optimal parameters that get influence of -1.

Only loaded if `elevation_optimal` is defined.

elevation corresponds to the `elevation` [noise expression](prototype:BaseNamedNoiseExpressions).

Distance from the optimal parameters that is still considered optimal.

Only loaded if `elevation_optimal` is defined.

properties.name: elevation_top_property_limit
properties.description:
Limit distance from the optimum on a single (positive) side. This is pure magic.

properties.name: influence
properties.description:
Influence multiplier.

Influence is calculated as a sum of influences of peaks. Influence of a peak is obtained by calculating a distance from each of its dimensions and sum of these individual distances is used as a distance from optimal conditions. Based on this distance a peak gets influence between -1 and 1. This is then multiplied by the noise function, if it is specified, and by the `influence` constant (or by `influence` + `richness_influence` if calculating richness). Finally this value is clamped to a range between `min_influence` and `max_influence`.

When [AutoplaceSpecification::starting_area_amount](prototype:AutoplaceSpecification::starting_area_amount) is non-zero a position in starting area is selected and a blob is placed centered on this position. Influence is then a maximum of the default calculated value and a value obtained from this blob.

properties.name: max_influence
properties.description: Maximal influence (after all calculations) of current peak. See `influence`.

properties.name: min_influence
properties.description: Minimal influence (after all calculations) of current peak. See `influence`.

properties.name: noise_layer
properties.description:
Name of [NoiseLayer](prototype:NoiseLayer) to use for this peak. If empty, then no noise is added to this peak.

A peak may have a noise multiplied with its influence. Intended use is to have noise layers separate for different types of objects that might appear (trees-12 vs enemy-base).

properties.name: noise_octaves_difference
properties.description: Difference between number of octaves of the world and of the noise.

properties.name: noise_persistence
properties.description: Must be between 0 and 1. Persistence of the noise.

properties.name: richness_influence
properties.description: Bonus for influence multiplier when calculating richness. See `influence`.

properties.name: starting_area_weight_max_range
properties.description:
Distance from the optimal parameters that get influence of -1.

Only loaded if `starting_area_weight_optimal` is defined.

properties.name: starting_area_weight_optimal
properties.description:
Optimal value of starting_area_weight. If starting_area_weight is close to this value, peak influence is 1.

starting_area_weight corresponds to the `starting_area_weight` [noise expression](prototype:BaseNamedNoiseExpressions).

properties.name: starting_area_weight_range

Distance from the optimal parameters that is still considered optimal.

Only loaded if `starting_area_weight_optimal` is defined.

properties.name: starting_area_weight_top_property_limit

properties.name: settings
properties.description: Overrides the FrequencySizeRichness provided to the [AutoplaceSpecification](prototype:AutoplaceSpecification) of the entity/tile/decorative. Takes priority over the FrequencySizeRichness set in the [autoplace control](prototype:AutoplaceSpecification::control).

properties.name: treat_missing_as_default
properties.description: Whether missing autoplace names for this type should be default enabled.

types.name: AutoplaceSpecification
types.description:
Autoplace specification is used to determine which entities are placed when generating map. Currently it is used for enemy bases, tiles, resources and other entities (trees, fishes, etc.).

Autoplace specification describe conditions for placing tiles, entities, and decoratives during surface generation. Autoplace specification defines probability of placement on any given tile and richness, which has different meaning depending on the thing being placed.

There are two entirely separate ways to specify the probability and richness:

- The newer noise expression-based system using `probability_expression` and `richness_expression`.

- The older peaks-based system using `peaks` and the properties listed below it.

properties.name: control
properties.description: Name of the [AutoplaceControl](prototype:AutoplaceControl) (row in the map generator GUI) that applies to this entity.

properties.name: coverage
properties.description: Sets a fraction of surface that should be covered by this item.

properties.name: default_enabled
properties.description:
Indicates whether the thing should be placed even if [MapGenSettings](runtime:MapGenSettings) do not provide frequency/size/richness for it. (either for the specific prototype or for the control named by AutoplaceSpecification.control).

If true, normal frequency/size/richness (`value=1`) are used in that case. Otherwise it is treated as if 'none' were selected.

properties.name: force
properties.description: Force of the placed entity. Can be a custom force name. Only relevant for [EntityWithOwnerPrototype](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype).

properties.name: max_probability
properties.description:
Multiplier for output of the sharpness filter.

Probability is calculated as `max_probability * sharpness_filter(sum of influences and size modifier from GUI) - random(0, random_probability_penalty)`.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Order for placing the entity (has no effect when placing tiles). Entities whose order compares less are placed earlier (this influences placing multiple entities which collide with itself), from entities with equal order string only one with the highest probability is placed.

properties.name: placement_density
properties.description: For entities and decoratives, how many times to attempt to place on each tile. Probability and collisions are taken into account each attempt.

properties.name: probability_expression
properties.description:
If specified, provides a noise expression that will be evaluated at every point on the map to determine probability.

If left blank, probability is determined by the `peaks` system based on the properties listed below.

properties.name: random_probability_penalty
properties.description: A random value between `0` and this number is subtracted from a probability after sharpness filter. Only works for entities.

properties.name: richness_base
properties.description:
Base Richness. It is calculated as `sum of influences * (richness_multiplier + distance * richness_multiplier_distance_bonus) + richness_base`.

Note, that when calculating richness, influences of individual peaks use [AutoplacePeak::richness_influence](prototype:AutoplacePeak::richness_influence) bonus.

properties.name: richness_expression
properties.description:
If specified, provides a noise expression that will be evaluated to determine richness.

If probability_expression is specified and `richness_expression` is not, then `probability_expression` will be used as the richness expression.

If neither are specified, then probability and richness are both determined by the `peaks` system based on the properties listed below.

properties.name: richness_multiplier
properties.description: See `richness_base`.

properties.name: richness_multiplier_distance_bonus
properties.description: Bonus to richness multiplier per tile of distance from starting point. See `richness_base`.

properties.name: sharpness
properties.description: Parameter of the sharpness filter for post-processing probability of entity placement. Value of `0` disables the filter, with value `1`, the filter is a step function centered around `0.5`.

images.caption: Example of sharpness filter with value 0.5.

properties.name: starting_area_amount
properties.description:
If this value is non zero, influence of this entity will be calculated differently in starting area: For each entity with this parameter a position in starting area is selected and a blob is placed centered on this position. The central tile of this blob will have approximately amount of resources selected by this value.

See [AutoplacePeak::influence](prototype:AutoplacePeak::influence) for the general influence calculation.

properties.name: starting_area_size
properties.description: See `starting_area_amount`. Controls approximate radius of the blob in tiles.

properties.name: tile_restriction
properties.description: Restricts tiles or tile transitions the entity can appear on.

types.name: BaseAttackParameters
types.description: The abstract base of all [AttackParameters](prototype:AttackParameters).

properties.name: activation_type
properties.description:
Used in tooltips to set the tooltip category. It is also used to get the locale keys for activation instructions and speed of the action for the tooltip.

For example, an activation_type of "throw" will result in the tooltip category "thrown" and the tooltip locale keys "gui.instruction-to-throw" and "description.throwing-speed".

properties.name: ammo_category
properties.description: Mandatory if both `ammo_type` and `ammo_categories` are not defined.

properties.name: ammo_consumption_modifier
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to `0`.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description: Can be mandatory.

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: Number of ticks in which it will be possible to shoot again. If < 1, multiple shots can be performed in one tick.

properties.name: cooldown_deviation
properties.description: Must be between `0` and `1`.

properties.name: cyclic_sound
properties.description: Played during the attack.

properties.name: fire_penalty
properties.description: Used when searching for the nearest enemy, when this is > 0, enemies that aren't burning are preferred over burning enemies. Definition of "burning" for this: Entity has sticker attached to it, and the sticker has a [spread_fire_entity](prototype:StickerPrototype::spread_fire_entity) set.

properties.name: health_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units with higher health. A negative penalty will encourage turrets to target units with higher health.

properties.name: lead_target_for_projectile_speed
properties.description: Setting this to anything but zero causes homing projectiles to aim for the predicted location based on enemy movement instead of the current enemy location.
examples:
```
-- this is same as particle horizontal speed of flamethrower fire stream
lead_target_for_projectile_speed = 0.2* 0.75 * 1.5
```

properties.name: min_attack_distance
properties.description: If less than `range`, the entity will choose a random distance between `range` and `min_attack_distance` and attack from that distance.

properties.name: min_range
properties.description: The minimum distance (in tiles) between an entity and target. If a unit's target is less than this, the unit will attempt to move away before attacking. A [flamethrower turret](https://wiki.factorio.com/Flamethrower_turret) does not move, but has a minimum range. Less than this, it is unable to target an enemy.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Before an entity can attack, the distance (in tiles) between the entity and target must be less than or equal to this.

properties.name: rotate_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units that would take longer to turn to face.

properties.name: sound
properties.description: Played once at the start of the attack if these are [ProjectileAttackParameters](prototype:ProjectileAttackParameters).

properties.name: turn_range
properties.description: If this is <= 0, it is set to 1. Arc from 0 to 1, so for example 0.25 is 90°. Used by the [flamethrower turret](https://wiki.factorio.com/Flamethrower_turret) in the base game. Arcs greater than 0.5 but less than 1 will be clamped to 0.5 as targeting in arcs larger than half circle is [not implemented](https://forums.factorio.com/94654).

properties.name: warmup
properties.description:
Number of ticks it takes for the weapon to actually shoot after the order for shooting has been made. This also allows to "adjust" the shooting animation to the effect of shooting.

[CapsuleActions](prototype:CapsuleAction) cannot have attack parameters with non-zero warmup.

types.name: BaseEnergySource
types.description: The abstract base of all [EnergySources](prototype:EnergySource). Specifies the way an entity gets its energy.

properties.name: emissions_per_minute
properties.description: The pollution an entity emits per minute at full energy consumption. This is exactly the value that is shown in the entity tooltip.

properties.name: render_no_network_icon
properties.description: Whether to render the "no network" icon if the entity is not connected to an electric network.

properties.name: render_no_power_icon
properties.description: Whether to render the "no power" icon if the entity is low on power. Also applies to the "no fuel" icon when using burner energy sources.

types.name: BaseModifier
types.description: The abstract base of all [Modifiers](prototype:Modifier).

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description: Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined, or if `icon_size` is not specified for all instances of `icons`.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

types.name: BaseNamedNoiseExpressions
types.description:
A list of notable [NamedNoiseExpressions](prototype:NamedNoiseExpression) defined in the base game. A list of all named noise expression defined in the base game can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#noise-expression).

Note that the named noise expressions are all defined in Lua, so mods may remove or change the notable expressions listed here, or change how they are used in the map generation.

options.description: `noise.distance_from(noise.var("x"), noise.var("y"), noise.var("starting_positions"))`, so the distance from the closest starting position. distance is never `< 0`.
A value between `0` and `1` that determines whether a tile becomes sandy (low moisture) or grassy (high moisture).
A value between `0` and `1` that determines whether low-moisture tiles become sand or red desert.
Provides a value (vaguely representing degrees Celsius, varying between `-20` and `50`) that is used (together with moisture and aux) as part of tree and decorative placement.
Tiles values less than zero become water. Cliffs are placed along certain contours according to [CliffPlacementSettings](prototype:CliffPlacementSettings).
Determines whether (when `>0.5`) or not (when `<0.5`) a cliff will be placed at an otherwise suitable (according to [CliffPlacementSettings](prototype:CliffPlacementSettings)) location.

Is referenced by both `enemy-base-frequency` and `enemy-base-radius`. If this is overridden, enemy base frequency and size will both be affected and do something reasonable. By default, this expression returns a value proportional to distance from any starting point, clamped at about `7`.
Represents average number of enemy bases per tile for a region, by default in terms of `enemy-base-intensity`.
Represents the radius of an enemy base, if one were to be placed on the given tile, by default proportional to a constant plus `enemy-base-intensity`.

types.name: BaseStyleSpecification
types.description: The abstract base of all [StyleSpecifications](prototype:StyleSpecification).
examples:
```
-- Adding a custom frame_style-type style via GuiStyle
data.raw["gui-style"]["default"]["custom_style_for_a_frame"] =
{
  type = "frame_style",
  parent = "frame",
  use_header_filler = false,
  drag_by_title = false
}
```

properties.name: effect
properties.description: Name of a custom GUI effect, which are hard-coded in the game's engine. Only has one option currently.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sets `minimal_height`, `maximal_height` and `natural_height` to the same value.

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Sets `top_margin`, `right_margin`, `bottom_margin` and `left_margin` to the same value.

properties.name: maximal_height
properties.description: Maximal height ensures that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

properties.name: maximal_width
properties.description: Maximal width ensures that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

properties.name: minimal_height
properties.description: Minimal height ensures that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

properties.name: minimal_width
properties.description: Minimal width ensures that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

properties.name: natural_height
properties.description: Natural height specifies the height of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a different size.

properties.name: natural_size
properties.description: If this is a tuple, the first member sets `natural_width` and the second sets `natural_height`. Otherwise, both `natural_width` and `natural_height` are set to the same value.

properties.name: natural_width
properties.description: Natural width specifies the width of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a different size.

properties.name: padding
properties.description: Sets `top_padding`, `right_padding`, `bottom_padding` and `left_padding` to the same value.

properties.name: parent
properties.description:
Name of a [StyleSpecification](prototype:StyleSpecification). This style inherits all property values from its parent.

Styles without a parent property default to the root style for their type. The exception to this are the root styles themselves, as they cannot have a parent set. Due to this, for root styles, some style properties are mandatory and behavior may be unexpected, such as an element not showing up because its size defaults to `0`.

properties.name: size
properties.description: If this is a tuple, the first member sets `width`, and the second sets `height`. Otherwise, both `width` and `height` are set to the same value.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets `minimal_width`, `maximal_width` and `natural_width` to the same value.

properties.name: apply_module_tint
properties.description: Which tint set in [ModulePrototype::beacon_tint](prototype:ModulePrototype::beacon_tint) should be applied to this, if any.

properties.name: apply_module_tint_to_light
properties.description: Which tint set in [ModulePrototype::beacon_tint](prototype:ModulePrototype::beacon_tint) should be applied to the light, if any.

properties.name: module_visualisations
properties.description: The visualisations available for displaying the modules in the beacon. The visualisation is chosen based on art style, see [BeaconModuleVisualizations::art_style](prototype:BeaconModuleVisualizations::art_style) and [ModulePrototype::art_style](prototype:ModulePrototype::art_style).

properties.name: apply_module_tint
properties.description: Which tint set in [ModulePrototype::beacon_tint](prototype:ModulePrototype::beacon_tint) should be applied to this, if any.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

properties.name: art_style
properties.description: The visualization is chosen based on the [ModulePrototype::art_style](prototype:ModulePrototype::art_style), meaning if module art style equals beacon module visualization art style then this visualization is chosen. Vanilla uses `"vanilla"` here.

properties.name: slots
properties.description: The outer array contains the different slots, the inner array contains the different layers for those slots (with different tints etc). Example:

properties.name: beam
properties.description: Name of a [BeamPrototype](prototype:BeamPrototype).

types.name: BlendMode
types.description:
Determines how sprites/animations should blend with the background. The possible values are listed below.

Note that in most of Factorio it is assumed colors are in alpha pre-multiplied format, see [FFF #172 - Blending and Rendering](https://www.factorio.com/blog/post/fff-172). Sprites get pre-multiplied when loaded, unless `premul_alpha` is set to `false` on the sprite/animation itself. Since generating mipmaps doesn't respect `premul_alpha`, lower mipmap levels will be in pre-multiplied format regardless.

options.description: The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB + Background_RGB * ( 1 - Active_Alpha )`. Note that this is alpha blending with an assumption that `Active_RGB` is already pre-multiplied with `Active_Alpha`.
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB + Background_RGB`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB * ( 1 - Background_RGB ) + Background_RGB`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB * Background_RGB`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB * Background_RGB * Active_Alpha + Background_RGB * ( 1 - Active_Alpha )`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGBA or Background_RGBA`

types.name: BoilerFire
types.description: The table itself is required, but it can be empty.

types.name: BoilerFireGlow
types.description: The table itself is required, but it can be empty.

properties.name: modifier
properties.description: The value this modifier will have upon researching.

types.name: BoundingBox
types.description:
BoundingBoxes are typically centered around the position of an entity.

The first position is leftTop, the second position is rightBottom. There is an unused third member, a [float](prototype:float) that represents the orientation.

Positive x goes towards east, positive y goes towards south. This means that the upper-left point is the least dimension in x and y, and lower-right is the greatest.

types.name: BoxSpecification
types.description: A cursor box, for use in [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites).

properties.name: is_whole_box
properties.description: Whether this is a complete box or just the top left corner. If this is true, `side_length` and `side_height` must be present. Otherwise `max_side_length` must be present.

properties.name: max_side_length
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `is_whole_box` is `false`.

properties.name: side_height
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `is_whole_box` is `true`.

properties.name: side_length
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `is_whole_box` is `true`.

properties.name: consecutive
properties.description: Building is considered consecutive when the built entity is the same as the last built entity.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: `1` means 100% effectivity. Must be greater than `0`. Multiplier of the energy output.

properties.name: fuel_categories
properties.description: The energy source can be used with fuel from these [fuel categories](prototype:FuelCategory).

properties.name: fuel_category
properties.description:
The energy source can be used with fuel from this [fuel category](prototype:FuelCategory). For a list of built-in categories, see [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#fuel-category).

Only loaded if `fuel_categories` is not defined.

properties.name: type
properties.description: This is only loaded, and mandatory if the energy source can be loaded as multiple energy source types.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: effect
properties.description: Required, read by the game and then immediately discarded. In short: Does nothing.

types.name: CapsuleAction
types.description: Loaded as one of the capsule actions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: CharacterArmorAnimation
types.description: The data for one variation of [character animations](prototype:CharacterPrototype::animations).

properties.name: armors
properties.description: The names of the armors this animation data is used for. Don't define this if you want the animations to be used for the player without armor.

properties.name: flipped_shadow_running_with_gun
properties.description: flipped_shadow_running_with_gun must be nil or contain exactly 18 directions, so all of the combination of gun direction and moving direction can be covered. Some of these variations are used in reverse to save space. You can use the character animation in the base game for reference. `flipped_shadow_running_with_gun` has to have same frame count as `running_with_gun`.

properties.name: running_with_gun
properties.description: Must contain exactly 18 directions, so all of the combination of gun direction and moving direction can be covered. Some of these variations are used in reverse to save space. You can use the character animation in the base game for reference.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.description: Elevation at which the first row of cliffs is placed. Can not be set from the map generation GUI.

properties.name: cliff_elevation_interval
properties.description: Elevation difference between successive rows of cliffs. This is inversely proportional to 'frequency' in the map generation GUI. Specifically, when set from the GUI the value is `40 / frequency`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the [CliffPrototype](prototype:CliffPrototype).

properties.name: richness
properties.description: Corresponds to 'continuity' in the GUI. This value is not used directly, but is used by the 'cliffiness' noise expression, which in combination with elevation and the two cliff elevation properties drives cliff placement (cliffs are placed when elevation crosses the elevation contours defined by `cliff_elevation_0` and `cliff_elevation_interval` when 'cliffiness' is greater than `0.5`). The default 'cliffiness' expression interprets this value such that larger values result in longer unbroken walls of cliffs, and smaller values (between `0` and `1`) result in larger gaps in cliff walls.

properties.name: cluster_count
properties.description: Must be at least `2`.

types.name: CollisionMask
types.description:
Every entry in the array is a specification of one layer the object collides with or a special collision option. Supplying an empty table means that no layers and no collision options are set.

The default collision masks of all entity types can be found [here](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_mask). The base game provides common collision mask functions in a Lua file in the core [lualib](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/core/lualib/collision-mask-util.lua).

Supplying an empty array means that no layers and no collision options are set.

The three options in addition to the standard layers are not collision masks, instead they control other aspects of collision.
examples:
```
-- Most common collision mask of buildings:
collision_mask = { "item-layer", "object-layer", "player-layer", "water-tile"}
```

options.description: Any two entities that both have this option enabled on their prototype and have an identical collision mask layers list will not collide. Other collision mask options are not included in the identical layer list check. This does mean that two different prototypes with the same collision mask layers and this option enabled will not collide.

Uses the prototypes position rather than its collision box when doing collision checks with tile prototypes. Allows the prototype to overlap colliding tiles up until its center point. This is only respected for character movement and cars driven by players.
Any prototype with this collision option will only be checked for collision with other prototype's collision masks if they are a tile.

types.name: CollisionMaskLayer
types.description:
A string specifying a collision mask layer.

In addition to the listed layers, there is `"layer-13"` through `"layer-55"`. These layers are currently unused by the game but may change. If a mod is going to use one of the unused layers it's recommended to use the `collision_mask_util.get_first_unused_layer()` method from the vanilla [library](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/core/lualib/collision-mask-util.lua). When not using the library, mods should start at the higher layers because the base game will take from the lower ones.

types.name: Color
types.description:
Table of red, green, blue, and alpha float values between 0 and 1. Alternatively, values can be from 0-255, they are interpreted as such if at least one value is `> 1`.

Color allows the short-hand notation of passing an array of exactly 3 or 4 numbers. The array items are r, g, b and optionally a, in that order.

The game usually expects colors to be in pre-multiplied form (color channels are pre-multiplied by alpha).
examples:
```
color = {r=1, g=0, b=0, a=1} -- red, full opacity
color = {r=1} -- the same red, omitting default values
color = {1, 0, 0, 1} -- also the same red
color = {0, 0, 1} -- blue
color = {r=0, g=0.5, b=0, a=0.5} -- half transparency green
color = {} -- full opacity black
```

properties.name: a
properties.description: alpha value (opacity)

properties.name: b
properties.description: blue value

properties.name: g
properties.description: green value

properties.name: r
properties.description: red value

properties.name: matrix
properties.description: 4 arrays of 4-length float arrays, essentially a 4x4 matrix.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column index.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column index.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets `minimal_width` and `maximal_width` to the same value.

types.name: ConnectableEntityGraphics
types.description: Graphics for the heat pipe.

types.name: ConstantNoiseBoolean
types.description: A constant boolean noise expression, such as a literal boolean. When using a constant number, it evaluates to true for numbers bigger than zero, anything else evaluates to false.

types.name: ConstantNoiseNumber
types.description: A constant numeric noise expression, such as a literal number, the result of addition of constants or multioctave noise that uses only constant arguments.

types.name: ConsumingType
types.description: Defines which other inputs a [CustomInputPrototype](prototype:CustomInputPrototype) consumes.

options.description: The associated script event will fire when satisfied and pass through to normal game events.
The associated script event will fire when satisfied and block game events that conflict with the key sequence. Actions that are processed regardless of game paused state cannot be blocked.

properties.name: consecutive
properties.description: Can only be used when `event_type` is `"crafting-finished"`.

types.name: CraftingMachineTint
types.description: If no tint is specified, the crafting machine falls back to [CraftingMachinePrototype::default_recipe_tint](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype::default_recipe_tint).

properties.name: spawn_max_radius
properties.description: Must be less than 24.

properties.name: entity_name
properties.description: The name of the entity that should be created.

properties.name: offsets
properties.description: If multiple offsets are specified, multiple entities are created. The projectile of the [Distractor capsule](https://wiki.factorio.com/Distractor_capsule) uses this property to spawn three Distractors.

properties.name: tile_collision_mask
properties.description: Entity creation will not occur if any tile matches the collision condition. Defaults to no collisions.

properties.name: trigger_created_entity
properties.description: If `true`, the [on_trigger_created_entity](runtime:on_trigger_created_entity) event will be raised.

properties.name: tail_length
properties.description: Silently capped to a maximum of 100.

properties.name: tail_length_deviation
properties.description: Silently capped to a maximum of 100.

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: Name of a [StickerPrototype](prototype:StickerPrototype) that should be created.

properties.name: trigger_created_entity
properties.description: If `true`, [on_trigger_created_entity](runtime:on_trigger_created_entity) will be triggered when the sticker is created.

types.name: CursorBoxType
types.description: One of the following values:

options.description: The normal entity selection box. Yellow by default.
The selection box used to specify electric poles an entity is connected to. Light blue by default.
The selection box used when doing entity copy-paste. Green by default.
The selection box used when specifying colliding entities. Red by default.

types.name: CyclicSound
types.description: Used by [BaseAttackParameters](prototype:BaseAttackParameters) to play a sound during the attack.

properties.name: begin_sound
properties.description: Played once at the beginning of the overall cyclic sound.

properties.name: end_sound
properties.description: Played once when the overall cyclic sound is requested to end.

properties.name: middle_sound
properties.description: Played repeatedly after the begin_sound was played.

types.name: DamagePrototype
types.description: A property type, NOT a prototype. Used to specify what type of damage and how much damage something deals.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of damage. See [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#damage-type) for a list of built-in types, and [DamageType](prototype:DamageType) for creating custom types.

properties.name: vaporize
properties.description: If `true`, no corpse for killed entities will be created.

types.name: DamageTypeFilters
examples:
```
damage_type_filters = { "fire" } -- more damage types could be specified here
```

```
damage_type_filters =
{
  whitelist = false, -- optional
  types = { "fire" } -- more damage types could be specified here
}
```

properties.name: types
properties.description: The damage types to filter for.

properties.name: whitelist
properties.description: Whether this is a whitelist or a blacklist of damage types. Defaults to being a blacklist.

types.name: DamageTypeID
types.description: The name of a [DamageType](prototype:DamageType).

types.name: Data
types.description:
The data table is read by the game to load all prototypes.

At the end of the prototype stage, the data table is loaded by the game engine and the format of the prototypes is validated. Any extra properties are ignored. See [Data Lifecycle](runtime:data-lifecycle) for more information.

The data table and its properties are defined in Lua, so their source code can be viewed in [dataloader.lua](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/core/lualib/dataloader.lua).

properties.name: extend
properties.description: The primary way to add prototypes to the data table.
examples:
```
local not_coal =
{
  type = "item",
  name = "a-thing",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/coal.png",
  icon_size = 64,
  stack_size = 2
}
local proto2 =
{
  type = "fuel-category",
  name = "best-fuel"
}
data:extend({not_coal, proto2})
```

properties.name: is_demo
properties.description: Set by the game based on whether the demo or retail version is running. Should not be used by mods.

properties.name: raw
properties.description:
A dictionary of prototype types to values that themselves are dictionaries of prototype names to specific prototypes.

This means that individual prototypes can be accessed with `local prototype = data.raw["prototype-type"]["internal-name"]`.
examples:
```
-- set the stack size of coal to be 1000
data.raw["item"]["coal"].stack_size = 1000
```

```
-- get the max health of the wooden chest
local health = data.raw["container"]["wooden-chest"].max_health
```

types.name: DataExtendMethod
types.description:
The data.extend method. It's the primary way to add prototypes to the data table.

The method has two positional function parameters:

- `self` :: [Data](prototype:Data): Usually provided by calling `data:extend(otherdata)`, which is syntax sugar for `data.extend(data, otherdata)`.

- `otherdata` :: array[[AnyPrototype](prototype:AnyPrototype)]: A continuous array of non-abstract prototypes.
examples:
```
local recipe_cat =
{
  type = "recipe-category",
  name = "my-category"
}
local assembler =
{
  type = "assembling-machine",
  name = "cool-assembler",
  energy_usage = "30kW",
  energy_source = {type = "void"},
  crafting_speed = 1,
  crafting_categories = {"crafting"}
}

data:extend({recipe_cat, assembler})
```

types.name: DaytimeColorLookupTable
types.description:
The first member of the tuple states at which time of the day the LUT should be used. If the current game time is between two values defined in the color lookup that have different LUTs, the color is interpolated to create a smooth transition. (Sharp transition can be achieved by having the two values differing only by a small fraction.)

If there is only one tuple, it means that the LUT will be used all the time, regardless of the value of the first member of the tuple.

The second member of the tuple is a lookup table (LUT) for the color which maps the original color to a position in the sprite where is the replacement color is found. The file pointed to by the filename must be a sprite of size 256×16.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: DecorativeID
types.description: The name of a [DecorativePrototype](prototype:DecorativePrototype).

types.name: DependenciesMetTipTrigger
types.description: This trigger is considered fulfilled when the [TipsAndTricksItem::dependencies](prototype:TipsAndTricksItem::dependencies) are fulfilled.

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

properties.name: decoratives_with_trigger_only
properties.description: If `true`, only decoratives with a [DecorativePrototype::trigger_effect](prototype:DecorativePrototype::trigger_effect) will be destroyed.

properties.name: include_soft_decoratives
properties.description: Soft decoratives are those where [DecorativePrototype::grows_through_rail_path](prototype:DecorativePrototype::grows_through_rail_path) is `true`.

properties.name: recipe_difficulty
properties.description: A [defines.difficulty_settings.recipe_difficulty](runtime:defines.difficulty_settings.recipe_difficulty).

properties.name: technology_difficulty
properties.description: A [defines.difficulty_settings.technology_difficulty](runtime:defines.difficulty_settings.technology_difficulty).

types.name: Effect
types.description: When applied to modules, the resulting effect is a sum of all module affects, multiplied through calculations: `(1 + sum module effects)` or, for productivity `(0 + sum)`.

properties.name: consumption
properties.description: Multiplier to energy used during operation (not idle/drain use). The minimum possible sum is -80%.

properties.name: pollution
properties.description: Multiplier to the pollution factor of an entity's pollution during use. The minimum possible sum is -80%.

properties.name: productivity
properties.description: Multiplied against work completed, adds to the bonus results of operating. E.g. an extra crafted recipe or immediate research bonus. The minimum possible sum is 0%.

properties.name: speed
properties.description: Modifier to crafting speed, research speed, etc. The minimum possible sum is -80%.

types.name: EffectTypeLimitation
types.description: A list of module effects, or just a single effect. Modules with other effects cannot be used on the machine. This means that both effects from modules and from surrounding beacons are restricted to the listed effects. If `allowed_effects` is set to `nil`, the machine cannot be affected by modules or beacons.
examples:
```
-- Allow only modules that affect speed
allowed_effects = "speed"
```

options.description: Modules that increase or decrease the machine's speed.
Modules that make the machine produce bonus items.
Modules that increase or decrease the machine's energy consumption.
Modules that make the machine produce more or less pollution.
Modules that increase or decrease the machine's speed.
Modules that make the machine produce bonus items.
Modules that increase or decrease the machine's energy consumption.
Modules that make the machine produce more or less pollution.

properties.name: bonus
properties.description: Precision is ignored beyond two decimals - `0.567` results in `0.56` etc.

types.name: ElectricEnergySource
examples:
```
energy_source = -- energy source of oil pumpjack
{
  type = "electric",
  emissions_per_minute = 10,
  usage_priority = "secondary-input"
}
```

```
energy_source = -- energy source of accumulator
{
  type = "electric",
  buffer_capacity = "5MJ",
  usage_priority = "tertiary",
  input_flow_limit = "300kW",
  output_flow_limit = "300kW"
}
```

```
energy_source = -- energy source of steam engine
{
  type = "electric",
  usage_priority = "secondary-output"
}
```

properties.name: buffer_capacity
properties.description: How much energy this entity can hold.

properties.name: drain
properties.description: How much energy (per second) will be continuously removed from the energy buffer. In-game, this is shown in the tooltip as "Min. [Minimum] Consumption". Applied as a constant consumption-per-tick, even when the entity has the property [active](runtime:LuaEntity::active) set to `false`.

properties.name: input_flow_limit
properties.description: The rate at which energy can be taken, from the network, to refill the energy buffer. `0` means no transfer.

properties.name: output_flow_limit
properties.description: The rate at which energy can be provided, to the network, from the energy buffer. `0` means no transfer.

properties.name: type
properties.description: This is only loaded, and mandatory if the energy source can be loaded as multiple energy source types.

types.name: ElectricUsagePriority
types.description: Used to specify priority of energy usage in the [electric system](https://wiki.factorio.com/Electric_system).

options.description: Used for the most important machines, for example laser turrets.
As input/output used for accumulators, to collect the overproduction or provide energy when neither primary/secondary output can't.
Can only be used by [SolarPanelPrototype](prototype:SolarPanelPrototype), will be ignored otherwise.
Can only be used by [LampPrototype](prototype:LampPrototype), will be ignored otherwise.

types.name: ElementImageSet
types.description: If this is loaded as a single ElementImageSetLayer, it gets used as `base`.

types.name: ElementImageSetLayer
types.description: If this is loaded as a Sprite, it gets used as `center`.

images.caption: How the sprites are laid out graphically when using a composition type element image set layer.
How the sprites are stretched when using a composition type element image set layer.

properties.name: border
properties.description:
Sets `top_border`, `right_border`, `bottom_border` and `left_border`.

Only loaded if `corner_size` is not defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: bottom_border
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: bottom_width
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: center
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: center_height
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: center_width
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: corner_size
properties.description:
If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is width and the second is height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

images.caption: In base game, the corner size is 8 and the sides are 1px long and 8px wide.

properties.name: draw_type
properties.description: Defines whether the border should be drawn inside the widget, which affects the padding and content size of the widget, or outside of the widget which doesn't affect size. The outer draw type is most commonly used for shadows, glows and insets.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: left
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: left_border
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: left_bottom
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: left_height
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: left_tiling
properties.description: Tiling is used to make a side (not corner) texture repeat instead of being stretched.

properties.name: left_top
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: overall_tiling_horizontal_size
properties.description: Overall tiling is used to make the overall texture repeat instead of being stretched.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Mandatory if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: right
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: right_border
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: right_bottom
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: right_height
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: right_top
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: stretch_monolith_image_to_size
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: tint
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: top
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: top_border
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: top_width
properties.description: Only loaded if `corner_size` is defined. Only loaded if `type` is `"composition"`.

properties.name: type
properties.default: `"none"` if this has no other properties, otherwise `"composition"`

properties.name: destroy_factor
properties.description: Percentual increase in the evolution factor for every destroyed spawner

properties.name: pollution_factor
properties.description: Percentual increase in the evolution factor for 1 pollution unit

properties.name: time_factor
properties.description: Percentual increase in the evolution factor for every second (60 ticks)

properties.name: max_colliding_tiles_coefficient
properties.description: A chunk has to have at most this much percent unbuildable tiles for it to be considered a candidate. This is to avoid chunks full of water to be marked as candidates.

properties.name: max_expansion_distance
properties.description: Distance in chunks from the furthest base around. This prevents expansions from reaching too far into the player's territory.

properties.name: min_expansion_cooldown
properties.description: Ticks to expand to a single position for a base is used. Cooldown is calculated as follows: `cooldown = lerp(max_expansion_cooldown, min_expansion_cooldown, -e^2 + 2 * e)` where `lerp` is the linear interpolation function, and e is the current evolution factor.

properties.name: settler_group_min_size
properties.description: Size of the group that goes to build new base (the game interpolates between min size and max size based on evolution factor).

types.name: Energy
types.description:
Specifies an amount of electric energy in joules, or electric energy per time in watts.

Internally, the input in `Watt` or `Joule/second` is always converted into `Joule/tick`, where 1 second is equal to 60 ticks. This means it uses the following formula: `Power in Joule/tick = Power in Watt / 60`. See [Power](https://wiki.factorio.com/Units#Power).

Supported Multipliers:

- `k/K`: 10^3, or 1 000

- `M`: 10^6

- `G`: 10^9

- `T`: 10^12

- `P`: 10^15

- `E`: 10^18

- `Z`: 10^21

- `Y`: 10^24
examples:
```
buffer_capacity = "5MJ"
input_flow_limit = "300W"
-- the following two lines result in the same power consumption:
energy_usage = "60W"
energy_usage = "1J" -- not recommended, Watt is convention for power
```

types.name: EnergySource
types.description: Loaded as one of the [BaseEnergySource](prototype:BaseEnergySource) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: EntityID
types.description: The name of an [EntityPrototype](prototype:EntityPrototype).

types.name: EntityPrototypeFlags
types.description:
An array containing the following values.

If an entity is a [building](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::is_building) and has the `"player-creation"` flag set, it is considered for multiple enemy/unit behaviors:

- Autonomous enemy attacks (usually triggered by pollution) can only attack within chunks that contain at least one entity that is both a building and a player-creation.

- Enemy expansion considers entities that are both buildings and player-creations as "enemy" entities that may block expansion.

options.description: Can't be rotated before or after placing.
Determines the default force when placing entities in the map editor and using the *AUTO* option for the force.
Determines the default force when placing entities in the map editor and using the *AUTO* option for the force.
Determines the default force when placing entities in the map editor and using the *AUTO* option for the force.
Refers to the fact that most entities are placed on an invisible 'grid' within the world, entities with this flag do not have to line up with this grid (like trees and land-mines).

Makes it possible for the biter AI to target the entity as a distraction in distraction mode [by_anything](runtime:defines.distraction.by_anything). Makes it possible to blueprint, deconstruct, and repair the entity (can be turned off again using the specific flags). Enables smoke to be created automatically when building the entity. If the entity does not have [EntityPrototype::map_color](prototype:EntityPrototype::map_color) set, this flag makes the entity appear on the map/minimap with the default color specified in the [UtilityConstants](prototype:UtilityConstants).
Uses 45 degree angle increments when selecting direction.
Used to automatically detect the proper direction, if possible. Used by base with the pump, train stop, and train signal.
Fast replace will not apply when building while moving.
This is used to specify that the entity breathes air, and so is affected by poison (currently [poison capsules](https://wiki.factorio.com/Poison_capsule) are the only source).
Used to specify that the entity can not be 'healed' by repair-packs (or construction robots with repair packs)
The entity does not get drawn on the map.
The entity can not be deconstructed.
The entity can not be used in blueprints.
Hides the entity from the bonus GUI (button above the map) and from the made in property of recipe tooltips.
Hides the alt-info of an entity in alt-mode, for example the recipe icon.
Do not fast replace over other entity types when building while moving.
Do not apply fire stickers to the entity.
Prevents inserters and loaders from taking items from this entity.
Prevents inserters and loaders from inserting items into this entity.

This flag does nothing when set in the data stage because it gets overridden by [EntityPrototype::allow_copy_paste](prototype:EntityPrototype::allow_copy_paste). Thus, it must be set on the entity via that property.

Disallows selection of the entity even when a selection box is specified for other reasons. For example, selection boxes are used to determine the size of outlines to be shown when highlighting entities inside electric pole ranges. This flag does nothing when set in the data stage because it gets overridden by [EntityPrototype::selectable_in_game](prototype:EntityPrototype::selectable_in_game). Thus, it must be set on the entity via that property.
The entity can't be selected by the [upgrade planner](https://wiki.factorio.com/Upgrade_planner).
The entity is not shown in the kill statistics.
The entity is not shown in the made in property of recipe tooltips.

types.name: EntityRendererSearchBoxLimits
types.description: How far (in tiles) entities should be rendered outside the visible area of the screen.

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: Min value 4, max value 15. Min value 4 to compensate for tall entities like electric poles.

properties.name: left
properties.description: Min value 6, max value 15. Min value 6 to compensate for shadows.

properties.name: right
properties.description: Min value 3, max value 15.

properties.name: top
properties.description: Min value 3, max value 15.

types.name: EquipmentCategoryID
types.description: The name of an [EquipmentCategory](prototype:EquipmentCategory).

types.name: EquipmentGridID
types.description: The name of an [EquipmentGridPrototype](prototype:EquipmentGridPrototype).

types.name: EquipmentID
types.description: The name of an [EquipmentPrototype](prototype:EquipmentPrototype).

types.name: EquipmentShape
types.description: The shape and dimensions of an equipment module.

properties.name: points
properties.description: Only used when when `type` is `"manual"`. Each inner array is a "position" inside width×height of the equipment. Each positions that is defined is a filled squares of the equipment shape. `{0, 0}` is the upper left corner of the equipment.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The shape. When using "manual", `points` must be defined.

properties.name: input_scale
properties.description: `x` and `y` will be multiplied by this value before sampling.

properties.name: output_scale
properties.description: The output will be multiplied by this value before returning.

properties.name: seed0
properties.description: Integer between 0 and 4 294 967 295 (inclusive) used to populate the backing random noise.

properties.name: seed1
properties.description: Integer between 0 and 255 (inclusive) used to provide extra randomness when sampling.

properties.name: input_scale
properties.description: `x` and `y` will be multiplied by this value before sampling.

properties.name: octaves
properties.description: How many layers of noise at different scales to sum.

properties.name: output_scale
properties.description: The output will be multiplied by this value before returning.

properties.name: persistence
properties.description: How strong is each layer compared to the next larger one.

properties.name: seed0
properties.description: Integer between 0 and 4 294 967 295 (inclusive) used to populate the backing random noise.

properties.name: seed1
properties.description: Integer between 0 and 255 (inclusive) used to provide extra randomness when sampling.

types.name: FileName
types.description:
A slash `"/"` is always used as the directory delimiter. A path always begins with the specification of a root, which can be one of three formats:

- **core**: A path starting with `__core__` will access the resources in the data/core directory, these resources are always accessible regardless of mod specifications.

- **base**: A path starting with `__base__` will access the resources in the base mod in data/base directory. These resources are usually available, as long as the base mod isn't removed/deactivated.

- **mod path**: The format `__<mod-name>__` is placeholder for root of any other mod (mods/<mod-name>), and is accessible as long as the mod is active.

properties.name: explosion
properties.description: Name of a [FlameThrowerExplosionPrototype](prototype:FlameThrowerExplosionPrototype).

types.name: FluidBox
types.description:
Used to set the fluid amount an entity can hold, as well as the connection points for pipes leading into and out of the entity.

Entities can have multiple fluidboxes. These can be part of a [FluidEnergySource](prototype:FluidEnergySource), or be specified directly in the entity prototype.

A fluidbox can store only one type of fluid at a time. However, a fluid system (ie. multiple connected fluid boxes) can contain multiple different fluids, see [Fluid mixing](https://wiki.factorio.com/Fluid_system#Fluid_mixing).

images.caption: Visual representation of base_area, base_level and height. When all the fluidboxes are connected, the water leaves fluidbox A and flows into the other 3 boxes through fluidbox B until the water level is equal in all boxes.

properties.name: base_area
properties.description: Must be greater than `0`. The total fluid capacity of the fluid box is `base_area × height × 100`.

properties.name: base_level
properties.description:
Base level is the elevation of the invisible fluid box. `0` is ground level.

For example, if the base level is `-1` and the height is `1`, it puts the top of the fluid box at the bottom of a pipe connection with base_level `0` and height `1`. This means fluid "falls" in to the fluid box, and can't get out.

For example, if the base level is `1`, it puts the bottom of the fluid box at the top of a pipe connection with base_level `0` and height `1`. This means fluid "falls" out of the fluid box, but fluids already outside can't get into it.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Can be used to specify which fluid is allowed to enter this fluid box. See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?f=28&t=46302).

properties.name: height
properties.description: Must be greater than `0`. The total fluid capacity of the fluid box is `base_area × height × 100`.

properties.name: hide_connection_info
properties.description: Hides the blue input/output arrows and icons at each connection point.

properties.name: maximum_temperature
properties.description: The maximum temperature allowed into the fluidbox. Only applied if a `filter` is specified.

properties.name: minimum_temperature
properties.description: The minimum temperature allowed into the fluidbox. Only applied if a `filter` is specified.

properties.name: pipe_connections
properties.description:
Connection points to connect to other fluidboxes. This is also marked as blue arrows in alt mode. Fluid may flow in or out depending on the `type` field of each connection.

Connection points may depend on the direction the entity is facing. These connection points cannot share positions with one another or the connection points of another fluid box belonging to the same entity.

Can't have more than 255 connections.

properties.name: pipe_covers
properties.description: The pictures to show when another fluid box connects to this one.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Set the secondary draw order for all orientations. Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

properties.name: secondary_draw_orders
properties.description: Set the secondary draw order for each orientation. Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

properties.name: burns_fluid
properties.description: If set to `true`, the energy source will calculate power based on the fluid's `fuel_value`, else it will calculate based on fluid temperature.

properties.name: destroy_non_fuel_fluid
properties.description:
Property is only used when `burns_fluid` is `true` and the fluid has a [fuel_value](prototype:FluidPrototype::fuel_value) of `0`, or when `burns_fluid` is `false` and the fluid is at its `default_temperature`.

In those cases, this property determines whether the fluid should be destroyed, meaning that the fluid is consumed at the rate of `fluid_usage_per_tick`, without producing any power.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: `1` means 100% effectivity. Must be greater than `0`. Multiplier of the energy output.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description: All standard fluid box configurations are acceptable, but the type must be `"input"` or `"input-output"` to function correctly. `scale_fluid_usage`, `fluid_usage_per_tick`, or a filter on the fluidbox must be set to be able to calculate the fluid usage of the energy source.

properties.name: fluid_usage_per_tick
properties.description: The number of fluid units the energy source uses per tick. If used with `scale_fluid_usage`, this specifies the maximum. If this value is not set, `scale_energy_usage` is `false` and a fluid box filter is set, the game will attempt to calculate this value from the fluid box filter's fluid's `fuel_value` or `heat_capacity` and the entity's `energy_usage`. If `burns_fluid` is `false`, `maximum_temperature` will also be used. If the attempt of the game to calculate this value fails (`scale_energy_usage` is `false` and a fluid box filter is set), then `scale_energy_usage` will be forced to `true`, to prevent the energy source from being an infinite fluid sink. More context [on the forums](https://forums.factorio.com/90613).

properties.name: maximum_temperature
properties.description:
`0` means unlimited maximum temperature. If specified while `scale_fluid_usage` is `false` and `fluid_usage_per_tick` is not specified, the game will use this value to calculate `fluid_usage_per_tick`.

Only loaded if `burns_fluid` is `false`.

properties.name: scale_fluid_usage
properties.description: If set to `true`, the energy source will consume as much fluid as required to produce the desired power, otherwise it will consume as much as it is allowed to, wasting any excess.

properties.name: minimum_temperature

If this FluidProductPrototype is used in a recipe, the `catalyst_amount` is calculated automatically based on the [RecipePrototype::ingredients](prototype:RecipePrototype::ingredients) and [RecipePrototype::results](prototype:RecipePrototype::results). See [here](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-256).

properties.name: fluidbox_index
properties.description: Used to specify which [CraftingMachinePrototype::fluid_boxes](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype::fluid_boxes) this product should use. It will use this one fluidbox. The index is 1-based and separate for input and output fluidboxes.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a [FluidPrototype](prototype:FluidPrototype).

properties.name: probability
properties.description:
Value between 0 and 1, `0` for 0% chance and `1` for 100% chance.

The effect of probability is no product, or a linear distribution on [min, max]. For a recipe with probability `p`, amount_min `min`, and amount_max `max`, the Expected Value of this product can be expressed as `p * (0.5 * (max + min))`. This is what will be shown in a recipe tooltip. The effect of `catalyst_amount` on the product is not shown.

When `amount_min` and `amount_max` are not provided, `amount` applies as min and max. The Expected Value simplifies to `p * amount`, providing `0` product, or `amount` product, on recipe completion.

properties.name: show_details_in_recipe_tooltip
properties.description: When hovering over a recipe in the crafting menu the recipe tooltip will be shown. An additional item tooltip will be shown for every product, as a separate tooltip, if the item tooltip has a description and/or properties to show and if `show_details_in_recipe_tooltip` is `true`.

types.name: IconData
types.description:
Icon layering follows the following rules:

- The rendering order of the individual icons follows the array order: Later added icons (higher index) are drawn on top of previously added icons (lower index).

- Only the first icon layer will display a shadow.

- When the final icon is displayed with transparency (e.g. a faded out alert), the icon layer overlap may look [undesirable](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=575844#p575844).

- The final combination of icons will always be resized in GUI based on the first icon layer's size, but won't be resized when displayed on machines in alt-mode. For example: recipe first icon layer is size 128, scale 1, the icon group will be displayed at resolution /4 to fit the 32px GUI boxes, but will be displayed 4 times as large on buildings.

- Shift values are based on final size (`icon_size * scale`) of the first icon layer.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Path to the icon file.

properties.name: icon_mipmaps
properties.description: Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon.

Mandatory if `icon_size` is not specified outside of `icons`.

properties.name: scale
properties.description:
Defaults to `32/icon_size` for items and recipes, and `256/icon_size` for technologies.

Specifies the scale of the icon on the GUI scale. A scale of `2` means that the icon will be two times bigger on screen (and thus more pixelated).

properties.name: shift
properties.description: Used to offset the icon "layer" from the overall icon. The shift is applied from the center (so negative shifts are left and up, respectively). Shift values are based on final size (`icon_size * scale`) of the first icon.

properties.name: tint
properties.description: The tint to apply to the icon.

types.name: IconMipMapType
types.description:
Icons of reduced size will be used at decreased scale. 0 or 1 mipmaps is a single image. The file must contain half-size images with a geometric-ratio, for each mipmap level. Each next level is aligned to the upper-left corner, with no extra padding. Example sequence: `128x128@(0,0)`, `64x64@(128,0)`, `32x32@(192,0)` is three mipmaps.

See [here](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-291) for more about the visual effects of icon mipmaps.

When `amount_min` and `amount_max` are not provided, `amount` applies as min and max. The Expected Value simplifies to `p * amount`, providing `0` product, or `amount` product, on recipe completion.

options.description: Whether the logistics areas of roboports should be drawn when holding this item. Used for example by the [deconstruction planner](https://wiki.factorio.com/Deconstruction_planner).
Item will not appear in lists of all items such as those for logistics requests, filters, etc.
Always show the item in selection lists (item filter, logistic request etc.) even when locked recipe for that item is present.
Item will not appear in the bonus gui.
Item will not appear in the tooltips shown when hovering over a burner inventory with the fuel category the item is in.

The item can never be stacked. Additionally, the item does not show an item count when in the cursor. This also prevents the item from stacking in assembling machine input slots, which otherwise can exceed the item stack size if required by the recipe.
Must be set on [ItemWithInventoryPrototype](prototype:ItemWithInventoryPrototype) when the item should act as an extension to the inventory that it is placed in. Does nothing for other item types.
Item will be preferred by construction bots when building the entity specified by the item's [place_result](prototype:ItemPrototype::place_result).
Only works for [SelectionToolPrototype](prototype:SelectionToolPrototype) and derived classes. Corresponds to the runtime [on_mod_item_opened](runtime:on_mod_item_opened) event.
Item is deleted when removed from the cursor by pressing `Q` ("clear cursor"). Used for example by the copy/paste tools.
Item is able to be spawned by a [ShortcutPrototype](prototype:ShortcutPrototype) or [CustomInputPrototype](prototype:CustomInputPrototype).

types.name: LocalisedString
types.description:
Localised strings are a way to support translation of in-game text. They offer a language-independent code representation of the text that should be shown to players.

It is an array where the first element is the key and the remaining elements are parameters that will be substituted for placeholders in the template designated by the key.

The key identifies the string template. For example, `"gui-alert-tooltip.attack"` (for the template `"__1__ objects are being damaged"`; see the file `data/core/locale/en.cfg`). In the settings and prototype stages, this key cannot be longer than 200 characters.

The template can contain placeholders such as `__1__` or `__2__`. These will be replaced by the respective parameter in the LocalisedString. The parameters themselves can be other localised strings, which will be processed recursively in the same fashion. Localised strings can not be recursed deeper than 20 levels and can not have more than 20 parameters.

There are two special flags for the localised string, indicated by the key being a particular string. First, if the key is the empty string (`""`), then all parameters will be concatenated (after processing, if any are localised strings themselves). Second, if the key is a question mark (`"?"`), then the first valid parameter will be used. A parameter can be invalid if its name doesn't match any string template. If no parameters are valid, the last one is returned. This is useful to implement a fallback for missing locale templates.

Furthermore, when an API function expects a localised string, it will also accept a regular string (i.e. not a table) which will not be translated, as well as a number or boolean, which will be converted to their textual representation.

See [Tutorial:Localisation](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Localisation) for more information.
examples:
```
-- In the English translation, this will print "No ammo"; in the Czech translation, it will print "Bez munice":
game.player.print({"description.no-ammo"})
-- The "description.no-ammo" template contains no placeholders, so no further parameters are necessary.
```

```
-- In the English translation, this will print "Durability: 5/9"; in the Japanese one, it will print "耐久度: 5/9":
game.player.print({"description.durability", 5, 9})
```

```
-- This will print "hello" in all translations:
game.player.print({"", "hello"})
```

```
-- This will print "Iron plate: 60" in the English translation and "Eisenplatte: 60" in the German translation.
game.print({"", {"item-name.iron-plate"}, ": ", 60})
```

```
-- As an example of a localised string with fallback, consider this:
{"?", {"", {"entity-description.furnace"}, "\n"}, {"item-description.furnace"}, "optional fallback"}
-- If "entity-description.furnace" exists, it is concatenated with "\n" and returned. Otherwise, if
-- "item-description.furnace" exists, it is returned as-is. Otherwise, "optional fallback" is returned. If this
-- value wasn't specified, the translation result would be "Unknown key: 'item-description.furnace'".
```

If no MapGenPreset has `default = true`, the preset selector will have a blank preset label, with default settings. The "blank" preset goes away when another preset is selected.

properties.name: max_expansion_cooldown
properties.description: In ticks.

properties.name: max_expansion_distance
properties.description: Distance in chunks from the furthest base around. This prevents expansions from reaching too far into the player's territory.

properties.name: min_expansion_cooldown
properties.description: Ticks to expand to a single position for a base is used. Cooldown is calculated as follows: `cooldown = lerp(max_expansion_cooldown, min_expansion_cooldown, -e^2 + 2 * e)` where `lerp` is the linear interpolation function, and e is the current evolution factor.

properties.name: settler_group_min_size
properties.description: Size of the group that goes to build new base (the game interpolates between min size and max size based on evolution factor).

types.name: MapGenPresetPollutionSettings
types.description: The pollution settings, the values are for 60 ticks (1 second).

properties.name: ageing
properties.description: Must be >= 0.1. Also known as dissipation rate.

properties.name: diffusion_ratio
properties.description: Must be <= 0.25. Amount that is diffused to neighboring chunks.

properties.name: enemy_attack_pollution_consumption_modifier
properties.description: Must be >= 0.1.

properties.name: autoplace_settings
properties.description: Each setting in this table maps the string type to the settings for that type.

properties.name: default_enable_all_autoplace_controls
