properties.description: Whether undefined `autoplace_controls` should fall back to the default controls or not.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the map in tiles. Silently limited to 2 000 000, ie. +/- 1 million tiles from the center in both directions.

properties.name: property_expression_names
properties.description: Map of property name (`"elevation"`, etc) to name of noise expression that will provide it. Entries may be omitted. A notable usage is changing autoplace behavior of an entity based on the preset, which cannot be read from a noise expression.

properties.name: seed
properties.description: Read by the game, but not used or set in the GUI.

properties.name: starting_area
properties.description: Size of the starting area. The starting area only effects enemy placement, and has no effect on resources.

properties.name: starting_points
properties.description: Array of the positions of the starting areas.

properties.name: terrain_segmentation
properties.description: This is the inverse of "water scale" in the map generator GUI. So a water scale that shows as 50% in the GUI is a value of `1/0.5 = 2` for `terrain_segmentation`.

properties.name: water
properties.description: Shown as water coverage in the map generator GUI.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the map in tiles. Silently limited to 2 000 000, ie. +/- 1 million tiles from the center in both directions.

types.name: MapGenSize
types.description:
A floating point number specifying an amount.

For backwards compatibility, MapGenSizes can also be specified as one of the following strings, which will be converted to a number:

Each of the values in a triplet (such as "low", "small", and "poor") are synonymous. In-game the values can be set from `0.166` to `6` via the GUI (respective to the percentages), while `0` is used to disable the autoplace control.

types.name: MapPosition
types.description:
Coordinates of a tile in a map. Positive x goes towards east, positive y goes towards south, and x is the first dimension in the array format.

The coordinates are saved as a fixed-size 32 bit integer, with 8 bits reserved for decimal precision, meaning the smallest value step is `1/2^8 = 0.00390625` tiles.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: MinableProperties
types.description: The mining properties of objects. For formulas for the mining time, see [mining](https://wiki.factorio.com/Mining).

properties.name: count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `results` is not defined.

How many of result are dropped.

properties.name: fluid_amount
properties.description: The amount of fluid that is used up when this object is mined. If this is > 0, this object cannot be mined by hand.

properties.name: mining_particle
properties.description: Name of a [ParticlePrototype](prototype:ParticlePrototype). Which set of particles to use.

properties.name: mining_time
properties.description: How many seconds are required to mine this object at 1 mining speed.

properties.name: required_fluid
properties.description: Name of a [FluidPrototype](prototype:FluidPrototype). The fluid that is used up when this object is mined.

properties.name: result
properties.description:
Only loaded if `results` is not defined.

Which item is dropped when this is mined. Cannot be empty. If you want the entity to not be minable, don't specify the minable properties, if you want it to be minable with no result item, don't specify the result at all.

properties.name: results
properties.description: The items that are returned when this object is mined.

types.name: MiningDrillGraphicsSet
types.description: Used by [MiningDrillPrototype](prototype:MiningDrillPrototype).

properties.name: always_draw_idle_animation
properties.description: Only loaded if `idle_animation` is defined.

properties.name: circuit_connector_layer
properties.description: Render layer(s) for all directions of the circuit connectors.

properties.name: circuit_connector_secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Secondary draw order(s) for all directions of the circuit connectors.

properties.name: idle_animation
properties.description: Idle animation must have the same frame count as animation.

properties.name: shift_animation_transition_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if `shift_animation_waypoints` is defined.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if `shift_animation_waypoints` is defined.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoints
properties.description: Only loaded if one of `shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration` or `shift_animation_transition_duration` is not `0`.

properties.name: status_colors
properties.description: Used by [WorkingVisualisation::apply_tint](prototype:WorkingVisualisation::apply_tint).

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: ModSetting
types.description: The user-set value of a startup [mod setting](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Mod_settings).

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the mod setting. The type depends on the kind of setting.

types.name: Modifier
types.description:
The effect that is applied when a [TechnologyPrototype](prototype:TechnologyPrototype) is researched.

Loaded as one of the [BaseModifier](prototype:BaseModifier) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: Mods
types.description: A dictionary of mod names to mod versions of all active mods. It can be used to adjust mod functionality based on the presence of other mods.
examples:
```
-- executes pineapple only when the pizza mod is active
if mods["pizza"] then
  pineapple()
end
```

```
-- when the only active mod is the space-age mod with version 1.2.0
-- then this logs
for name, version in pairs(mods) do
  log(name .. " version " .. version) -- => space-age version 1.2.0
end
```

types.name: ModuleCategoryID
types.description: The name of a [ModuleCategory](prototype:ModuleCategory).

types.name: ModuleSpecification
types.description: The number of module slots in this entity, and their icon positions.

properties.name: module_slots
properties.description: The number of module slots in this entity.

types.name: MouseCursorID
types.description: The name of a [MouseCursor](prototype:MouseCursor).

types.name: NoiseArrayConstruction
types.description:
`value_expressions` property should be a list of numeric expressions, each of which will be evaluated to come up with the corresponding numeric value in the resulting array.

Used to construct map positions (`{x, y}`) and map position lists (`{{x0,y0}, {y1,y1}, [...]}`) for [offset-points](prototype:NoiseFunctionOffsetPoints) and [distance-from-nearest-point](prototype:NoiseFunctionDistanceFromNearestPoint) functions.

types.name: NoiseExpression
types.description:
Loaded as one of the noise expressions listed in this union, based on the value of the `type` key.

A fragment of a functional program used to generate coherent noise, probably for purposes related to terrain generation.

Noise expressions can be provided as table literals or built using functions in the built-in [noise library](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/core/lualib/noise.lua). The built-in noise library allows writing much more concise code, so its usage will be shown in most examples for noise expressions.

[noise.define_noise_function](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/core/lualib/noise.lua#L272) allows noise expressions to be defined using a shorthand that's a subset of Lua (see the example for details).

See [here](https://togos.github.io/togos-example-noise-programs/) for a tutorial on authoring noise expressions.

The most frequently used noise functions are loaded via [NoiseFunctionApplication](prototype:NoiseFunctionApplication).
examples:
```
-- "noise" library required beforehand
expression = noise.define_noise_function(function(x, y, tile, map)
  return (x + y) / 1000
end)
```

types.name: NoiseFunctionAbsoluteValue
types.description: Takes a single argument and returns its absolute value. Ie. if the argument is negative, it is inverted.

types.name: NoiseFunctionAdd
types.description: Takes between 0 and 32 numbers and adds them up.

types.name: NoiseFunctionApplication
types.description:
Loaded as one of the NoiseFunctions listed in this union, based on the value of the `function_name` key.

Apply a function to a list or associative array of arguments. Some functions expect arguments to be named and some expect them not to be.

Function calls are their own class of expression (as opposed to every function just being its own expression type) because function calls all have similar properties -- arguments are themselves expressions, a function call with all-constant arguments can be constant-folded (due to [referential transparency](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Referential_transparency)), etc.

types.name: NoiseFunctionAtan2
types.description: Returns the arc tangent of y/x using the signs of arguments to determine the correct quadrant.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The first argument is y and the second is x.

types.name: NoiseFunctionBitwiseAnd
types.description: Casts between 0 and 32 numbers to 32-bit integers and performs a bitwise AND on them.

types.name: NoiseFunctionBitwiseNot
types.description: Casts the single argument to a 32-bit integer and performs bitwise negates it.

types.name: NoiseFunctionBitwiseOr
types.description: Casts between 0 and 32 numbers to 32-bit integers and performs a bitwise OR on them.

types.name: NoiseFunctionBitwiseXor
types.description: Casts between 0 and 32 numbers to 32-bit integers and performs a bitwise EXCLUSIVE OR on them.

types.name: NoiseFunctionCeil
types.description: Takes a single argument and returns its ceil.

types.name: NoiseFunctionClamp
types.description: The first argument is clamped to be between the second and third. The second is treated as a lower limit and the third the upper limit.

types.name: NoiseFunctionCompileTimeLog
types.description: Prints between 0 and 32 arguments to the [log file](https://wiki.factorio.com/Log_file) when the expression is compiled. For that it needs to part of another expression that is compiled. The last argument of the `compile-time-log` is returned as the "result" of the `compile-time-log`.
examples:
```
-- Example usage inside a NamedNoiseExpression
local noise = require("noise")
local tne = noise.to_noise_expression

data:extend{{
  type = "noise-expression",
  name = "compile-log-test",
  intended_property = "elevation",
  expression = noise.compile_time_log(2000, noise.var("y"), tne(100) - noise.var("distance"))
}}

-- When "compile-log-test" is selected as the map type and a map preview or map is generated, this logs:
--  Info data-updates.lua:24: 2000.000000 reference to variable 'y' subtract
-- Furthermore, the elevation noise expression is set to 'tne(100) - noise.var("distance")', producing a circular island with a 100 tile radius
```

types.name: NoiseFunctionCos
types.description: Takes a single argument and returns its cosine.

types.name: NoiseFunctionDistanceFromNearestPoint
types.description: Computes the [euclidean distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance) of the position `{x, y}` to all position listed in points and returns the shortest distance. The returned distance can be `maximum_distance` at most.
examples:
```
-- Shortest distance at the current {x, y} from the two given points, but at most 1000
local noise = require("noise")
local tne = noise.to_noise_expression
local positions = noise.make_point_list({{-100, -40}, {-50, -200}})

local shortest_distance =
{
  type = "function-application",
  function_name = "distance-from-nearest-point",
  arguments = {x = noise.var("x"), y = noise.var("y"), points = positions, maximum_distance = tne(1000)}
}
-- or with the noise lib
local also_shortest_distance = noise.function_application("distance-from-nearest-point", {x = noise.var("x"), y = noise.var("y"), points = positions, maximum_distance = 1000})
```

types.name: NoiseFunctionDivide
types.description: Takes two arguments and divides the first by the second.

types.name: NoiseFunctionEquals
types.description: Returns the result of first argument == second argument as a literal number that is `0` for false and `1` for true.

types.name: NoiseFunctionExponentiate
types.description: Takes two arguments and raises the first to the second power.

types.name: NoiseFunctionFactorioBasisNoise
types.description: Scaling input and output can be accomplished other ways, but are done so commonly as to be built into this function for performance reasons.

types.name: NoiseFunctionFloor
types.description: Takes a single argument and returns its floor.

types.name: NoiseFunctionLessOrEqual
types.description: Returns the result of first argument <= second argument as a literal number that is `0` for false and `1` for true.

types.name: NoiseFunctionLessThan
types.description: Returns the result of first argument < second argument as a literal number that is `0` for false and `1` for true.

types.name: NoiseFunctionModulo
types.description: Takes two arguments and divides the first by the second and returns the remainder. This is implemented using [fmod(double, double)](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/math/fmod).

types.name: NoiseFunctionMultiply
types.description: Takes between 0 and 32 numbers and multiplies them.

types.name: NoiseFunctionOffsetPoints
types.description: The first argument represents a vector of how the positions should be shifted, and the second argument lists the positions that should be shifted.
examples:
```
-- Shifts "positions" by {100, 90}
local noise = require("noise")
local positions = noise.make_point_list({{-10, -40}, {-50, -20}})
local offset = noise.make_array({100, 90})
local offset_positions =
{
  type = "function-application",
  function_name = "offset-points",
  arguments = {offset, positions}
}
-- or with the noise lib
local also_offset_positions = noise.function_application("offset-points", {offset, positions})
```

types.name: NoiseFunctionRandomPenalty
types.description: Subtracts a random value in the `[0, amplitude)` range from `source` if `source` is larger than `0`.

types.name: NoiseFunctionRidge
types.description: Similar to [clamp](prototype:NoiseFunctionClamp), where the first argument is folded back across the third and second limits until it lies between them.
examples:
```
local noise = require("noise")
local ridge_1 = noise.ridge(6, 1, 5) -- this returns 4
local ridge_2 = noise.ridge(-1, 1, 5) -- this returns 3
```

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The first argument is the number to be ridged, the second is the lower limit and the third is the upper limit.

types.name: NoiseFunctionSin
types.description: Takes a single argument and returns its sine.

types.name: NoiseFunctionSpotNoise
types.description:
Generates random conical spots. The map is divided into square regions, and within each region, candidate points are chosen at random and target density, spot quantity, and radius are calculated for each point (or one of every `skip_span` candidate points) by configured expressions. Each spot contributes a quantity to a regional target total (which is the average of sampled target densities times the area of the region) until the total has been reached or a maximum spot count is hit. The output value of the function is the maximum height of any spot at a given point.

The parameters that provide expressions to be evaluated for each point (all named something_expression) need to actually return expression objects.

The quantity of the spot is assumed to be the same as its volume. Since the volume of a cone is `pi * radius^2 * height / 3`, the height ('peak value') of any given spot is calculated as `3 * quantity / (pi * radius^2)`

The infinite series of candidate points (of which `candidate_point_count` are actually considered) generated by `spot-noise` expressions with the same `seed0`, `seed1`, `region_size`, and `suggested_minimum_candidate_point_spacing` will be identical. This allows multiple spot-noise expressions (e.g. for different ore patches) to avoid overlap by using different points from the same list, determined by `skip_span` and `skip_offset`.

types.name: NoiseFunctionSubtract
types.description: Takes two arguments and subtracts the second from the first.

types.name: NoiseFunctionTerrace
types.description: The first argument is the value to be terraced. The second argument is the offset, the third the width, and the fourth the strength.

types.name: NoiseIfElseChain
NoiseLayerID
types.description: The name of a [NoiseLayer](prototype:NoiseLayer).

types.name: NoiseLiteralBoolean
types.description: Evaluates to the same boolean value (true or false) every time, given by the `literal_value` property. May be used as a number value, evaluates to `1` for true and `0` for false.

types.name: NoiseLiteralExpression
types.description: Returns the expression represented by its `literal_value` property. Useful mostly for passing expressions (to be evaluated later) to the [spot-noise](prototype:NoiseFunctionSpotNoise) function.

types.name: NoiseLiteralNumber
types.description: Evaluates to the same number every time, given by the `literal_value` property. All numbers are treated as [float](prototype:float) internally unless otherwise specified. May be used as a boolean value, evaluates to true for numbers bigger than zero, anything else evaluates to false.
examples:
```
local ten =
{
  type = "literal-number",
  literal_value = 10
}

-- or with the noise lib
local noise = require("noise")
local twenty_point_five = noise.to_noise_expression(20.5)
```

types.name: NoiseLiteralObject
types.description: Evaluates to the same object every time, given by the `literal_value` property. Since the noise generation runtime has no notion of objects or use for them, this is useful only in constant contexts, such as the argument of the `autoplace-probability` function (where the 'literal object' is an [AutoplaceSpecification](prototype:AutoplaceSpecification)).

types.name: NoiseLiteralString
types.description: Evaluates to the same string every time, given by the `literal_value` property. Since the noise generation runtime has no notion of strings or use for them, this is useful only in constant contexts.

types.name: NoiseNumber
types.description:
A numeric noise expression, such as a literal number, the result of addition, or multioctave noise.

This encompasses all [NoiseExpressions](prototype:NoiseExpression), except for [NoiseLiteralBoolean](prototype:NoiseLiteralBoolean), [NoiseLiteralString](prototype:NoiseLiteralString), [NoiseLiteralObject](prototype:NoiseLiteralObject), [NoiseLiteralExpression](prototype:NoiseLiteralExpression), [NoiseArrayConstruction](prototype:NoiseArrayConstruction), and [NoiseFunctionOffsetPoints](prototype:NoiseFunctionOffsetPoints).

types.name: NoiseProcedureDelimiter
types.description:
Evaluates and returns the value of its expression property, which is itself an expression.

This hints to the compiler that it should break the subexpression into its own procedure so that the result can be re-used in multiple places. For instance if you want to re-use the same multioctave noise for determining probability of multiple tiles/entities, wrap the multioctave noise expression in a procedure-delimiter. Alternatively, make the noise its own [NamedNoiseExpression](prototype:NamedNoiseExpression) and reference it by name, using a [NoiseVariable](prototype:NoiseVariable).

types.name: NoiseVariable
types.description: Variables referencing named noise expressions may have their reference overridden by other named noise expression if their `intended_property` is the variable name and it is selected by the user in the map generator GUI. See the second example on [NamedNoiseExpression::intended_property](prototype:NamedNoiseExpression::intended_property).
examples:
```
local noise = require("noise")

local y =
{
  type = "variable",
  variable_name = "y" -- predefined variable
}
local x = noise.var("x") -- predefined variable, with the noise lib

local width =
{
  type = "variable",
  variable_name = "map_width" -- predefined constant
}
local height = noise.var("map_height") -- predefined constant, with the noise lib

local aux =
{
  type = "variable",
  variable_name = "aux" -- named noise expression
}
local cliffiness = noise.var("cliffiness") -- named noise expression, with the noise lib
```

properties.name: variable_name
properties.description:
A string referring to a pre-defined variable, constant, or [NamedNoiseExpression](prototype:NamedNoiseExpression).

The `"x"` or `"y"` variables refer to the current coordinates of the map position being evaluated.

The constants refer to a set of values mostly defined by [MapGenSettings](prototype:MapGenSettings).

The named noise expressions refer to one of the notable [BaseNamedNoiseExpressions](prototype:BaseNamedNoiseExpressions), or any other existing one by name.

types.name: NoiseVariableConstants
types.description: A set of constants largely determined by [MapGenSettings](prototype:MapGenSettings).

options.description: Additional constants are generated for all [tile](prototype:TilePrototype), [entity](prototype:EntityPrototype), [decorative](prototype:DecorativePrototype), and [autoplace-control](prototype:AutoplaceControl) prototypes. These follow these three patterns: `control-setting:<name>:frequency`, `control-setting:<name>:size`, and `control-setting:<name>:richness`.
Should not be used, `wlc_elevation_minimum` should be used instead.
Should not be used, `wlc_elevation_offset` should be used instead.
When the result of `10 * log2("water")` ([MapGenSettings::water](prototype:MapGenSettings::water)) is infinite, `wlc_elevation_minimum = -∞`, else `wlc_elevation_minimum = 4`.
When the result of `10 * log2("water")` ([MapGenSettings::water](prototype:MapGenSettings::water)) is finite, `wlc_elevation_offset = -(10 * log2(water))`, else `wlc_elevation_offset = 0`.
Calculated from the cliff and water settings.
Calculated from starting positions and map seed.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 0.

properties.name: base_pictures
properties.description: Rendered in layer specified by `base_render_layer`, with secondary draw order 0.

properties.name: fluid_animation
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 20.

properties.name: glass_pictures
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 40.

properties.name: underwater_pictures
properties.description: Drawn by tile renderer when water animation is enabled.

properties.name: triggers
properties.description: If at least one of the triggers is fulfilled, this trigger is considered fulfilled.

types.name: Order
types.description:
The order property is a simple `string`. When the game needs to sort prototypes (of the same type), it looks at their order properties and sorts those alphabetically. A prototype with an order string of `"a"` will be listed before other prototypes with order string `"b"` or `"c"`. The `"-"` or `"[]"` structures that can be found in vanilla order strings do *not* have any special meaning.

The alphabetical sorting uses [lexicographical comparison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lexicographic_order) to determine if a given prototype is shown before or after another. If the order strings are equal then the game falls back to comparing the prototype names to determine order.
examples:
```
{  -- This item will be shown after the below one
  type = "item",
  name = "item-1",
  order = "ad",
},
{  -- This item will be shown before the above one
  type = "item",
  name = "item-2",
  order = "ab",
}
```

```
-- The order of special characters can be identified by looking at a UTF-8 character list.
-- This is the order some common characters are sorted in:
"-"
"0"
"9"
"A"
"Z"
"["
"]"
"a"
"z"
-- The following order strings would be ordered thusly then:
"a"
"ab"
"azaaa"  -- "b" is sorted before "z", so "ab" comes before "az", regardless of the letters following it
"b"
"b-zzz"
"b[aaa]" -- "[" is sorted after "-" in UTF-8
"bb"  -- "b" is sorted after "[" in UTF-8
]
```

properties.name: fill_volume
properties.description: Unused.

types.name: ParticleID
types.description: The name of a [ParticlePrototype](prototype:ParticlePrototype).

properties.name: cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
properties.description: When looking for path from cache make sure it doesn't end too far from requested end. This is typically higher than accept value for the start because the end target can be moving.

properties.name: cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
properties.description: When looking for path from cache make sure it doesn't start too far from requested start in relative distance terms.

properties.name: cache_max_connect_to_cache_steps_multiplier
properties.description: When searching for connection to path cache path, search at most for this number of steps times the initial estimate.

properties.name: cache_path_end_distance_rating_multiplier
properties.description: When assigning rating to the best path this * end distances is considered. This is typically higher than value for the start to achieve better path end quality.

properties.name: cache_path_start_distance_rating_multiplier
properties.description: When assigning rating to the best path this * start distances is considered.

properties.name: direct_distance_to_consider_short_request
properties.description: This is the "threshold" to decide what is short and what is not.

properties.name: enemy_with_different_destination_collision_penalty
properties.description: Enemy is not moving/or is too close and has different destination.

properties.name: extended_collision_penalty
properties.description: Collision penalty for collisions in the extended bounding box but outside the entity's actual bounding box.

properties.name: fwd2bwd_ratio
properties.description: The pathfinder performs a step of the backward search every `fwd2bwd_ratio`'th step. The minimum allowed value is 2, which means symmetric search.

properties.name: general_entity_collision_penalty
properties.description: Simplification for now; collision with everything else is this.

properties.name: general_entity_subsequent_collision_penalty
properties.description: Collision penalty for successors of positions that require destroy to reach.

properties.name: goal_pressure_ratio
properties.description: When comparing nodes in open which one to check next, heuristic value is multiplied by this ratio. The higher the number the more is the search directed directly towards the goal.

properties.name: ignore_moving_enemy_collision_distance
properties.description: If there is a moving unit further than this we don't really care.

properties.name: long_cache_min_cacheable_distance
properties.description: Minimal distance to goal for path to be searched in long path cache.

properties.name: max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request
properties.description: Up until this amount any client will be served by the path finder (no estimate on the path length).

properties.name: max_clients_to_accept_short_new_request
properties.description: From max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request till this one only those that have a short estimate will be served.

properties.name: max_steps_worked_per_tick
properties.description: When this is exhausted no more requests are allowed, at the moment the first path to exhaust this will be finished (even if it is hundreds of steps).

properties.name: min_steps_to_check_path_find_termination
properties.description: Absolute minimum of steps that will be performed for every path find request no matter what.

properties.name: negative_cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
properties.description: Same as cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio, but used for negative cache queries.

properties.name: negative_cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
properties.description: Same as cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio, but used for negative cache queries.

properties.name: short_cache_min_algo_steps_to_cache
properties.description: Minimal number of algorithm steps for path to be inserted into the short path cache.

properties.name: short_cache_min_cacheable_distance
properties.description: Minimal distance to goal for path to be searched in short path cache.

properties.name: short_cache_size
properties.description: Number of elements in the cache.

properties.name: short_request_max_steps
properties.description: If a short request takes more than this many steps, it will be rescheduled as a long request.

properties.name: short_request_ratio
properties.description: How many steps will be allocated to short requests each tick, as a ratio of all available steps per tick.

properties.name: stale_enemy_with_same_destination_collision_penalty
properties.description: Somewhere along the path is stuck enemy we need to avoid. This is mainly to handle situations when units have arrived and are attacking the target then units further in the back will use this and run around the target.

properties.name: start_to_goal_cost_multiplier_to_terminate_path_find
properties.description: If the current actual cost from start is higher than this times estimate of start to goal then path finding is terminated.

properties.name: max_underground_distance
properties.description: `0` means not underground.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Where pipes can connect to this fluidbox regardless the directions of entity.

properties.name: positions
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `position` is not defined.

Where pipes can connect to this fluidbox, depending on the entity direction.

Table must have 4 members, which are 4 explicit positions corresponding to the 4 directions of entity. Positions must correspond to directions going one after another.

properties.name: gas_flow
properties.description: Visualizes the flow of the fluid in the pipe. Drawn when the fluid's temperature is above [FluidPrototype::gas_temperature](prototype:FluidPrototype::gas_temperature).

properties.name: high_temperature_flow
properties.description: Visualizes the flow of the fluid in the pipe. Drawn when `(fluid_temp - fluid_min_temp) / (fluid_max_temp - fluid_min_temp)` is larger than `2/3` and the fluid's temperature is below [FluidPrototype::gas_temperature](prototype:FluidPrototype::gas_temperature).

properties.name: low_temperature_flow
properties.description: Visualizes the flow of the fluid in the pipe. Drawn when `(fluid_temp - fluid_min_temp) / (fluid_max_temp - fluid_min_temp)` is less than or equal to `1/3` and the fluid's temperature is below [FluidPrototype::gas_temperature](prototype:FluidPrototype::gas_temperature).

properties.name: middle_temperature_flow
properties.description: Visualizes the flow of the fluid in the pipe. Drawn when `(fluid_temp - fluid_min_temp) / (fluid_max_temp - fluid_min_temp)` is larger than `1/3` and less than or equal to `2/3` and the fluid's temperature is below [FluidPrototype::gas_temperature](prototype:FluidPrototype::gas_temperature).

types.name: PlayFor
types.description: Defines when controller vibrations should be played.

options.description: Play the vibration only if it was caused by the player. For example when shooting a gun, vibration will play when the character shoots but not when a turret shoots.
Always play the vibration. Useful for example for explosions.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

properties.name: max_distance
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

properties.name: min_distance
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

properties.name: volume_modifier
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

types.name: PollutionSettings
types.description: The pollution settings, the values are for 60 ticks (1 second).

properties.name: ageing
properties.description: Constant modifier a percentage of 1; the pollution eaten by a chunks tiles.

properties.name: diffusion_ratio
properties.description: Amount that is diffused to neighboring chunks.

properties.name: expected_max_per_chunk
properties.description: Anything bigger than this is visualized as this value.

properties.name: min_to_diffuse
properties.description: This much pollution units must be on the chunk to start diffusing.

properties.name: min_to_show_per_chunk
properties.description: Anything lower than this (but > 0) is visualized as this value.

types.name: ProductPrototype
types.description: Defaults to loading products as items.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: projectile_center
properties.description:
When used with `projectile_creation_parameters`, this offsets what the turret's sprite looks at. Setting to `{0,1}` will cause the turret to aim one tile up from the target but the projectile will still aim for the entity. Can be used to give the illusion of height but can also confuse aim logic when set too high.

When used without `projectile_creation_parameters`, this sets the turret's rotation axis.

properties.name: projectile_creation_parameters
properties.description: Used to shoot projectiles from arbitrary points. Used by worms and multi-barreled weapons. Use multiple points with the same angle to cause the turret to shoot from multiple barrels. If not set then the launch positions are calculated using `projectile_center` and `projectile_creation_distance`.

properties.name: projectile_orientation_offset
properties.description: Used to shoot from different sides of the turret. Setting to `0.25` shoots from the right side, `0.5` shoots from the back, and `0.75` shoots from the left. The turret will look at the enemy as normal but the bullet will spawn from the offset position. Can be used to create right-handed weapons.

properties.name: shell_particle
properties.description: Used to show bullet shells/casings being ejected from the gun, see [artillery shell casings](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-345).

properties.name: direction_deviation
properties.description: Maximum deviation of the projectile from source orientation, in +/- (`x radians / 2`). Example: `3.14 radians -> +/- (180° / 2)`, meaning up to 90° deviation in either direction of rotation.

properties.name: projectile
properties.description: Name of a [ProjectilePrototype](prototype:ProjectilePrototype).

properties.name: range_deviation
properties.description: The maximum deviation of the projectile maximum range from `max_range` is `max_range × range_deviation ÷ 2`. This means a deviation of `0.5` will appear as a maximum of `0.25` (25%) deviation of an initial range goal. Post-deviation range may exceed `max_range` or be less than `min_range`.

properties.name: starting_speed
properties.description: Starting speed in tiles per tick.

types.name: PumpConnectorGraphics
types.description: A mapping of arrays of [PumpConnectorGraphicsAnimations](prototype:PumpConnectorGraphicsAnimation) to all 4 directions of the pump connection (to a fluid wagon).
examples:
```
load_animations =
{
west = {
  [1] = {
    standup_base = {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/pump/connector/V-R-135-load-standup-base.png",
      width = 55,
      height = 63,
      line_length =1,
      frame_count =20,
      shift = util.by_pixel(-23.5, -13.5),
      hr_version = {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/pump/connector/hr-V-R-135-load-standup-base.png",
        width = 110,
        height = 126,
        scale = 0.5,
        line_length = 1,
        frame_count = 20,
        shift = util.by_pixel(-23.5, -13.5)
      },
    },
    standup_shadow = {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/pump/connector/V-R-1-load-standup-base-shadow.png",
      width = 79,
      height = 69,
      line_length =1,
      frame_count =20,
      shift = util.by_pixel(-8.5, 8.5),
      hr_version = {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/pump/connector/hr-V-R-1-load-standup-base-shadow.png",
        width = 157,
        height = 136,
        scale = 0.5,
        line_length = 1,
        frame_count = 20,
        shift = util.by_pixel(-8.75, 8.5)
      },
    },
  },
  [2] = {
    standup_base = { ... },
    standup_shadow = { ... },
    connector_shadow = { ... },
  },
  [3] = { ... },
  [4] = { ... },
  [5] = { ... },
  [6] = { ... },
},
north = { ... },
east = { ... },
south = { ... },
}
```

properties.name: east
properties.description: Size of the array must be 6 or more.

properties.name: north
properties.description: Size of the array must be 6 or more.

properties.name: south
properties.description: Size of the array must be 6 or more.

properties.name: west
properties.description: Size of the array must be 6 or more.

types.name: PushBackTriggerEffectItem
types.description:
The push back effect used by the [discharge defense](https://wiki.factorio.com/Discharge_defense).

Aims to push the target entity away from the source entity by the `distance` from the target entity's current position. Searches within double the `distance` from the pushed to position for the nearest non-colliding position for the target entity to be teleported too. If no valid non-colliding position is found or the target is not teleportable, then no push back occurs.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

types.name: RadiusVisualisationSpecification
types.description: Sprite to be shown around the entity when it is selected/held in the cursor.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

types.name: RailPieceLayers
types.description: Used for graphics by [RailPrototype](prototype:RailPrototype) and [RailRemnantsPrototype](prototype:RailRemnantsPrototype).

properties.name: backplates
properties.description: Must have same number of variations as `metals`.

properties.name: metals
properties.description: Must have between 1 and 4 variations.

properties.name: stone_path
properties.description: Must have between 1 and 4 variations.

properties.name: stone_path_background
properties.description: Must have less or equal than 4 variations.

properties.name: ties
properties.description: Must have between 1 and 4 variations.

properties.name: seed
properties.description: Integer used to seed the random generator.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Number that the penalty is applied to.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Number used to seed the random generator.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Number used to seed the random generator.

types.name: RealOrientation
types.description: Specified by a [float](prototype:float) between 0 and 1, including 0 and excluding 1.

types.name: RecipeCategoryID
types.description: The name of a [RecipeCategory](prototype:RecipeCategory).

types.name: RecipeData
types.description: Used when defining a [RecipePrototype](prototype:RecipePrototype) that uses difficulty. For a recipe without difficulty, these same properties are defined on the prototype itself.

properties.name: allow_as_intermediate
properties.description: Whether the recipe can be used as an intermediate recipe in hand-crafting.

properties.name: allow_decomposition
properties.description: Whether this recipe is allowed to be broken down for the recipe tooltip "Total raw" calculations.

properties.name: allow_inserter_overload
properties.description: Whether the recipe is allowed to have the extra inserter overload bonus applied (4 * stack inserter stack size).

properties.name: allow_intermediates
properties.description: Whether the recipe is allowed to use intermediate recipes when hand-crafting.

properties.name: always_show_made_in
properties.description: Whether the "Made in: <Machine>" part of the tool-tip should always be present, and not only when the recipe can't be hand-crafted.

properties.name: always_show_products
properties.description: Whether the products are always shown in the recipe tooltip.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
This can be `false` to disable the recipe at the start of the game, or `true` to leave it enabled.

If a recipe is unlocked via technology, this should be set to `false`.

properties.name: energy_required
properties.description: The amount of time it takes to make this recipe. Must be `> 0.001`. Equals the number of seconds it takes to craft at crafting speed `1`.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Hides the recipe from crafting menus.

properties.name: hide_from_player_crafting
properties.description: Hides the recipe from the player's crafting screen. The recipe will still show up for selection in machines.

properties.name: hide_from_stats
properties.description: Hides the recipe from item/fluid production statistics.

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description:
A table containing ingredient names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually in the IngredientPrototype (see [here](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-256)).

The maximum ingredient amount is 65 535. Can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that needs no ingredients.

Duplicate ingredients, e.g. two entries with the same name, are *not* allowed. In-game, the item ingredients are ordered by [ItemGroup::order_in_recipe](prototype:ItemGroup::order_in_recipe).

properties.name: main_product
properties.description:
For recipes with one or more products: Subgroup, localised_name and icon default to the values of the singular/main product, but can be overwritten by the recipe. Setting the main_product to an empty string (`""`) forces the title in the recipe tooltip to use the recipe's name (not that of the product) and shows the products in the tooltip.

If 1) there are multiple products and this property is nil, 2) this property is set to an empty string (`""`), or 3) there are no products, the recipe will use the localised_name, icon, and subgroup of the recipe. icon and subgroup become non-optional.

properties.name: overload_multiplier
properties.description:
Used to determine how many extra items are put into an assembling machine before it's considered "full enough". See [insertion limits](https://wiki.factorio.com/Inserters#Insertion_limits).

If set to `0`, it instead uses the following formula: `1.166 / (energy_required / the assembler's crafting_speed)`, rounded up, and clamped to be between`2` and `100`. The numbers used in this formula can be changed by the [UtilityConstants](prototype:UtilityConstants) properties `dynamic_recipe_overload_factor`, `minimum_recipe_overload_multiplier`, and `maximum_recipe_overload_multiplier`.

properties.name: result
properties.description:
The item created by this recipe. Must be the name of an [item](prototype:ItemPrototype), such as `"iron-gear-wheel"`.

Only loaded if `results` is not defined.

properties.name: result_count
properties.description:
The number of items created by this recipe.

Only loaded if `results` is not defined.

properties.name: results
properties.description:
A table containing result names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually in the ProductPrototype (see [here](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-256)).

Can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that produces nothing. Duplicate results, e.g. two entries with the same name, are allowed.

properties.name: show_amount_in_title
properties.description: Whether the recipe name should have the product amount in front of it. E.g. "2x Transport belt"

properties.name: unlock_results
properties.description: Whether enabling this recipe unlocks its item products to show in selection lists (item filters, logistic requests, etc.).

types.name: RecipeID
types.description: The name of a [RecipePrototype](prototype:RecipePrototype).

types.name: RenderLayer
types.description: The render layer specifies the order of the sprite when rendering, most of the objects have it hardcoded in the source, but some are configurable. The union contains valid values from lowest to highest.

types.name: Resistance
types.description: Resistances to certain types of attacks from enemy, and physical damage. See [Damage](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage).

properties.name: decrease
properties.description: The [flat resistance](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage#Decrease.2C_or_.22flat.22_resistance) to the given damage type. (Higher is better)

properties.name: percent
properties.description: The [percentage resistance](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage#Percentage_resistance) to the given damage type. (Higher is better)

types.name: ResourceCategoryID
types.description: The name of a [ResourceCategory](prototype:ResourceCategory).

properties.name: apply_projection
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: axially_symmetrical
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If `true`, `direction_count` must be greater than `1`.

properties.name: counterclockwise
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: direction_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The sequential animation instance is loaded equal to the entities direction within the `direction_count` setting.

Direction count to [Direction](prototype:Direction) (animation sequence number):

- `1`: North (1)

- `2`: North (1), South (2)

- `4`: North (1), East (2), South (3), West (4)

- `8`: North (1), Northeast (2), East (3), Southeast (4), South (5), Southwest (6), West (7), Northwest (8)

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `layers`, `stripes`, and `filenames` are not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded if both `layers` and `stripes` are not defined.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the animation.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedAnimation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from AnimationParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: middle_orientation
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: orientation_range
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Automatically clamped to be between `0` and `1`.

properties.name: slice
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: still_frame
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: stripes
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

types.name: RotatedAnimation4Way
types.description: A map of rotated animations for all 4 directions of the entity. If this is loaded as a single RotatedAnimation, it applies to all directions.

properties.name: east
properties.description: Defaults to the north animation.

properties.name: south
properties.description: Defaults to the north animation.

properties.name: west
properties.description: Defaults to the east animation.

types.name: RotatedSprite
types.description: Specifies series of sprites used to visualize different rotations of the object.
examples:
```
pictures =
{
  layers =
  {
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/radar/radar.png",
      priority = "low",
      width = 98,
      height = 128,
      apply_projection = false,
      direction_count = 64,
      line_length = 8,
      shift = util.by_pixel(1, -16),
      hr_version =
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/radar/hr-radar.png",
        priority = "low",
        width = 196,
        height = 254,
        apply_projection = false,
        direction_count = 64,
        line_length = 8,
        shift = util.by_pixel(1, -16),
        scale = 0.5
      }
    },
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/radar/radar-shadow.png",
      priority = "low",
      width = 172,
      height = 94,
      apply_projection = false,
      direction_count = 64,
      line_length = 8,
      shift = util.by_pixel(39,3),
      draw_as_shadow = true,
      hr_version =
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/radar/hr-radar-shadow.png",
        priority = "low",
        width = 343,
        height = 186,
        apply_projection = false,
        direction_count = 64,
        line_length = 8,
        shift = util.by_pixel(39.25,3),
        draw_as_shadow = true,
        scale = 0.5
      }
    }
  }
}
```

properties.name: allow_low_quality_rotation
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: apply_projection
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Used to fix the inconsistency of direction of the entity in 3d when rendered and direction on the screen (where the 45 degree angle for projection is used).

properties.name: axially_symmetrical
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

When `true`, the same picture is used for left/right direction, just flipped, which can save half of the space required, but is not usable once the picture contains shadows, etc.

properties.name: back_equals_front
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: counterclockwise
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Set to `true` to indicate sprites in the spritesheet are in counterclockwise order.

properties.name: direction_count
properties.description: Count of direction (frames) specified.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `layers` and `filename` are not defined.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Unused.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the sprite.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedSprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from SpriteParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having more sprites in matrix, to input files with too high width. The game engine limits the width of any input files to 8192px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards. 0 means that all the pictures are in one horizontal line.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: slice
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. As an example, if this is `4`, the sprite will be sliced into a `4x4` grid.

properties.name: slice_x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `slice`, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x-axis.

properties.name: slice_y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `slice`, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y-axis.

properties.name: effect_id
properties.description: The effect ID that will be provided in [on_script_trigger_effect](runtime:on_script_trigger_effect).

properties.name: extra_margin_when_activated
properties.description: Sets `extra_top_margin_when_activated`, `extra_bottom_margin_when_activated`, `extra_left_margin_when_activated` and `extra_right_margin_when_activated`.

properties.name: extra_padding_when_activated
properties.description: Sets `extra_top_padding_when_activated`, `extra_bottom_padding_when_activated`, `extra_left_padding_when_activated` and `extra_right_padding_when_activated`.

types.name: SelectionModeFlags
types.description: An array containing the following values.

options.description: Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for a blueprint.
Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for deconstruction.
Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for deconstruction cancellation.
Selects entities which are considered [a building](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::is_building), plus landmines.
Selects no entities or tiles, but is useful to select an area.
Selects entities and tiles that can be built by an item.
Selects entities with the same force as the selecting player.
Selects entities with a different force as the selecting player.
Selects entities from a friendly force.
Selects entities from an enemy force.
Selects entities as if selecting them for upgrading.
Selects entities as if selecting them for upgrade cancellation.
Selects entities as if selecting them for downgrading.
Selects entities that are not a [RollingStockPrototype](prototype:RollingStockPrototype).

properties.name: triggers
properties.description: List of triggers to fulfill.

types.name: Settings
types.description: A struct that provides access to the user-set values of startup [mod settings](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Mod_settings).
examples:
```
-- Accessing the value of a mod setting
local val = settings.startup["my-mod-setting-name"].value
```

properties.name: startup
properties.description: All startup mod settings, indexed by the name of the setting.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the signal that shows this color.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the signal that shows this color.

properties.name: modifier
properties.description: Modification value, which will be added to the variable it modifies.

types.name: SimulationDefinition
types.description:
Used by tips and tricks and main menu simulations.

There are a few simulation-only APIs:

```
game.create_test_player{name=string}
game.activate_rail_planner{position=position,ghost_mode=bool}
game.deactivate_rail_planner()
game.move_cursor{position=position,speed=number}  -- should be called every tick; returns true when target is reached
game.activate_selection()
game.finish_selection()
game.deactivate_selection()
game.scroll_clipboard_forwards()
game.scroll_clipboard_backwards()
game.camera_player_cursor_position [RW]
game.camera_position [RW]
game.camera_zoom [W]
game.camera_player [W]
game.camera_player_cursor_direction [W]
game.camera_alt_info [W]
game.smart_belt_building [W]
player.drag_start_position [W]
player.raw_build_from_cursor{ghost_mode=bool,created_by_moving=bool,position=position}
surface.create_entities_from_blueprint_string{string=string,position=position,force=force,direction=defines.direction,flip_horizonal=bool,flip_vertical=bool,by_player=player}
```

properties.name: checkboard
properties.description: If this is true, the map of the simulation is set to be a lab-tile checkerboard in the area of `{{-20, -15},{20, 15}}` when the scenario is first initialized (before init/init_file run).

properties.name: generate_map
properties.description: If `save` is not given and this is true, a map gets generated by the game for use in the simulation.

properties.name: init
properties.description:
Only loaded if `init_file` is not defined.

This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation when it is first initialized. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: init_file
properties.description: This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation when it is first initialized. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: init_update_count
properties.description: Amount of ticks that this simulation should run for before the simulation is shown to the player. These updates happen after init/init_file has been run and at the highest possible rate (> 60 UPS).

properties.name: length
properties.description: How long this simulation takes. In the main menu simulations, another simulation will start after this simulation ends.

properties.name: override_volume
properties.description: If true, overrides the simulation volume set by the player in the sound settings, simply setting the volume modifier to `1`.

properties.name: save
properties.description: The save file that is used for this simulation. If not given and `generate_map` is `true`, a map is generated by the game.

properties.name: update
properties.description:
Only loaded if `update_file` is not defined.

This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation every time the simulation is updated. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: update_file
properties.description: This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation every time the simulation is updated. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: volume_modifier
properties.description: Multiplier for the simulation volume set by the player in the sound settings.

types.name: SmokeSource
types.description: Definition of the smoke of an entity.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: Can't be negative, NaN or infinite.

properties.name: vertical_speed_slowdown
properties.description: A value between `0` and `1`.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Modifies how far a sound can be heard. Must be between `0` and `1` inclusive.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Supported sound file formats are `.ogg (Vorbis)` and `.wav`.

Only loaded, and mandatory if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= min_speed`.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined. Only loaded, and mandatory if `min_speed` is defined.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= 1 / 64`.

Only loaded if both `variations` and `speed` are not defined.

properties.name: preload
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
Speed must be `>= 1 / 64`. This sets both min and max speeds.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Supported sound file formats are `.ogg (Vorbis)` and `.wav`.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory, if `min_speed` is defined.

Must be `>= min_speed`.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description:
Only loaded if `speed` is not defined.

Must be `>= 1 / 64`.

properties.name: speed
properties.description: Speed must be `>= 1 / 64`. This sets both min and max speeds.

types.name: SoundType
types.description: This defines which slider in the sound settings affects the volume of this sound. Furthermore, some sound types are mixed differently than others, e.g. zoom level effects are applied.

types.name: SpawnPoint
types.description:
The definition of a evolution and probability weights for a [spawnable unit](prototype:UnitSpawnDefinition) for a [EnemySpawnerPrototype](prototype:EnemySpawnerPrototype).

It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both. If this is specified as a table with numbered keys then the first value is the evolution factor and the second is the spawn weight.

properties.name: spawn_weight
properties.description: Must be `>= 0`.

types.name: SpiderEnginePrototype
types.description: Used by [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: military_target
properties.description: The string content is irrelevant, if it is present at all then the [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype) is considered to have [EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target) set to true. This gets enemies interested in attacking the spider vehicle even when nobody is in it.

types.name: SpiderLegSpecification
types.description: Used by [SpiderEnginePrototype](prototype:SpiderEnginePrototype) for [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: blocking_legs
properties.description: The 1-based indices of the legs that should block this leg's movement.

properties.name: leg
properties.description: Name of a [SpiderLegPrototype](prototype:SpiderLegPrototype).

properties.name: leg_hit_the_ground_trigger
properties.description: For triggers, the source and target is the leg entity. Certain effects may not raise as desired, e.g. `"push-back"` does nothing, and `"script"` has `leg` as the source and target of the event.

types.name: SpiderVehicleGraphicsSet
types.description: Used to specify the graphics for [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: eye_light
properties.description: Placed in multiple positions, as determined by `light_positions`.

properties.name: light_positions
properties.description: Defines where each `eye_light` is placed. One array per eye and each of those arrays should contain one position per body direction.

properties.name: candidate_point_count
properties.description: Integer. How many candidate points to generate.

properties.name: candidate_spot_count
properties.description: Integer. An alternative to `candidate_point_count`: number of spots to generate: `candidate_spot_count = X` is equivalent to `candidate_point_count / skip_span = X`

properties.name: density_expression
properties.description: A numeric expression that will be evaluated for each candidate spot to calculate density at that point.

properties.name: hard_region_target_quantity
properties.description: Whether to place a hard limit on the total quantity in each region by reducing the size of any spot (which will be the last spot chosen) that would put it over the limit.

properties.name: region_size
properties.description: Integer. The width and height of each region.

properties.name: seed0
properties.description: Integer. First random seed, usually the map seed is used.

properties.name: seed1
properties.description: Integer. Second random seed, usually chosen to identify the noise layer.

properties.name: skip_offset
properties.description: Integer. Offset of the first candidate point to use.

properties.name: skip_span
properties.description: Integer. Number of candidate points to skip over after each one used as a spot, including the used one.

properties.name: spot_favorability_expression
properties.description: A numeric expression that will be evaluated for each candidate spot to calculate the spot's favorability. Spots with higher favorability will be considered first when building the final list of spots for a region.

properties.name: spot_quantity_expression
properties.description: A numeric expression that will be evaluated for each candidate spot to calculate the spot's quantity.

properties.name: spot_radius_expression
properties.description: A numeric expression that will be evaluated for each candidate spot to calculate the spot's radius. This, together with quantity, will determine the spots peak value.

properties.name: suggested_minimum_candidate_point_spacing
properties.description: The minimum spacing to *try* to achieve while randomly picking points. Spot noise may end up placing spots closer than this in crowded regions.

types.name: Sprite
types.description:
Specifies one picture that can be used in the game.

When there is more than one sprite or [Animation](prototype:Animation) frame with the same source file and dimensions/position in the game, they all share the same memory.
examples:
```
-- simple sprite
picture_set_enemy =
{
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/land-mine/land-mine-set-enemy.png",
  priority = "medium",
  width = 32,
  height = 32
}
```

```
-- sprite with hr version
picture =
{
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/wooden-chest.png",
  priority = "extra-high",
  width = 32,
  height = 36,
  shift = util.by_pixel(0.5, -2),
  hr_version =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/hr-wooden-chest.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 62,
    height = 72,
    shift = util.by_pixel(0.5, -2),
    scale = 0.5
  }
}
```

```
-- sprite with layers and hr version
picture =
{
  layers =
  {
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/wooden-chest.png",
      priority = "extra-high",
      width = 32,
      height = 36,
      shift = util.by_pixel(0.5, -2),
      hr_version =
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/hr-wooden-chest.png",
        priority = "extra-high",
        width = 62,
        height = 72,
        shift = util.by_pixel(0.5, -2),
        scale = 0.5
      }
    },
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/wooden-chest-shadow.png",
      priority = "extra-high",
      width = 52,
      height = 20,
      shift = util.by_pixel(10, 6.5),
      draw_as_shadow = true,
      hr_version =
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/hr-wooden-chest-shadow.png",
        priority = "extra-high",
        width = 104,
        height = 40,
        shift = util.by_pixel(10, 6.5),
        draw_as_shadow = true,
        scale = 0.5
      }
    }
  }
}
```

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `layers` is not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the Sprite.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Sprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from SpriteParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: slice
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. As an example, if this is `4`, the sprite will be sliced into a `4x4` grid.

properties.name: slice_x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `slice`, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x-axis.

properties.name: slice_y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `slice`, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y-axis.

types.name: Sprite4Way
types.description: A map of sprites for all 4 directions of the entity. If this is loaded as a single Sprite, it applies to all directions.

properties.name: east
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: north
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: sheet
properties.description: Only loaded if `sheets` is not defined.

properties.name: south
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: west
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

types.name: Sprite8Way
types.description: A map of sprites for all 8 directions of the entity.

properties.name: east
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: north
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: north_east
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: north_west
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: sheet
properties.description: Only loaded if `sheets` is not defined.

properties.name: south
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: south_east
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: south_west
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

properties.name: west
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `sheets` and `sheet` are not defined.

types.name: SpriteFlags
types.description: An array containing the following values.

options.description: The sprite won't be automatically cropped.
This flag will internally set these flags: `"group=none"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"no-crop"`, `"no-scale"`, `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"not-compressed"`, `"group=icon"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"no-crop"`, `"no-scale"`, `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"not-compressed"`, `"group=gui"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"no-crop"`, `"no-scale"`, `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"not-compressed"`, `"group=icon"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"group=none"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"linear-minifaction"`, `"no-crop"`, `"group=terrain"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"linear-minifaction"`, `"no-crop"`, `"terrain-effect-map"` (internal group flag)
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"group=smoke"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"group=decal"`
Deprecated flag that does nothing but is kept to prevent "unknown sprite flag" errors.

types.name: SpriteNWaySheet
examples:
```
sheet =
{
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/burner-inserter/burner-inserter-platform.png",
  priority = "extra-high",
  width = 46,
  height = 46,
  shift = {0.09375, 0},
  hr_version =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/burner-inserter/hr-burner-inserter-platform.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 105,
    height = 79,
    shift = util.by_pixel(1.5, 7.5-1),
    scale = 0.5
  }
}
```

properties.name: frames
properties.description: Specifies how many of the directions of the SpriteNWay are filled up with this sheet.
properties.default: 4 if used in Sprite4Way, 8 if used in Sprite8Way

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the Sheet.

properties.name: draw_as_glow
properties.description:
Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_light`.

Draws first as a normal sprite, then again as a light layer. See [https://forums.factorio.com/91682](https://forums.factorio.com/91682).

properties.name: draw_as_light
properties.description: Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true.

properties.name: draw_as_shadow
properties.description: Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light`.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description:
This property is only used by sprites used in [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) that have the `"icon"` flag set.

If this is set to `true`, the game will generate an icon shadow (using signed distance fields) for the sprite.

images.caption: Example of the icon shadow in the character modifier icon used by the steel axe research

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error ([Example](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/340530709712076801/532315796626472972/unknown.png)). Modders can ignore this property.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon, that is it has the flag `"group=icon"` or `"group=gui"`.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when `x` and `y` are both `0`. The first member of the tuple is `x` and the second is `y`.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be pre-multiplied.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values other than `1` specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. A scale of `2` means that the picture will be two times bigger on screen (and thus more pixelated).

properties.name: shift
properties.description: The shift in tiles. `util.by_pixel()` can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The width and height of the sprite. If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height. Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

types.name: SpritePriority
types.description: This sets the "caching priority" of a sprite, so deciding priority of it being included in VRAM instead of streaming it and is therefore a purely technical value. See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=437380#p437380) and [here](https://www.factorio.com/blog/post/fff-264). The possible values are listed below.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, this is used to load the SpriteSheet.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all SpriteSheet definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from SpriteParameters, are ignored.

types.name: SpriteVariations
examples:
```
-- sprite sheet using "sheet"
connection_patches_connected =
{
  sheet =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/nuclear-reactor/reactor-connect-patches.png",
    width = 32,
    height = 32,
    variation_count = 12,
    hr_version =
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/nuclear-reactor/hr-reactor-connect-patches.png",
      width = 64,
      height = 64,
      variation_count = 12,
      scale = 0.5
    }
  }
}
```

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: force_unit_fuzzy_goto_behavior
properties.description: Used only for special "to look good" purposes (like in trailer).

properties.name: radius
properties.description: Not including the radius of the unit.

properties.name: fluids
properties.description: Controls which fluids can fuel this stream attack and their potential damage bonuses.

properties.name: stream
properties.description: Name of a [FluidStreamPrototype](prototype:FluidStreamPrototype).

types.name: StretchRule
types.description: Sets whether a GUI element can be stretched or squashed.

options.description: Stretching/squashing is disabled even when the container contains stretchable/squashable elements.
Stretching/squashing depends on the contents of the layout, for example a flow with stretchable element gets stretchable.

Used only for stretchable (not squashable) properties on scroll panes, labels, check boxes and radio buttons. The element this is set on expands its size to maximum and is stretched at the same time. This means the element takes up its maximum size even before its contents require it.

types.name: Stripe
types.description: Used as an alternative way to specify animations.

properties.name: height_in_frames
properties.description:
Mandatory when Stripe is used in [Animation](prototype:Animation).
