Optional when it is used in [RotatedAnimation](prototype:RotatedAnimation), where it defaults to [RotatedAnimation::direction_count](prototype:RotatedAnimation::direction_count).

types.name: StyleSpecification
types.description: Loaded as one of the [BaseStyleSpecification](prototype:BaseStyleSpecification) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

properties.name: badge_font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: cell_padding
properties.description: Sets `top_cell_padding`, `right_cell_padding`, `bottom_cell_padding` and `left_cell_padding` to the same value.

types.name: TechnologyData
types.description: Used when defining a [TechnologyPrototype](prototype:TechnologyPrototype) that uses difficulty. For a technology without difficulty, these same properties are defined on the prototype itself.

properties.name: effects
properties.description: List of effects of the technology (applied when the technology is researched).

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Hides the technology from the tech screen.

properties.name: ignore_tech_cost_multiplier
properties.description: Controls whether the technology cost ignores the tech cost multiplier set in the [DifficultySettings](runtime:DifficultySettings). E.g. `4` for the default expensive difficulty.

properties.name: max_level
properties.description:
`"infinite"` for infinite technologies, otherwise `uint32`.

Defaults to the same level as the technology, which is `0` for non-upgrades, and the level of the upgrade for upgrades.

properties.name: prerequisites
properties.description: List of technologies needed to be researched before this one can be researched.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: Determines the cost in items and time of the technology.

properties.name: upgrade
properties.description: When set to true, and the technology contains several levels, only the relevant one is displayed in the technology screen.

properties.name: visible_when_disabled
properties.description: Controls whether the technology is shown in the tech GUI when it is not `enabled`.

types.name: TechnologyID
types.description: The name of a [TechnologyPrototype](prototype:TechnologyPrototype).

properties.name: level_font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: level_range_font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

types.name: TechnologyUnit
types.description: Either `count` or `count_formula` must be defined, never both.

properties.name: count
properties.description: How many units are needed. Must be `> 0`.

properties.name: count_formula
properties.description:
Formula that specifies how many units are needed per level of the technology.

If the last characters of the prototype name are `-<number>`, the level is taken to be the number, e.g. `physical-projectile-damage-2` implies a number of `2`. This defaults to `1`. There does not need to be lower-level technologies for a technology to be detected as having a level, meaning a technology or sequence of upgrade technologies can begin at any number.

For an infinite technology, the level begins at the given suffix (or `1` by default) and gains 1 level upon being researched, or if the `max_level` is reached, marked as completed. The initial level of a technology can not be greater than its `max_level`.

The formula is executed following the BODMAS order (also known as PEMDAS). It supports these operators and characters:

- `+`: Addition

- `-`: Subtraction

- `*`: Multiplication

- `^`: Exponentiation

- `()`: Brackets for order of operations; supports nested brackets

- `l` or `L`: The current level of the technology

- Digits: Treated as numbers

- `.`: Decimal point in numbers

- `SPACE`: Spaces are ignored

Note that this formula can also be used at [runtime](runtime:LuaGameScript::evaluate_expression).

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description: List of ingredients needed for one unit of research. The items must all be [ToolPrototypes](prototype:ToolPrototype).

properties.name: time
properties.description: How much time one unit takes to research. In a lab with a crafting speed of `1`, it corresponds to the number of seconds.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

types.name: TileID
types.description: The name of a [TilePrototype](prototype:TilePrototype).

types.name: TileIDRestriction
types.description: Name of an allowed tile, or a list of two tile names for entities allowed on transitions.

types.name: TileSprite
types.description: Used by [TilePrototype](prototype:TilePrototype).

properties.name: count
properties.description: Frame count.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the tile sprite.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having longer animations in matrix, to input files with too high width. The game engine limits the width of any input files to 8192px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards. 0 means that all the pictures are in one horizontal line.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Probability of 1x1 (size = 1) version of tile must be 1.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Only powers of 2 from 1 to 128 can be used. Square size of the tile arrangement this sprite is used for. Used to calculate the `width` and `height` of the sprite which cannot be set directly. (width or height) = size * 32 / scale.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Frame count.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the tile transition sprite.

properties.name: tall
properties.description: If this is true, the shift of the tile transition sprite is set to `{0, 0.5}`.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

types.name: TileTransitions
types.description: Used for [TilePrototype](prototype:TilePrototype) graphics.

properties.name: inner_corner
properties.description: This or inner_corner_mask needs to be specified if `empty_transitions` is not true.

properties.name: inner_corner_mask
properties.description: This or inner_corner needs to be specified if `empty_transitions` is not true.

properties.name: outer_corner
properties.description: This or outer_corner_mask needs to be specified if `empty_transitions` is not true.

properties.name: outer_corner_mask
properties.description: This or outer_corner needs to be specified if `empty_transitions` is not true.

properties.name: side
properties.description: This or side_mask needs to be specified if `empty_transitions` is not true.

properties.name: side_mask
properties.description: This or side needs to be specified if `empty_transitions` is not true.

properties.name: material_background
properties.description: Width and height are given by the game, setting them will not have an effect. Width and height are calculated from the expected size (32) and the scale. So, for HR tiles at a size of 64x64, the scale needs to be 0.5.

types.name: TipStatus
types.description: This is used by [TipsAndTricksItem](prototype:TipsAndTricksItem) for the initial starting status. One of the following values:

options.description: The [trigger](prototype:TipsAndTricksItem::trigger) for the tip was already met, but the tip is still hidden because of dependencies.
Not suggested by trigger yet, but visible in the window. This is also the state that tips are left in when the /unlock-tips command is used in-game.
The dependencies and triggers are met, the game suggests the tip.
The tip is considered completed, shows the check mark in the GUI.
The tip is considered completed, shows the check mark in the GUI.

types.name: TipTrigger
types.description: Loaded as one of the tip triggers, based on the value of the `type` key.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: train_waiting_at_signal_tick_multiplier_penalty
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

types.name: TransportBeltConnectorFrame
types.description: Used to define the graphics for the (in vanilla) yellow frame that is used when a [TransportBeltPrototype](prototype:TransportBeltPrototype) is connected to the circuit network.

properties.name: disable_shadow_distortion_beginning_at_frame
properties.description: Only loaded if `shadow` is present. Defaults to `shadow.frame_count - 1`.

properties.name: normal
properties.description: Normal must have the same frame_count as `leaves`.

properties.name: overlay
properties.description: Overlay must have the same frame_count as `leaves`. Won't be tinted by the tree color unless `apply_runtime_tint` is set to `true` in the sprite definition. See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=547758#p547758).

properties.name: shadow
properties.description: Shadow must have 1 less `frame_count` than `leaves`.

properties.name: trunk
properties.description: If `shadow` is not specified, this has to have one more frame than `leaves`.

types.name: Trigger

types.name: TriggerDelivery

types.description: The abstract base of all [TriggerDeliveries](prototype:TriggerDelivery).

properties.name: source_effects
properties.description: Provides the source of the TriggerDelivery as as both the source and target of the effect.

types.name: TriggerEffect
types.description: Loaded as one of the [TriggerEffectItem](prototype:TriggerEffectItem) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: TriggerEffectItem
types.description: The abstract base of all [TriggerEffects](prototype:TriggerEffect).

properties.name: damage_type_filters

Unknown if it works with other properties that use [TriggerEffect](prototype:TriggerEffect).

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Must be greater than `0` and less than or equal to `1`.

types.name: TriggerItem
types.description: The abstract base of all [Triggers](prototype:Trigger).

properties.name: collision_mask

properties.name: force

properties.name: trigger_target_mask
properties.description: The trigger affects only prototypes with these masks.

types.name: TriggerTargetMask
types.description: An array of names of [TriggerTargetType](prototype:TriggerTargetType). See [Design discussion: Trigger target type](https://forums.factorio.com/71657) and [Blacklist for prototypes turrets shouldn't attack](https://forums.factorio.com/86164).

types.name: TrivialSmokeID

properties.name: infer_icon

properties.name: modifier
properties.description: Modification value, which will be added to the current turret attack modifier upon researching.

properties.name: turret_id

types.name: UnitAISettings
types.description: Used by [UnitPrototype](prototype:UnitPrototype).

properties.name: allow_try_return_to_spawner
properties.description: If enabled, units that have nothing else to do will attempt to return to a spawner.

properties.name: destroy_when_commands_fail
properties.description: If enabled, units that repeatedly fail to succeed at commands will be destroyed.

properties.name: do_separation
properties.description: If enabled, units will try to separate themselves from nearby friendly units.

properties.name: path_resolution_modifier
properties.description: Must be between -8 and 8.

properties.name: attacking_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: back_to_walk_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: cooldown_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: prepared_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: warmup2_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: warmup_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: max_gathering_unit_groups
properties.description: Maximum number of automatically created unit groups gathering for attack at any time.

properties.name: max_group_member_fallback_factor
properties.description: If a member falls behind more than this times the group radius, the group will slow down to max_group_slowdown_factor.

properties.name: max_group_radius
properties.description: Limits for group radius (calculated by number of numbers).

properties.name: max_group_slowdown_factor
properties.description: When members of a group are behind, the entire group will slow down to at most this factor of its max speed.

properties.name: max_member_slowdown_when_ahead
properties.description: When a member gets ahead of its group, it will slow down to at most this factor of its speed.

properties.name: max_member_speedup_when_behind
properties.description: When a member falls behind the group he can speedup up till this much of his regular speed.

properties.name: max_unit_group_size
properties.description: Maximum size of an attack unit group. This only affects automatically-created unit groups; manual groups created through the API are unaffected.

properties.name: max_wait_time_for_late_members
properties.description: After the gathering is finished the group can still wait for late members, but it doesn't accept new ones anymore.

properties.name: member_disown_distance
properties.description: If a member falls behind more than this time the group radius, it will be removed from the group.

properties.name: min_group_gathering_time
properties.description: Pollution triggered group waiting time is a random time between min and max gathering time

types.name: UnitSpawnDefinition
types.description: It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both. If this is specified as a table with numbered keys then the first value is the unit and the second is the spawn points.

properties.name: spawn_points
properties.description:
Array of evolution and probability info, with the following conditions:

- The `evolution_factor` must be ascending from entry to entry.

- The last entry's weight will be used when the `evolution_factor` is larger than the last entry.

- Weights are linearly interpolated between entries.

- Individual weights are scaled linearly so that the cumulative weight is `1`.

properties.name: recipe
properties.description: Prototype name of the [RecipePrototype](prototype:RecipePrototype) that is unlocked upon researching.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

types.name: Vector
types.description: A vector is a two-element array or dictionary containing the x and y components. Positive x goes east, positive y goes south.

types.name: Vector3D
types.description: If this is specified as a three-element array then the array items are x, y and z, in that order.

properties.name: frames
properties.description: The size of all `frames` must be the same.

types.name: VirtualSignalID
types.description: The name of a [VirtualSignalPrototype](prototype:VirtualSignalPrototype).

types.name: VoidEnergySource

types.name: WaterReflectionDefinition

types.name: WireConnectionPoint

types.name: WorkingSound
types.description: This type is used to produce sound from in-game entities when they are working/idle.
examples:
```
-- refinery
working_sound =
{
  sound = { filename = "__base__/sound/oil-refinery.ogg" },
  idle_sound = { filename = "__base__/sound/idle1.ogg", volume = 0.6 },
  apparent_volume = 2.5,
}
```

```
-- roboport
working_sound =
{
  sound = { filename = "__base__/sound/roboport-working.ogg", volume = 0.6 },
  max_sounds_per_type = 3,
  audible_distance_modifier = 0.5,
  probability = 1 / (5 * 60) -- average pause between the sound is 5 seconds
}
```

properties.name: activate_sound
properties.description: Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Modifies how far a sound can be heard. Can only be 1 or lower, has to be a positive number.

properties.name: deactivate_sound
properties.description: Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

properties.name: fade_in_ticks
properties.description: Can't be used when `match_progress_to_activity` is true.

properties.name: fade_out_ticks
properties.description: Can't be used when `match_progress_to_activity` is true.

properties.name: idle_sound
properties.description: The sound to be played when the entity is idle. Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Modifies how often the sound is played.
examples:
```
probability = 1 / (3 * 60) -- average pause between the sound is 3 seconds
```

properties.name: sound
properties.description: The sound to be played when the entity is working.

types.name: WorkingVisualisation
types.description: Used by crafting machines to display different graphics when the machine is running.

properties.name: apply_recipe_tint
properties.description: Used by [CraftingMachinePrototype](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype).

properties.name: apply_tint
properties.description:
Used by [CraftingMachinePrototype](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype) ("status" only) and [MiningDrillPrototype](prototype:MiningDrillPrototype).

For "status" on CraftingMachine, the colors are specified via [CraftingMachinePrototype::status_colors](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype::status_colors). For "status" on MiningDrill, the colors are specified via [MiningDrillGraphicsSet::status_colors](prototype:MiningDrillGraphicsSet::status_colors). For "resource-color", the colors are specified via [ResourceEntityPrototype::mining_visualisation_tint](prototype:ResourceEntityPrototype::mining_visualisation_tint).

properties.name: constant_speed
properties.description: Whether the animations are always played at the same speed, not adjusted to the machine speed.

properties.name: north_animation

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

properties.name: south_animation
properties.description: Only loaded if `animation` is not defined.

types.name: bool
types.description:
A variable type which can have one of two values: `true` or `false`. Wikipedia has a [comprehensive article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boolean) on Booleans.

Booleans used in prototypes can also be be defined by other variable types which are then coerced to boolean values by the game. This type coercion differs from the [standard Lua truthy/falsy](https://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/manual.html#2.1) coercion.

It is recommended to only use `true` and `false`.

types.name: double
types.description:
Format uses a dot as its decimal delimiter. Doubles are stored in the [double precision](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double-precision_floating-point_format) floating point format.

May not be [NaN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NaN).

types.name: float
types.description:
Format uses a dot as its decimal delimiter. Floats are stored in the [single precision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-precision_floating-point_format) floating point format.

May not be [NaN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NaN).

types.name: int16
types.description: 16 bit signed integer. Ranges from `-32 768` to `32 767`, or `[-2^15, 2^15-1]`.

types.name: int8
types.description: 8 bit signed integer. Ranges from `-128` to `127`, or `[-2^7, 2^7-1]`.

types.name: string
types.description: Strings are enclosed in double-quotes.

types.name: uint16
types.description: 16 bit unsigned integer. Ranges from `0` to `65 535`, or `[0, 2^16-1]`.

types.name: uint32
types.description: 32 bit unsigned integer. Ranges from `0` to `4 294 967 295`, or `[0, 2^32-1]`.

types.name: uint64
types.description: 64 bit unsigned integer.

types.name: uint8
types.description: 8 bit unsigned integer. Ranges from `0` to `255`, or `[0, 2^8-1]`.
